description:
True rating: 4.5
Here's the breakdown:

1. The neighborhood is a little sketchy but the restaurant itself is nicely decorated and spacious

2. The food is tasty but truly depends on what you get. I personally got a soup based dish with fish (I forgot the name :c). It tasted like homemade food back in South Korea, which was great and heart warming. My friend got a vegetarian stir fry which tasted like a typically Chinese/Thai restaurant stir fry. So the taste really depends on what dish you get.

3. The interior is nice. Nicely lit and cozy yet modern. The bathroom is located upstairs where you have to take the stairs to get up there. So not immobile friendly. 

4. The service is okay. They are not rude but I didn't sense the extra effort to be warm and friendly with the customers. It also took a really long time to get the waitress attention at one point. 

5. The prices are reasonable. They are not overly expensive or extremely cheap. I think the prices are fair for what they provide. 

Overall, I would recommend this place to someone who is looking for a place to eat in the area. I don't think this is the 'go-to' spot for someone who is visiting SF, but I would go again. I really did like their soup based dish with fish.
author: Shin L.

description:
This is hands down the best Thai food I've had in SF. I wish I could give 6 stars! I've ordered from this place dozens of times and not once was I let down. It's hard to pick favorites, but I'd absolutely recommend any of their curry dishes (Gang Ga-Ree Gai and Pad Pong-Ga-Ree are especially good), Pad Gra-Praw, the beef jerky, Chan Pad Poo (stick noodles with crab), and taro ball soup for dessert.

Also, kudos for never arriving late or mixing up any of my delivery orders.
author: Carl W.

description:
Ordered take out from here after another place (closer by) could not take our order even though their hours were listed as open until midnight. The Pad Gra-Praw was pretty good, though a bit more vegetable would have been preferred. The spice level was decent, considering I ordered medium spicy, and the vegetable rolls were good. 

The take out receipt showed our name as "at" which was definitely not correct, and had our phone number wrong (so if there was an issue, it would not get fixed). This was bothersome since the employee repeated the name and number back to me. 

Overall it was a good experience and I would try them again.
author: Chris D.

description:
We went here on Pride weekend on a Sunday around 7:10pm. 

Communication: 2/5 stars
A worker inside asked us for our name, wrote it down along with some other people's names for the people around us and quoted us a time of 10-20 min and asked us if we wanted a menu so we could look at it while waiting. After looking at it for a while, my friend and I chose our items and continued to wait a little. I then noticed that another lady worker started asking the people around us for the name of their party. She then came up to us and asked you if we were waiting for our food. I told her no, we were waiting to be seated and the other lady got our names already.

This showed me that there's a clear disconnect between workers because she didn't appear to know that we were waiting to be seated, even though someone already got our names like 15 min ago. She even seated some people that came after us... This kind of irked me since I'm thinking- why did that other lady get our name then?? Luckily, they had a table free so we didn't have to wait any longer...

Food: 4/5 stars
We ordered 3 items. Now, just to get a heads up, I like Thai food, but I'm very weak against spicy food so I tend to get stuff that's not really spicy at all. We decided on three items.

Salad Neur Sun $13: 4/5 stars
Tender beef put on top of a "salad" composed of lettuce, 3 slices of tomato on the side, and raw onions with some type of special sweet salad dressing/glaze. You kind of have to mix up the salad, since parts of the lettuce doesn't have any dressing on it. The beef was very tender, and the glaze in the "salad" was pretty sweet and tasty.

Pad Kee Mao with beef $11: 4/5 stars
Since I'm weak against spice, I asked if we could make this mild spice level and the server said it was OK. This tasted like a spicier version of Pad See Yew. Now, I really like Pad See Yew, so I really liked this dish as well, although their mild spice level is still pretty damn spicy to me. If I were to order this again, I would make sure to say I wanted no spice. However, the beef in this was pretty dry, and was definitely of lower quality than the beef in the above-mentioned salad.

Gang Dang with pork $13 a la carte: 4/5 stars
This is basically like panang curry but the sauce is definitely more watery. I also chose to have mild spice level and this was also a bit too spicy for me. We ordered a side of Jasmine rice for $2, because you can't get curry without rice. They also gave a smaller version over rice for $11, but I wanted the full size. This also tasted yummy, although spicy. The pork was also too dry.

Service: 3.5/5 stars
There was a male server that went around refilling people's water, but when I wanted water due to the spice level, he was nowhere to be seen. The other servers were also a bit less attentive. We called one server for water, but she never came back. When we asked for a check and a box, we got those pretty quickly. We didn't have to wait too long the food to be served. 

I didn't use their restroom so I'm not sure how clean it was...

Would I come again? Yes, if I'm in the neighborhood, but maybe I'll try dishes with tofu or chicken to see if it's better with those options instead...
author: Gilda W.

description:
Located fairly close to where I go to the gym. I was recommended this location by one of the guys at gym since it opens up late.

It's not the best place for thai food but it suffices. I ordered a pork pad thai and something else I forgot. However they both tasted very plain and wasn't really that special overall. Would recommend that they use more sauces to make the flavors better and more unique.

Probably the best thing about this place is that it closes late.
author: Timothy D.

description: Right off the bat, let me say that the service here is delightful. We ordered pineapple fried rice, pad himmaparn, and pad prik king. Really flavorful food! We ordered Roti for dessert, which turned out to be yummy.
author: Prateek J.

description:
Recently tried their delivery option. Food was well-packed, with no leaks. The noodles were a bit drier than when consumed at the restaurant. The fried rice tasted fine. When ordering via Uber Eats, however, the drivers have occasionally asked that you come down to the car as "they can't find parking."

Previous review:
Thought it was a bit touristy from the outside, but the food is actually not too bad. Would steer clear of the soup we ordered that was a bit too sour and sweet for my taste. The rest of the dishes aren't bad. They have some choices for alcoholic beverages.
author: Kimberly H.

description:
Located in the heart of San Francisco, House of Thai bring together the flavors of Thai and the presentation of any local big city dish. 

Atmosphere - Inside there is a normal amount of seating and tables for guests to enjoy their meal. Their bathroom is located up the stairs and is a little bit cramped-- the stairs going up are a little bit small and cramped as well so be sure to take your time. The restaurant space is wide and open which can make the noise level a little high during certain times, but we were still able to enjoy our meal and conversation regardless of the noise around us. 

  Food - I had the Pad Thai (Pictured) and it was delicious! I love the Thai peanut sauce they use along with the pan-fried rice, stick noodles with shrimps, egg, fresh tofu, green onions, beans, sprouts, and ground peanuts. All in all it made for an amazing Pad Thai dish and not too spicy because I got moderate. 

Service - I would've given this place a 4/5, but their service was very very very slow... We were sitting there for a long time before someone actually came and took our order, got us more water, gave us a receipt, or even checked up on how we were doing. The restaurant wasn't even full or busy at the time, they just wanted to take their time in serving us. Most of the time I saw servers just hanging around near the kitchen and talking rather than serving tables. 

It was a good first experience going there, but I don't think I'd want to go back... Too slow of a service for my taste.
author: Cj C.

description:
Came here for my graduation lunch after the ceremony and they were so accommodating for a large party of 14. Open spacious seating with lots of light. It's in a sketchy area but it's safe enough during the daytime. Coordinating for reservations on the phone was an easy task. Was even able to pre-order ahead of time so that the food was quick to come out after we got seated. I would highly recommend this place for large parties/group dinners. 

All the food was delicious with few things I would change. 
Tom yum soup -- more sour than most, but still very good! (4/5)
Calamari -- not skimpy or too oily (5/5)
Pad Thai -- basic Thai food noodle staple. Yes!!!! (5/5)
Pad kee mao -- basic Thai food noodle staple (5/5)
Fried catfish with plum sauce -- unique take and executed well! (4/5)
Steak strips with salad -- (4/5)
Pineapple fried rice -- not the most outstanding but good and filling (4/5)

I'm glad I found this place and would come back if I'm in the area again for some delicious Thai food.
author: Audrey D.

description: Always Thai food is good. The restaurant is not expensive and gorgeous than they apper. I ordered Pad thai and it's delicious though vegetables are solid than I expected. But I like the taste.
author: Keisuke W.

description: Tasty Thai food in San Francisco near the Orpheum theatre. Good place to catch a bite before a show and then stop by philz nearby for a caffeine fix. Hub and I ordered pad ke mau which is drunken noodles, steak salad, green beans n pork belly and for dessert Roti. Food was fresh and delicious, service was nice as well. A great experience and I didn't feel drowsy afterwards which means little to none msg
author: J S.

description:
What's the perfect meal on a cold day?  Soup.  My friend suggested this place specifically for their noodle soup.  Alright, I'm not even going to bother looking at the menu; you order while I run to the restroom.  Cool.

Tom Yum Noodle Soup - To my surprise, this was a noodle dish and not just a bowl of soup!  The soup alone is worth slurping every last bit.  The noodles were endless. The flavor was phenomenal.  As full as I was, this dish was worth losing a button from my jeans.  Delicious.

Friendly staff, good food
author: Linda N.

description:
I came back for a second time and decided to get the #61 tom yum noodle soup. My friend got that last time, so I wanted to experience the goodness for myself. 

It looks like I always end up liking the dish my eating buddy orders. My friend got the #57 sukiyaki stir fry noodles, and it was DELICIOUS! She couldn't talk for about 10 minutes because she was having an out-of-world-when-Harry-met-Sally-esque experience. That sesame-bean curd sauce is something else. Wow. 

HOT is legit. I will come back here again and again.
author: Joanna L.

description:
We really wanted Thai food and found this place on Yelp. We ordered the Tom Kha Chicken (spicy coconut milk soup with lemongrass, galangal, Kaffir lime leaves, and mushrooms) and Pad Thai with beef. We also ordered Thai tea.

The Thai tea here is solid in taste. Enough sweetness and flavor of the Thai leaves.

The Pad Thai is flavorful and portions are fine. I've had plenty of similar pad thai elsewhere so didn't think it was special.

The soup was definitely sour enough but was missing the spicy element. My biggest problem is with the overcooked chicken. It was tough and bland. I think this place has solid food.
author: Cindy N.

description: I was excited when I came to try this place out, after receiving the food I was less than happy with my decision to eat here, I ordered curry that tasted watered down and was cold. My boyfriend ordered the pad Thai that was not very good at all. Overall this place was less than I expected. Gave extra star for service. It's sad because I live less than a block away. Still won't be coming back.
author: Angelique L.

description:
Best thing about this place is that it is open late for San Francisco. The service is a bit slow and not attentive. The restaurant is clean. The food is average.

We ordered the Tom Yum soup and the Pad Thai. 

I would not go back there unless I was starving at 10PM in SF.
author: Joe L.

description: The best Thai spot in the city and most authentic of the ones I've eaten. It's a little pricey but so is most Thai food. The staff is friendly enough I think!
author: Desiree B.

description: Stumbled upon this place when we were in the area. The restaurant we originally wanted to go to was closed, but this was right across the street so it turned out to be an happy accident since we had a good experience. We ordered tofu pad thai, pork pad gra-praw, and gang dang. The pad thai was the favorite of everybody. It was saucey which was how I like it. Ask for a spice rack if you don't think it's spicy enough. The pad gra-praw was a good level of spice however I wished there was more vegetables. We finished the rice that came with it pretty quickly so it was difficult just eating that pork all on its own. The gang dang (red curry) was delicious as well. Portions were reasonable, prices felt a bit more expensive than your average thai restaurant but it made sense considering this is in the heart of SF. This was a good way to end our SF trip and definitely satisfied our thai cravings.
author: Alina H.

description:
My friends and I ended up having food here for lunch and I thought it was mostly okay. The place itself is very nice looking and clean, and for the price it was a pretty nice overall environment.

I got the Khao Soi and it wasn't as good as I had hoped it would be. The "crispy" noodles on top felt more like just broken up dried noodles poured on top, and the noodles were a bit overcooked a kind of soggy in areas. The curry wasn't that flavorful and overall it wasn't amazing.

That being said, the dish itself wasn't terrible and was enjoyable to eat, so in ways it is quite acceptable.
author: Tyler T.

description:
This is for takeout only. We ordered pad kee mao, eggplant with chicken, and basil chicken. The flavor was good, but it didn't stand out from other Thai places in the area. My wife is a spice warrior, and even she thought the "medium" spicy was hot. The portions are small, especially if you order with rice on the side. There were barely any noodles in the pad kee mao - more tofu and veggies than noodle, and the eggplant was good, but again, skimpy on the portion size. Maybe this is because we ordered to go? 

This place satisfied our Thai craving, but I doubt I'll dine in or takeout again. There are so many better places, but we wanted to try something new. 

3 stars for the price and the spice, minus 2 for the skimpy portions and lack of noodles.
author: Ashley S.

description:
My go-to Thai lunch spot in the TL. 

I've tried quite a few Thai restaurants near my work in the neighborhood but House of Thai is my fave! 

It is very clean and serves authentic and delish Thai dishes. Service is also on point. Even the dragon mural outside the restaurant is cool. What's not to love?! 

I'm a big fan of their crab pad Thai. It's my default order. I've also tried their papaya salad, pork leg stew over rice, and Thai iced tea. Everything is tasty! The crab fried rice is on my list to try next. 

I know I can always count on House of Thai for an excellent Thai meal. Now guess who's the duchess here?!
author: Angela F. W.

description:
It's not a cooking I like. Because for me it's too spicy and you can't be able to distinguish anything after eating 3 spoons or 3 forks. I was just settled in this area for a week and I found this restaurant for eating a soup after a day rain. 
I ordered a soup and it was with two ingredients they often use in Thai cooking : coconut milk and pepper.
However, it was warm for me and I took away for tomorrow.
Great place and personals were kind, generous and talkative.
author: Marie-Claire L.

description:
OMG this place . Please try their Tom Kha Kai and their surprisingly good Mojitos .
Coming back here
author: Martin M.

description: Been coming here for almost 20 years and it has consistently been amazing!  Low key, down to earth good grub is what you'll get here.  My fave is their silver noodle soup.
author: D. S.

description:
Great food. We had no expectations. Since we were in the area, went in after quickly looking at yelp reviews, but this place was hands down serves easily one of the best thai food in the bay area. You can order without fish sauce for example, they make it very easy and friendly for vegetarians who don't eat egg or fish, besides meat.

Taro ball in coconut milk was awesome.

They are very busy and open late. Its not super fancy in terms of ambience but certainly superb food.

Definitely a destination in SF if you are looking for a great Thai food.
author: S N.

description: Food presentation was great, I ordered the shrimp pad Thai which was very good. It had the right amount of heat. I ordered the fresh spring rolls as an appetizer. It tasted a bit like sushi but with a tangy taste due to the sauce they placed around it. It wasn't too bad but nothing worth raving about. Service was not to bad, food came out at a decent time and staff was attentive
author: Natalie N.

description: Came here at 11pm, easy parking, seated fast, good service, clean everything, delicious food, spacious
author: Fiona B.

description:
Arrived here pretty late after just getting into town and we were starving.
Got some drinks and pad Thai, nothing too adventurous. The service was quick and attentive. Good thai spot...
author: David C.

description: Wow!! Came here for a weekend, it was around the block from out awesome hotel. Literally one of the best Thai experiences I've ever had. The pumpkin curry is outrageous these little golden nuggets were amazing
author: Randy B.

description:
TLDR - Not a top pick for Thai food, unless you're into overly sweet flavors

I ordered delivery through UberEats so this review is for delivery only. Food was very average. Maybe below average actually. If you're a fan of sweeter palates for Thai food, House of Thai might be up your alley. A lot of Thai spots I've been to tend to be on the sweet side, but I found both dishes that I ordered here to be overly sweet and couldn't even compare to the authentic food I've had in Thailand.

* SOM TOM PU ($10) - 3/5
[salted crab, shredded green papaya, green bean, tomatoes, garlic, fresh chili, lime dressing]
A lot of people judge Thai restaurants based on pad thai, but I like to use papaya salad as a basis for comparison. Theirs was way too sweet for me and was missing the complex flavors I like in papaya salads. No acidity and not that spicy. The only saltiness came from the salted crab. I usually get papaya salad with shrimp but decided to try the crab version, and I think I'd stay with the shrimp version in the future. I wasn't really fond of the crab so I ended up not eating it. 

* KA MOO ($11) - 3.5/5
[pork leg stew, served w/ spicy secret sauce, jasmine rice]
Seeing ka moo on the menu reminded me of an amazing plate of pork leg stew I had in Thailand a few years ago and made me crave it again, especially since I don't see it a lot at Thai restaurants. Like the papaya salad, their ka moo was on the sweet side, but the pickled mustard greens gave it some tangy flavor. The pork was a little dry/overcooked in some parts and it was probably half meat, half skin/fat. The rice is definitely needed to soak up all the fat.
author: Jessie L.

description: I love the food at this place. Good quantity and presentation. I will also say that the food delivery time is always faster than what the Yelp estimates. I recommend the Pumpkin Curry with brown rice!!
author: Roberto G.

description:
I'm quite surprised by the bad/ok reviews on this restaurant. This place is absolute the best Thai food I have ever had in the Bay Area. My family is from Laos and Thailand so I'm pretty used to that authentic Thai taste and I'll say that House of Thai absolutely nails it in authenticity.  I have been here about 5-6 Times now and I have never been disappointed. 

You cannot go wrong when you order here. I do want to mention that their food can be quite spicy because this is VERY authentic. Their mild would be equivalent to medium at other Thai restaurants. And medium is hot. Hot = hot AF + possible sweating. Just keep this in mind especially if you're sensitive to spiciness. 

My go to's are the Tom Yum Noodle Soup, Pad Thai with Shrimp, Rad Nah with Seafood, Sausage (sai oaw) with sticky rice!

Service and ambiance are great too! Very friendly staff. One of the waitresses surprised us and played happy birthday on the speakers so we could sing to my uncle for his birthday. It was very sweet of her. I will keep coming back to this place for my Thai fix!
author: Ashlei K.

description: Delivery took an hour.  Resto was one mile from my hotel.  The amount of food was teenie weenie for the price. I ordered Tom yum soup but got something else.  Food was just ok, nothing special.
author: Ann E.

description:
Food was great and service was quick. Servers don't smile much. What I didn't like was we were a family
Of 5 and they automatically put 18% on the bill. A group of 5 is not really a large group
author: Rhea S.

description:
One time I forgot my wallet when I made a pick up order and realized I forgot my wallet and I wasn't gonna make it home and back in time for closing.... so yeah I messed up and made an order that I didn't pick up....
Time goes by and I make an order since then and everything is fine.... this time I call To make an order and they tell me they won't accept an order from me ... because one time I didn't pick up the food?
author: Chris T.

description:
I've only ordered delivery here, so I can't really say much about the place itself.

The delivery is usually really fast despite the distance. Always on time, sometimes even early, and always with the right order so far.

The main reason why we order here is that the meat is super fresh and really well cooked. You can get a Beef Pad See Ew in every Thai restaurant, but most often that not, you'll get your beef cold, or too cooked. That won't happen if you order House of Thai. Same goes for the duck, really really good. With just white rice it's a bit plain, so upgrading to either garlic rice or fried rice is a must.

Their prices are very competitive too.
author: Antonio H.

description:
Came here for dinner after a long day. The service is alright, one girl was kind of rude to me when I wanted to pay the check up at the counter. 
I got the Pumpkin Curry which was actually kind of spicy. Also the soup is super diluted which was a little disappointing. My friend got the Pad Thai and said it was pretty good!
author: Jennifer L.

description:
House of Thai was my first stop upon arrival in San Francisco. My boyfriend and I were looking for a hole in the wall Thai restaurant near our hotel when we stumbled upon this place. 

When we arrived we were kind of skeptical looking in the window, but we walked in anyway. 

Service was good, we were seated right away and our server was very friendly.  

We ordered the appetizer sampler, pad thai, and the pad gra-praw. The appetizer sampler wasn't very good- the fish cakes were sad and soggy and the golden bags were over fried and dry. The entrees were okay, but nothing to write home about. 

The ambiance and cleanliness of the establishment  is pretty terrible. It's a brown brick building and the entire restaurant is overheated and has an unpleasant smell that made me sort of nauseous and not want to eat. When our drinks arrive, my boyfriend's glass had a hair in it. The server apologized and replaced the drink- but the whole experience was unpleasant. 

I would definitely not return to House of Thai.
author: Ellie L.

description:
Another disappointing experience in San Francisco. 

This is a very simple thai place, what is good they are open late. 

The girl who was serving us was Jan, who did not even want to come to our table to get our order. I had to wave at  her when I lost my patience after we had been sitting there for like almost 10 mins. 

She was doing everything the whole time, except taking care of our table. 

I had to go to the counter to ask even a water refill and it was going on like this during the time we were in the restaurant, which was so annoying. Horrible service...

If I rate only the food it were 4 star but this service destroyed the dining experience..worst since in SF. 

The tom yup soup was not well made, tasted like water, we should have sent it back. 

The pad thai was pretty good, but the portion was 
not a generous one. 

I still wanted to order something as we were hungry, but the girl after giving reccomendation left our table again and took her forever to return, so I decided not to order anything else here.

Go elsewhere, since not the best place to have a pleasant time. 

An unattentive server like this one,  will ruin your dining, you will have to stand up and look for her the whole time, when you need or you want something. 

If this is what I want, I will go to a self-serve place.
author: Andrea T.

description:
Bland is the best way to describe the food here. I've sort of given up on Southeast Asian food in SF. They can't compare to the Southeast Asian cooking up in Seattle. After going to Thailand last year, the food is pretty dull in flavor compared to authentic Thai food.

Food:

Khao Soy - incredibly bland, lack of spices and curry wasn't flavorful. 
Por Pier Sod - The rolls were drenched with sauce. The dish tasted more like Chinese cooking. 
Lychee Thai tea - There was only 1 lychee in this drink. Really now?

Ambiance - Casual and somewhat noisy, good for groups. 

One word - Overrated.
author: Virginia Y.

description: I pass by this restaurant while on my way to a Japanese sushi bar, the decoration attracted me so I decide to try this one. I ordered a Tom Yum Soup with sea food and one white rice plus a Thai Ice teas . The Tom Yum soup is awesome! Very tasty as what I got in Thailand. The ice tea is so so. So, I put 4 stars on it.
author: Zhen R.

description:
Tasty authentic Thai food, we love our papaya salad, pork stew soup noodle so

The service is awesome. Variety of Thai dish.If you love Thai food, this is one of the good choice.
author: Supawat J.

description: Been coming here for years. Always great food, decent and fast service. The neighborhood just adds to the charm. The prices are some of the best in the city for quality Thai food.
author: L D.

description: We stopped by because of Yelp.  Place was crowded so we decided to try the Tom Kha soup, yellow chicken curry and pineapple fried rice.  Wow!  Sooo good!  Absolutely no left overs!  Highly recommend!
author: Larry M.

description: I'd like to recommend #53 Kao Soy as it is uncommon in most Thai places and they did a great job!  We also had Pad Thai and Green Curry which are both delicious.  However, their dessert taro coconut milk did not use the real taros and was a bit too sweet.
author: Agnes L.

description:
I stopped here for a quick dinner with a group after we were deterred by the long line for Mensho down the street. I used Yelp to find nearby restaurants, and this one popped up. I called, and the staff was more than willing to accommodate our group of ten with just a few minutes' notice. Plus one for that service!

As far as the food quality, it was okay. I ordered Pad Thai, and I was excited about it because I hadn't had Thai food in a while. It wasn't bad, but it was so sweet! I know this dish is supposed to be a little sweet, but it was so sweet that it was a bit difficult to eat.

Other than that, I have no complaints. The staff was attentive, and the space was clean. I wouldn't go out of my way to visit this restaurant again, but it's a good place for a relatively casual Thai dining experience.
author: Stella T.

description: Outstanding!!! Everything was great! highly recommend! Unbelievably fresh! Clean, and reasonably priced. A must, for Thai food lover's.
author: Brett R.

description: Awesome Pad Thai and Shrimp paste fried rice. Fast and free delivery. Food always arrives earlier than expected.
author: Kenny E.

description: This place is delicious! They serve quickly, the plates are well portioned and the soups are bountiful enough to share. I loved the Kom Kah, Moo Yang, and Pad See Eew... warning, when they say spicy, it's spicy even for a Mexican hot sauce fan
author: Alvin B.

description: Went with my wife. We didn't see many vegan options, but the lady who attend us said we can make anything in the list, vegan, and it worked great! I really enjoyed the food. Great experience overall. Delicious meal of course. One of the best Thai places I've been to in SF. Thank you House of Thai.
author: Maulik S.

description: Hmmm I don't go there that often but it's jammed packed at night time I need too wait 20 minutes for my food, mostly I get food from here online but they asked for tip when they delivers food that's a little odd because I know that you give them tips not because they asked for it but because of how generous you are and the timing of your delivery
author: Alex W.

description:
If you're craving for really good and authentic Thai food...this is the spot!!! The food is sooo delicious
and they have great customer service too! Must come by and eat!
author: Marie Y.

description:
Pad See Ew was ok; I've had better elsewhere for half the price I paid here. 

I was expecting to make it into two meals, but I have to say I was really disappointed in their portion size. In regards to the actual food, the beef in my pad see ew was really chewy and bland compared to the noodles. The noodles itself were kind of burnt and really salty. Overall, this was not a very good dish. 

I ordered this as a takeout, so I'm not sure if their food is better when you eat in. At this point, I'm not certain I'll go back to try it out. 

Despite their lackluster pad see ew, they get stars for their quick service! It took about 15 minutes from when I put in the order for them to have it ready to go for me!
author: Nina Z.

description: We came here on a weekend around 7pm and there was no wait.  We ordered the Tom Kha soup, pumpkin curry and the beef with sticky rice.  The coconut soup was ordered medium spicy and it tasted medium spicy.  It was flavorful as if should be and delicious.   The pumpkin curry was something I never really tried before but I liked it.  The curry came with potatoes and beef and it was tasty.  The beef was tender but the potatoes were a tad too soft to my liking.  The beef with sticky rice was really good!  It came in three big pieces so we had to cut them.  It went really well with the sticky rice--something I would order again.  At the end, we ordered mango with sticky rice and this was a tad disappointing because the portion was extra small, lol.  The mango was tiny and the sticky rice was a scoop.  If you order this, you could probably finish this on your own. Other than that, it was a cool experience to eat authentic Thai food on Larkin.
author: Kristy L.

description: Decent food. Friendly staff. Fast service. I ordered yellow curry with chicken. It was quite yummy - as expected.
author: Cynthia G.

description:
Solid food, and quick delivery.  

But unbelievably, the shrimp curry had the tails left on the shrimp! 

Who on earth has ever gotten a bowl of curry and thought, "Yes!  I get to finish cleaning the shrimp for the staff at the restaurant!  I'm so psyched to fish through the curry to remove the tails from all the shrimp."

Imagine getting a chicken dish with the feathers still on, or a beef dish served with the cow's fur still on. Yuck. Please clean you shrimp.
author: Jim M.

description:
The delivery service was great! They were prompt and the food arrived piping hot! 

It was so delicious that I ate far too much but I enjoyed every bit. 

Thank you!
author: A C.

description: This is my favorite thai place so far. I made an easy reservation on the yelp page but ended up not having to as the place was not too packed for a Sunday night. The food was amazing here, definitely get a noodle dish. The restaurant was also clean and they always filled our water cups (which was amazing since the noodles were spicy). Tip: You can pick your spicy level as well.
author: Makaela M.

description: Absolutely loved the taste of everything I ordered!! Tom kha, Tom yum noodle soup and green curry paste fried rice. Oh! The rice!! It was super delicious!
author: Rashmi D.

description:
Kao Pad! This fried rice really hit the spot. First time having fried rice with calamari. Not damn bad. Additionally, the rice was nicely moist and complemented by my dream fried rice ingredients. 

On my dine-in list now, thanks to the good folks of Caviar delivery. (And thanks to my dog for not eating most of my order.)
author: Paulina F.

description:
This place is pretty good! I've only tried 3 of their dishes so far, the pad woon sen, gang ga ree gai and yum woon sen, and I've been ok with all so far.

Be careful about adding spice to any dish that isn't labeled as spicy though! I wanted to add two star to my dish of pad woon sen and it was 4x more spicy than the gang ga ree gai, which is also labeled with two star spiciness.
author: Averi E.

description: Went there on weekend. Nice and lovely place to eat. I ordered pad Thai and pineapple fried rice. They were kind enough to prepare both of them vegan. I loved the taste of both. For dessert, I had coconut ice cream. It was delicious with chocolate drizzle. Will definitely go again
author: Megha S.

description: I ordered delivery on eat24 so cant comment on service but food was good. I had beef pad see ew and chicken yellow curry over jasmine rice. Better then most thai but not the best iv ever had. Portions are large i could only finish 1 order of the 2 required for delivery. The curry had large chunks of chicken and potatoes and lots of beef in the noodles. Solid food overall.
author: Sean G.

description: There are two locations for this restaurant And I have been to both of them. I enjoy their fast service and ability to tweak for vegetarian and spicy concerns. If you are in a rush to get something to go or sit down you can be guaranteed the food will be made quickly. Those sometimes the flavors can be off or inconsistent, I still do enjoy my time there. The eggrolls are OK and the pad Thai is decent. Well portions ar
author: Johnny H.

description: I had the Pad See Ew, and it was really good. One of the better thai places in the city. Thai Iced Tea was small portion though. Literally drank it in a few sips.
author: Marie D.

description: Best Thai I've had in the city! Been a bunch of ok, 4 star places but this place delivered.  Had the pineapple friend rice, pad Thai and pad prick, all top notch.  Looking for yummy Thai by bob hill?  GO HERE!
author: Jason H.

description: Got my food to be delivered at the hospital I work in and my chicken was nasty. Shit looks like it had been waiting to be delivered since Jesus Christ was born.  It also reminded me of a patients amputated leg. Nasty and will never order from here again. I showed the pictures to my coworkers and everyone was grossed out.
author: Alex C.

description:
Well , hasn't tried the food yet but did order it . 
Waited 3 hours no one called , no one delivered...
Eventually I called E24 and Canceled...
author: Alex B.

description:
I am here at the restaurant after I picked up my order, arrived at home, and realized it was missing two menu items. 
I had to walk back to the restaurant in the rain and was told I had to wait for my food to be prepared. 
I had called to tell them my order was missing items before I returned. 
Please check your orders when picking up. 
They were not super helpful and I will not be ordering here again.  
Disappointing :/
Oh and I had already left a 15% tip for takeout....please get orders right!
author: Lauren P.

description: Pad Kee Mao - $11 ordered off Yelp for son. About 12 noodles that barely covered the bottom of serving container but oddly good amt of beef. Weird sauce, not full, not recommended.
author: Lu L.

description: Now this is what I'm talking about! Kept saying that while I was eating haha. It was great! Spiciness & flavoring was on point! YUM! They do not downplay their spice level like other "non-authentic" Thai restaurants. Will be back!
author: Anita S.

description:
Ordered delivery from here after a late flight into SF. This review is for delivery only!

Delivery was pretty fast, and polite service. The food was only ok. Very sweet and sticky- not the complexity of flavors I'm used to in Thai food. Didn't seem super fresh either, as far as the veggies go. Chicken was totally flavorless but everything else was covered in a way too sweet sauce. This place is fine in a pinch but not a place I would order from again.
author: Liz M.

description: This place is the second jewel of the tenderloin. All the dishes are authentic and prices are fair. It's my weekly indulgence.
author: Mitra K.

description:
My boyfriend and I always come here for date night. It is by far one of the better Thai restaurants in the city and I love it because it is so close by to where we live. We always eat-in so i'm not quite sure how it is if you want to do takeout. My boyfriend always gets the Red Gang Dang Curry with Chicken every time we go. It's delicious and they add quite a bit of spicy kick to the dish. I'm personally not a fan of bamboo shoots but I love how their coconut curry sauce tastes and the flavors of the Red Curry meld very well. 

Depending of what i'm in the mood for, there are many other good things on their menu. My go-to curry is their Pumpkin curry and I always add either Chicken or Beef. I'm a sucker for butternut squash/pumpkin and the flavors always balance out nicely because they add garlic and basil and bell pepper. Whenever i'm in a noodle mood I always go with the Pad Se Ew or the Pad Thai, as you can't really go wrong there. Their Yum salad with Beef is also delicious, their spicy lime dressing is really refreshing and the beef is seasoned well and not overcooked. The prices her are good - you'll end up spending $30 for 2 people which is pretty standard I think, but it also depends on how much food you order.
author: Carina P.

description: Hotel was in the area so we decided to check it out. Incredible Thai food, casual setting. Good for a quicker dinner. Highly recommend the pad Thai and roast pork. Can't go wrong!
author: Monika W.

description: HOLY COW this place does not mess around with spice. I can handle some heat, and have been known to drench my food in hot sauce. That being said, my go to move is always an order of pad kee mao (drunken noodles) which I get with just enough heat to leave room for some additional sriracha. I ordered this the other day here for takeout and got a "medium" and could barely breath, sans sriracha. Unfortunately I also only got 3 pieces of shrimp which I thought was sort of lame and I typically like my pad kee mao with more veggies. The flavor in the sauce was noodles were good, but I'm still searching for the holy grail of Thai food in SF and I didn't find it here.
author: Lauren M.

description:
During a visit to San Fran I used Yelp to find a good Thai restaurant and this place lived up to their rating. The food was very fresh and delicious.

The food was cooked quickly and the prices were average. 


My only complaint was the garlic wings appetizer was bland. The wings were cooked well and moist but it lacked flavor.
author: Stacey R.

description: Had high hopes based on reviews and multiple locations but was disappointed.  Service was slow and taste was just ok.
author: Nidhi D.

description: The staff very friendly and i went there becos craving of fresh roll which stuffed w/ Chinese sausage and it met my desire!!! Also, the taro ball with coconut milk or we call it Bua-loi , it was hella good Must try!! The taste is so Thai
author: Tiratiwan L.

description: Great service from the staff and the food was on point. We ordered like 4 dishes for 2 people(we like to take food home) and all of it was delicious. To bad we live on the other side of the city otherwise we'd eat here Morr.
author: Faisal P.

description:
Yummy food, good services but hard to park:)

Food：

Services：WESME！

Enviroment：WRM

PRICE：$$（CHEAP）
author: Yingying C.

description: The dessert to not miss is sticky rice and egg custard, the perfect way to finish a firey Thai meal
author: Gary F.

description: This is an authentic Thai restaurant. Very tasty. Street parking in neighborhood with homeless hanging about. Good food, bad environment.
author: Clifford W.

description:
We ordered Pad Se-Ew for takeout with pork. This was made with real Chinese broccoli which is a plus. Overall good texture and taste, even though my husband forgot to bring back hot sauce.

Good price. Good quantity. We'd try other dishes if we end up back in the area. 

Walking distance from the Motel 6.
author: Jana M.

description: Food is absolutely delicious. I've tried a variety of them and all have done nothing but impress me. Reasonable price. Clean environment and nice decorations. Definitely recommend.
author: Anna B.

description: I think there's much better thai in this area. It is open till 12 so it works in a pinch for late night.
author: nancy w.

description: Seafood fried rice. Comes with 02 shrimps. This place use to be very affordable , now they charge like 5star price with 1 star service:(
author: Adelio D.

description:
Went in for lunch around 1:30 on a Tuesday afternoon. I was spotted as I walked in, seated, and given iced water all within a couple minutes. Service is definitely prompt but friendly. They notice when you need more water, when you're done with your food, and when you need your bill. 

I ordered the Panang curry rice plate. The rice was too undercooked and the beef overcooked. Also, the beef didn't taste all that fresh. I probably just ordered the wrong dish on this visit. The flavor of the curry was good, though a bit on the spicier end. 

Parking will be impossible and I'd fear for the safety of my car parking in the TL. Take public transport then walk here! Probably won't be dropping by regularly, but not a bad place to grab a quick bite when you're in the area and craving Thai cuisine!
author: Kristi T.

description: Love the service , beer from Thailand & pak ga paw. Pls add another fried egg and white rice. Spicy level can be adjust just let the servers know. Their Tom yam with calamari is fresh and taste so good
author: Sy F.

description:
I was in San Francisco for a networking trip Sunday thru Wednesday.  Our hotel was right in the heart of downtown, so I was determined to find some of the best Asian cuisine in the area... and lucky me, first try.  Shout outs to Yelp and Location Tracking.

I walked in with my friend on Sunday around 6.  Pretty busy, but not super packed.  It was a lot bigger than I thought it was going to be.  The kitchen is open in the back, so you can see and hear all the cooking going on.  The menu is huge -- there are well over 100 options to choose from.  I'm a huge fan of Tom Yum, so I got the Tom Yum Noodle Soup.  You can ask for a spice level 1-5 -- 3 is the threshold for me, and I like a good kick to my food.  I also got a Thai Tea, which was refreshing.

The Tom Yum Noodle Soup was delicious.  I think that this place has the perfect noodle to soup to meat ratio -- a lot of other places I've been to have either too much broth or not enough meat.  Another thing to note is that you get a lot of food for the price you pay, which is a stark contrast from many other Thai restaurants I've been to.  For $10, I was definitely satisfied.  

The waiters and waitresses are nice and are really on top of it all -- they give you water in really small cups, but I never ran out even once.  Another thing I like about this place is how casual the atmosphere is -- it's an awesome place to gather as a group or just go with a friend.  They had the Warriors game on and played today's hits on the radio.

My friend and I liked our meal so much on Sunday night that on Tuesday night, we came back... and brought 6 others with us.  They all enjoyed their meals as well.

Good job, House of Thai.  You're officially one of the reasons I want to end up in San Francisco after I graduate.
author: Alex L.

description: My first experience at this place was pretty decent. The service was excellent, recommended for groups, vegetarian friendly, and waitresses were friendly. The wait for the food was not bad. I ordered the tofu option for my pad see ew, and the first bite was really satisfying and tasty! After the first couple bites, the noodles got too sweet and flavorful. My friend who ordered the Pad Thai said that it was slightly too salty.
author: Cindy C.

description: House of Thai would have probably gotten better rating if it were not for the lack of service. There were two waitresses there, one of them was super nice and friendly, the other was snobby and rolled her eyes at every request we made for water, spice rack, etc. when the bill came at the end, she took it upon herself to give herself an 18% tip on our full bill. Mind you we are a group of 3 really young looking people and half of our food were for takeouts, which isn't normally calculated into the tip. When we told the host about the situation, she was very accommodating and apologized for the whole situation. She did not deserve that tip so we did not give her that satisfaction of earning our gratuity for snobby attitude. I do want to warn others out there to look at their bill before paying. It was extremely unprofessional.
author: Thu V.

description: Great curries. However they are a bit light on portion size given the price. Pumpkin curry is great and so is the duck green curry with bamboo. I
author: Phillip T.

description:
My friend and I went here for dinner on a Sunday and it wasn't so crowded. This place is pretty spacious and clean. The waitresses were very quick and attentive so that's a plus.

Food: we wanted something with noodles and curry and this was it. The curry sauce was so good and flavorful...wish it was more spicy though. 
- Kao Soy with chicken $10
- Kao Soy with shrimp (+$3)

Tip: If you're looking for something with veggies, choose something else. It does take awhile for the food to come esp if you order something that's not commonly requested.
author: My N.

description:
Wow what a random find and truly we felt this was one of the best Thai we've had in the Bay Area to date!

So the fiance and I were in SF as she had a hair appointment in the Presidio area. I scoped out a Vietnamese place but forgot to check the hours. So passing by (and very hungry) we just decided to take a chance without looking at Yelp for the rating.

We were sat pretty quickly. While it was a little stuffy and hot (no AC running, just an open window) inside, that was quickly taken care of with some ice water. We decided to play it a little safe and went with our usual go to Thai dishes, Pad Thai and seafood green curry. I ordered the curry between medium and hot. We also decided to treat ourselves to two Thai iced teas as others around us seemed to enjoy theirs.

So first to arrive was the pad Thai. Visually it looked like any ol' dish of Pad Thai.  But it wasn't a huge mound of noddles like other places so we wondered if it was a quality vs quantity thing. Well we definitely felt it was a quality thing as my fiancé couldn't stop taking about how good it was. Skeptical, I took a bite. Yup, pretty damn good! Now was it something so spectacular that id gush to everyone about it? Nope, but best dish of pad Thai I've had in the Bay Area so far

Same true with the green curry except it was even better. Asked for med to really hot and got it exactly how I liked it. The best part? Each piece of seafood was cooked to perfection. The squid, cuttlefish, shrimp, etc was NOT overcooked, rubbery, tough, etc. Well the mussels were a bit chewy, but all else was perfect. Flavor? Outstanding. Enough to go back again. And we'll be back in the area again in the future. 

Legit points: real deal Thais in the back cooking. Friendly service. Great food. Bathroom needs a serious paint job though. 

Highly recommended and will return if in the area.
author: Bob K.

description:
I am generally not one to give 1 star reviews, but when you have the worst delivery experience ever, you want people to know about it so they never order from this place.

I had ordered delivery Wednesday night in North Beach. While my friend had her Thai preferences, we saw the rating and over a thousand reviews and it sounded good. The menu was huge but we ordered chicken pad Thai, the chicken wings, and panang curry.

What follows is while this place will never get my or any of my friend's business: We were given a ridiculous 90 minute wait to start. Hold on a sec - the app said 45 minutes, how did it double?

Well we watch a movie and the 10:01 delivery time rolls by and no word. I generously give them 10 more minutes before reaching out on Eat24. I now wait an additional 20 minutes to hear back from the app as they get into contact with the now over 2 hour late delivery.

It gets better - as Eat24 discovers on our behalf the driver never called and decided to give our order to someone else!

So now I'm hangry, scrambling to get any good alternative (she took me to Kennedy's which was fascinating). I will not only never order from here again, I will openly request people not order as well. This place effectively stole from me (I was refunded via Eat24) and I now look forward to supporting their competitors.
author: Michael C.

description:
I would actually give this place 2.5 stars. I came here because it has high Yelp reviews, but I didn't like it very much. 

I pretty much only order Pad Thai at any Thai restaurant I go to, and this wasn't a good one. The tofu pieces were sour and soft, not fried like the tofu in typical Pad Thais. The Pad Thai here didn't taste good at all and was tangy. They gave me ample shrimp though, which was a huge plus. 

I also ordered a hot Thai tea, and strangely it was only hot tea with no milk or sugar in there. I was used to Thai restaurants serving their Thai iced tea, but in a hot form. 

The restaurant was also extremely noisy. It wasn't very crowded as it was a Thursday night, but people sitting across the table from each other cannot carry on a conversation because it was so loud in there. They've got the music going and the kitchen wasn't separated. It wasn't a nice atmosphere. 

What is great about this place is that it's so cheap! A lot of dishes were $10 only, whereas I've normally seen Thai entree prices to be closer to $12-13. 

Overall, it was a decent dining experience, but I wouldn't go back.
author: Jennifer W.

description: Waitress there are impolite, always so meant to customer with bad attitude.  I haven't experienced as a customer services to yell at customer.  I won't suggest this restaurant and if you would like to pay money for having hard time, then you should go and try...  disappointed at all.
author: Darren P.

description:
My favorite place for **TOM YUM NOODLE SOUP! Its really authentic and amazing. Totally different, less Americanize. I always, almost get the same thing, their Tom Yum noodle soup with rice noodle. Explosion of flavors. So good! I get medium spicy but all my friends couldn't handle it. Their spicy is pretty spicy and I love it. You won't find a better one in the city for this soup. 

Also love their pork belly with string beans, so yummy. And the thai ice tea is really good too. $3.
author: Sandy B.

description: I have frequented this place a few times. But, delivered food today was just terrible.
author: Arun R.

description: Always fast and spicy. Curiously, delivery is better than eating in. Pork belly is bomb. Wonton soup interestingly delicious. All curries leave you breathing heavily, sweating and wanting moreeeeee
author: Andrew J.

description: Food was alright. I placed an order on the phone for pickup. They said it will take 10 minutes for the order to be ready. Instead it took them 20 minutes. I ordered only one dish. That doesn't make any sense. I am ok with waiting a little longer, but they should have let me know if that was the case. There is literally no parking, and I can't leave my car on the bus lane so I had to drive around and wait for the order to be picked up. Don't think I'll be coming back again.
author: Shanzay H.

description:
After a long day of Santa con debauchery, nothing sounded better than getting some Thai food before heading home

Duck Noodle soup was soul satisfying and worth a repeat order. Noodles were cooked well and plenty of them. Duck was good, nothing special but enough to keep you happy

Fried rice was flavorful and what you expect, easily shareable with a large group

No draft beers but they do have bottles and sake 

Overall Thoughts

I would come back again to see what else House of Thai can do
author: Eddie W.

description:
I've become a late night House of Thai delivery fan.

Their crispy pork belly with string beans is perfect.

The duck larb is excellent.

I also love the pork leg stew.
author: David T.

description:
Formally known as Thai House Express, this restaurant had a face lift about 2 years ago because I think people thought it was a 'take-out' only establishment.

It is a full service restaurant that serves homey delicious thai food at a good price!

Compared to the many other Thai restaurants in the area, I actually love the quality and options here. They don't skimp on the tofu when you order vegetarian or vegan.
I've had all the comforting staples here-from Pad Thai to Pad See Ew, from Pumpkin Curry to Tom Kha, from Veggie Spring rolls to Deep fried tofu!

This place can get really crowded depending on whether there is some event going on nearby downtown, but thy are really fast and efficient at getting tables turned and cleaned and I've never had to wait too long for a table.

They even have a full bar if you want something cold and refreshing to wash down that spicy noodle soup you're eating.

One more plus: They do delivery! So when you're feeling reaaal lazy (like me today), all you have to do is order through Yelp and get piping hot Thai food at your door in no time!
author: Lanie L.

description:
Food was amazing here!  And I thought back at home in LA was good. Now I can't seem to eat at any other Thai restaurants.  Even thou the place is kind of in a dumpy area...  food and portion and price is great! 

Had pad Thai, green papaya salad, beef BBQ and duck.  All very delicious!  Will be back!
author: KendraHA B.

description: Craving for Thai so Ordered delivery at 10pm on my way back from the airport. The food came very fast but the portion was pathetically small. I was not particularly hungry but I finished the pa kee mau in literally a few bites. It looked like either someone ate my food or they split an order in two. I am giving a two star only because it was the amount of food I wanted to eat late at night but I felt ripped off for what I paid. The dish itself was a little too salty to my taste but it was fine overall.
author: Tina C.

description: Awesome food and very friendly staff! Highly recommend the soup as they are so flavorful! Just make sure you don't order it being too spicy. :)
author: Karim C.

description:
Really affordable and delicious Thai food! Also very friendly service. I think this is my favorite spot for Thai food in the city so far.

My friend and I came late after a class and ordered both drinks and food. I got the Tom yum noodle soup and she got the shrimp pad Thai.  Both dishes were yummy and very filling. Best of all, they were also only $10 each which is so rare in the city.

For drinks I ordered the mango mint mojito. It was only $6!!! It was so refreshing to see non overpriced alcohol in the city. The drink was also very tasty and had a good amount of fresh mint.

They open late which is another huge plus. We were there from 9 pm - 11:30 pm and we're welcomed to stay as long as we want.
author: Sophia H.

description: Best Thai Food in the Bay. None can make a better Duck Larb. Make sure you visit during the week at prime time for the top chef.
author: Shauntinez J.

description: Tom yumm soup was not authentic. Mediocre service, sketchy area. Food ok. Would not return.
author: Simone C.

description: The lunch special is a good deal -- lots of food for a low price. The actual food was fine, but not very impressive or unique. I liked my dish well enough, but I wouldn't order it again (I got vegetables with peanut sauce and brown rice). This place is very inexpensive, though, so if you just need a quick cheap meal it's a good option.
author: Kate J.

description:
I found this spot in my neighborhood and it's pretty great!  It stays open pretty late so you can eat at the actual restaurant at like 11:00pm on a weeknight.  The service is great, and the prices are good! I usually get the Pad Thai or the Tom Yum soup.  Any of my friends that I have brought tend to have good things to say about it.

Honestly, I don't have anything negative to say about this place -- while I wouldn't say it's worth a trek from another neighborhood, I would definitely recommend it if you live in the area.  It's  ridiculously quick, affordable, friendly, safe, and convenient.
author: Michelle S.

description:
We came here for my friend's birthday because she loved Thai food. I ordered the tom yum noodle soup with rice stick noodles. It was delicious. I'm not truly certain what authentic/traditional flavors are, but if I had to guess, this would be it! It was a balance for savory/sourness and spicy with a touch of sweet. 

Spicy is VERY spicy in Thai food. Be forewarned. 

The service was very good as well. They respected our large party and allowed us to stay for the long time that we did. I definitely enjoyed myself and will be coming back again.
author: Tina Y.

description: Delicious! I had the ma keur yao (spicy eggplant) w/ jasmine rice (spicier than I *should* have but it is worth the pain) and the freshly made mint lemonade (scrumptious and refreshing). Also had the egg roll and golden purses which were amazing. I was not in love with the fried tofu or fish cake, but everything else was excellent!
author: Tyger L.

description:
Running late to eat, me and my friends decided to give this place a try.
I ordered the Pad Thai and my friend ordered the Pad Se Ew, turned out the food were good. The service was fast. Totally come back.
Not the best thai place around neighborhood tho, but it worths a try.
author: Candice L.

description: Delivery was prompt, arrived 12 minutes prior to quoted time and packaged perfectly. I ordered the pad thai (it was delicious) and green curry (mild was way hotter than I expected, too hot for me to enjoy).
author: Lahela W.

description: Solid choice for Thai food. Got the pad se ew and the pad ke mao and both were great. Balanced between some sweetness and spiciness. Price point is right too.
author: Husayn H.

description:
We wanted something simple, something Asian, and we found House of Thai. I feel that thai food is almost always safe, wherever you are... The exterior had a new signs and paints, as it used to be a different restaurant name (another Thai restaurant, different management). It was located on a quiet street, so the restaurant was mostly empty. As we entered, we were greeted immediately with warm smile, and was offered any open seats we wanted.The interior are rather simple, lots of wood from floor to table to the counter. The walls facing the streets were all windows, from floor to ceilings, making the inside very bright with natural lights. 

We ordered a basic Pad Thai, and Tom Kha soup, they were good, nice portion, well seasoned. We also enjoyed their Thai Iced Coffee and Lychee Thai Tea. It was not really anything special or amazing, but it hit the spot, and the price was right. 

The service was good, as we were one of the very few customers, but the waiters were attentive, answered our questions with smile, we had no problem there.
author: June S.

description: I love love love this place.   I have been here three times and every single time the food is sooooo delicious.   I've never had to wait for a table and the food is always served promptly.
author: Mike R.

description:
Came here on a rainy Tuesday for lunch. Parking in the area are mostly street parking with meter. Unless you are lucky and find a 2 hour parking spot a few blocks up Hyde St.

It wasn't easy to get attention from the waitress unless she comes out to serve another table, the staff are usually keeping themselves busy towards the back near the kitchen.

The lunch special caught my eye right away. For $12 during weekdays, it comes with:

1) Small soup of the day/salad
    -- Today's soup of the day is Tom Kha: Had a nice balance of coconut milk with broth so that it wasn't overpowering. Very tasty.

2) Appetizer
   -- Egg rolls: nice crisy golden brown skin, really enjoyed the contents- a mix of vermicelli, wood ear, and cabbage. 

3) Steamed/brown/sticky rice

4) Main entree
   -- Green curry with chicken: had a little more heat than other green curry I've tried but it was tolerable and delicious nonetheless. 

I also had a Thai iced tea which tasted like any other Thai iced tea, nothing remarkable.

I would definitely come again, probably during a weekday around lunch time.
author: Amy T.

description:
Their food is actually 4.5 stars. Strong flavors: spicy, sweet, salty, sour. None of that watered down for the white person's taste buds' taste. Large, but not overly large, portion size. I love that they have a big variety to their menu, not just the typical Thai menu of Pad Thai, curries, and Tom Yum Soup. Plus, they have Kao Soy (yellow curry noodle soup), my favorite dish!!

However, upon ordering delivery via EAT24, I encountered a huge problem. My company orders out for lunch and dinner everyday. We ordered from House of Thai almost once a week until one day they called after I placed an order basically saying they wouldn't deliver to us anymore because we tip poorly. So let me get this straight: you don't want our business ($200 lunch order) because we didn't tip $20? It doesn't make sense to me to lose that much business over 10% or 20% for a non-mandatory gratuity. We ended up having to cancel and got a refund from EAT24 and don't order from them anymore.

Strange customer service but great food!
author: Liz R.

description: Today my husband and I made and order with delivery there. We waited our food almost 2 hours and it was cold when it arrived finally. Nobody called about delays.
author: Regina P.

description:
One of the best thai restaurants I've tried in the bay area. Arrived on a Sunday night and we had a party of 10 but they couldn't fit us at one connecting table so our party split up.

The pad thai with dungeness crab was amazing! The crab flavor didn't over power the original pad thai taste, it was saucy and there were actual crab meat throughout the dish. I also ordered the tom yum soup. I asked for it spicy and it was the perfect amount of spice. The larb and pad thai was also good. 

Ask for the spice rack if the dish isn't spicy enough for you!
author: Olivia T.

description: Good place for Thai food in the tenderloin. The food was tasty. The portions were right.  Place is noisier than I would like. You can hardly hear what your friends say. Service is slow and not attentive.
author: Ken D.

description:
This place had a better overall rating than most other places in the area so I decided to give it a shot and I'm so glad that I did! Ordered delivery through Caviar and I got my food in less than 30 min which never happens! Love how quick these guys are!

Decided to try their Gang Panag (panang curry) which was some of the best I've ever had! The beef shortrib was so tender and fell apart just with a spoon! The kaffir lime flavor really stood out, and the fresh basil made it so tasty! The dish also came with a side of rice. Portion size was perfect and the pricing is very reasonable in my opinion. 

You can also order extra sides of green or red curry sauce which made me so happy because I love pouring extra curry sauce over my rice! This place was very very good. Full of flavor. I think this is my new go-to for thai food takeout!
author: Chisholm T.

description:
Food is OK. Pretty atypical for all the stellar reviews they receive.

Don't order for delivery. Either eat there or pick it up. Their delivery usually takes ~90 minutes.

Another reason to avoid delivery at all costs: they actually confirmed an order to me over the phone and forgot to send it to the kitchen and I ended up waiting 2 hours (they are predictably slow but i was sick and didnt want to go in) until I called and they simply offered to refund me rather than make the order right away and send it let alone discount it. 

The TL has way better spots for cheaper.
author: Benjamin C.

description: We chose the restaurant because of its 4 star rating and we were not disappointed.   The food was delicious and the service spot on!  We ordered cashew chicken, pad se-ew  and moo yang.  We loved it so much we went there again on the last night in town. Amazing food!
author: Genny G.

description: Worse customer service ever. The waitress gave us our menus and disappeared. No water or check in after 10-15 mins. I understand if she was busy but she wasn't, the place was literally empty. We walked out 15 mins later without any service and went to Lers Ros!
author: Liz G.

description: I seriously love this place! My boyfriend and I have come here multiple times in the last few months and can not get enough of it. The portion sizes are great! Awesome customer service
author: Kristen C.

description: Dont order Medium here unless you want your mouth and lips to burn!!! I have eaten here for 15 years, the Original Name is Thai Express, I ate here tonight with my family and ordered Medium Spicey level and recieved over the top extremely hot food. Of course we had already made our plates and served everyone when we realized the food was way to hot to eat, and the portions very very small, like 4-5 pieces of chicken total in the Thom Kah Gai and 4-5 pieces max in the red curry. The Larb Chicken was the size of a icecream scoop... Very small!!  The most dissappointing experience with Thai Food ever.... the food was small portions, and the food was so hot it was inedible- with lips face and mouth on fire and sweat dripping from my entire head. When I mentioned the fact that the food was way too hot to the waitress for my have ordered a medium dish, her reply was "our food is thai hot, not american hot"..... The other waitess said "our medium is hot", so let me get this right, your "medium is hot".... So why not call the medium hot, its not medium, instead of letting customers find out the hard way... By the way, after ordering medium 20 times before, they definitely destroyed my order with chili peppers and then offered no recourse for a meal I could not enjoy or consume. Bummer deal! If you dont like Extemely Hot, then order mild, there is no medium with this restaurant.  I left zero tip for the meal I could not enjoy or eat...
author: Ganja F.

description: I ordered from here for my work place and we had a good 10-11 orders from here and I have to say everyone was pleased and thought the food was amazing. I would highly recommend :)
author: Radhika G.

description:
If you're thinking about ordering House of Thai for delivery, I would say stop and don't do it. It is much tastier and the portions much more generous when you dine in.

I ordered the garlic marinated fried wings and the pad see ew with shrimp for delivery. The wings were bland and not at all crispy - I threw them away. The pad see ew was very oily, the noodles were cut in little pieces (making it look like these were left overs from someone else's plate) and looked completely not appetizing, and the container smelled strange. The portion was tiny - my box was maybe half full. The only redeeming part of of the dish were the shrimp, which were cooked perfectly (which, in my experience, is rare for take out orders.)

The only reason that I gave more than 1 star was because I know the food is better for dine in, but my latest delivery experience was absolutely terrible.
author: Nelya T.

description:
I have yet to eat at the restaurant itself but I've ordered delivery a few times and the flavors are spot on! Thai food that tastes authentic and spicy to the point of sweat, is hard to find! 

My favorite is the duck larb! Geezus, how come I didn't think of this before? Mix a deliciously overlooked meat like roast duck and combine it with the flavors of larb and you get tastebud-explosive-flavors!

They don't mess around with the levels of spiciness either!
author: Nitar L.

description:
Was craving Thai so I stopped by here on a Saturday afternoon for a quick meal.

I shared a Pad Thai (chicken) and a yellow curry with chicken.
Pad Thai was great and I loved that there was some tofu inside as well. The tofu was firm and soft without being dry.
The chicken in the curry was an actual chicken with bones and super tender, not just pieces of chicken breast meat stirred (like many other thai places) 

Taking off one star because it was superrrr hot inside and it was slightly uncomfortable. :(
author: Micaela I.

description:
My favorite place to order Thai delivery from! I always order the Tom Kha soup with tofu and mixed vegetables and the pumpkin curry (all spicy, of course!). The soup has quickly become one of my favorite comfort foods, not only is the broth rich and flavorful, but hearty - they pack plenty of tofu & veggies into it so maybe I don't feel so guilty about eating it. 
P.S. They aren't kidding when they say spicy, which I greatly appreciate ;) Gotta get that Thai spice in my life. 
The only downside to ordering delivery from this place is that they usually take a little longer to deliver (1hr +), so probably not the best place to order delivery from if you are already feeling hangry.
They messed up my order once and sent a different type of curry, but I had no problems being refunded and the lady I spoke with on the phone was extremely apologetic and courteous.
author: Daniella O.

description: Ordered the roasted duck ($10.99), but it tasted more like steamed duck. Came here for dinner, kind of late around 1030. No wait. Service was fine, water refilled without asking. Duck sauce was lightly sweet and salty. Not sure I would make a regular visit.
author: Thomas L.

description: We've dined at House of Thai as well as ordered through Yelp.  They consistently give very good meals at reasonable prices and attentive, but not overbearing, service when dining in.  Ordered for pickup recently and the only disappointment was no soy sauce was included in bag; next time we'll just have to double check.  Food taste and temperature were both good....and order was very, very spicy as requested.
author: Dei C.

description: Nice atmosphere, solid food, and nice staff. Only complaint would be finding bits of egg shell in my pad see yew.
author: Danny K.

description:
Very good value for the quality of food. 
Location is good- right on Geary street. The dining area is very spacious, which is nice compared to many other Thai places where you feel you are sitting on top of other tables. 
The pad Thai is good here, a good benchmark for judging this type of food. 
The service is also good. Also the spring Rolls with peanut sauce is really nice. 
Good place to come for a quick casual bite on your own or in a group. Would recommend.
author: Derek M.

description:
This review is on DELIVERY:
Pork Leg Stew Noodles Soup
Soup: soy sauce based is main taste
Pork Leg: Meat dry,dry dried up or mushy fat floating on top or very slippery fatty skin
Vegetable: mustard cabbage 1 clump wilted spoiled taste discovered three chews in
Noodles: nice texture 
  I had to the stewed pork leg and rice as a delivery item before and it was juicy and tender. 
Dining at the restaurant on a previous occasion, I thought the restaurant just had one slip up when My friend had ordered this same soup and thought the meat was very dry. Now as a delivery the same inedible experience: Apparently their chosen meat for the "pork leg stew noodle soup" is jerky dry, over cooked pork and loose fat. Definitely not going to order it again.
Ive been happy with many other menu items however.
Tip: When ordering Yelp Delivery, best to call and remind them to include eating utensils and napkins also confirm any added notes to your online/YelpDelivery order. (They offer to send driver back, but c'mon who wants to go through all that?)
author: S S.

description: Ok my SO accidentally ordered from here using Eat24. They took 90 mins to deliver and the pad Thai was missing. I called they said they would bring it in 20 mins and 50 mins later it came. How hard is it to get the right items into a bag (4 items)?!! Never again!
author: Piper W.

description:
Oh House of Thai...how I love thee.

I lived in San Francisco a few years back and was lucky enough to have found this place for Thai delivery. I ordered around once a week and they never let me down. My go-to pad see ew is the perfect balance of sweet and savory, and I love the pineapple fried rice as well.

Last time I was back in SF for a long weekend, I went back three times. Still my gold standard for Thai food.
author: Vivian Y.

description: We liked this place but my wife almost choked on her shrimp tail,We ordered Pad Tai!!! Who leaves on the the tails of shrimp for Pad Tai!!!!!!!!
author: Zaalen B.

description: Delicious, had the pork belly with red peppers. Steamed rice & cucumber salad. Gorgeous. Desert was Thai custard with sticky rice. Was stuffed so cud only eat half. Absolutely authentic (I shud know) Thai that's gr8 value for ur buck
author: honey k.

description: This place is so amazing!!! Im Thai and this resturant is the bomb!!! Everything we ate was so good and we finished it all up!!! 10 Stars!!!! #therealwfg
author: Nathan A.

description: The best. I drove from San Bruno just to get some food from here. I had business in the city. I haven't found another Thai restaurant as satisfying as this one. I haven't been in many. I was fortunate to have found this place when I first learned about Thai food. My favorite is the gang garee gai.
author: King L.

description: Turn on ur phone! Over 3hrs wait is uncalled for or stop accepting orders from grubhub for the night.
author: Jenn G.

description: Ordered delivery from here. I live around the corner and it took 1.5 hours to get to my house. I asked for the green curry Mild and even wrote "Very mild please" in the notes - it was so spicy I couldn't eat it. I was sweating bullets after just a bite. The pad see ew was ok. Portions are extremely small. Overall, I wouldn't order from here again.
author: Yasmin M.

description: Well go back for sure. We went there afterwork because they were open until 11pm and the staff was friendly and very helpful. The food came out quick too.
author: Christina L.

description:
The food here was not bad, but not great either. Not much flavor.

Also, when I went, most of the people working there were busy setting up some super fancy table in the middle of the restaurant. I'm assuming it was for a picture that they can put on their website or something. Because of that, our service wasn't too great.
author: Do P.

description:
It was good but the SPICY coconut soup was VERY VERY STRONG (spicy)
I recommend this restaurant/food!
author: Charlotte L.

description: One of the best Thai food I ever had.. actually I have ordered those items which can't even pronounce but just ordered after looking at description... But that was so good.. i can't forget these taste ever.. service was okay although they were pretty busy...
author: Surya R.

description:
I made a huge mistake when I came here. I actually ordered my food at the spiciest level because I'm used to other restaurants being weaksauce when it comes to that... but I promise you, House of Thai WILL deliver the spice you ask for and they do NOT hold back.

My friend and I came here because I was craving Tom Yum Noodle Soup. This is what I ordered at the spiciest level (with regret) but it was okay regardless. Way too sweet for my taste. Large portions, though... so you will definitely be full by the end of the bowl. We also ordered the Larb with minced duck, which I was also not a fan of. For dessert we got the Mango with Sweet Sticky Rice which was AMAZING. Favorite part of the meal and a great way to counter all the spiciness consumed prior. 

The service here is fast and excellent. The food is fresh and affordable, but it's just not my favorite place to get Thai food in SF.
author: Stefanie C.

description: This review is based on ordering takeout and having it delivered.  I found this spot on Yelp and it seemed to be having good reviews so you know I had to give it a chance.  I was staying at a hotel in downtown SF and my family and I were to lazy to go out.  Thank goodness this place had free delivery too for orders over $20.  The lady over the phone was super nice and didn't rush you.  I ordered the usual shrimp pad Thai noodles, beef pad see-ew and some crispy chicken wings with Thai chili dipping sauce!! We ordered at 9pm on a Thursday night and got our food delivered to our room 9:30!! This was awesome because our food was still hot and the wings were really crispy!!! The pad Thai was really tasty not to sweet and not to much egg in there!! The pad see-ew had nice size cuts off well marinated beef in them and the Chinese broccoli was nice and crispy! The chicken was nice and crispy with about 6 pieces.  No negatives here! I want to eat in the restaurant to see if they are truly a 5 star!  I will be back here to try this place again when I'm in the area!
author: Elvin D.

description:
I ordered the pad see ew and pad thai and I thought it was way too salty. 
The pad see ew came with asparagus, pork (I chose), and noodles. It tasted like it had been drenched in the sauce for a very long time. I'm a big fan of salty food, so when I find it salty it's pretty darn salty. The pad thai was a little bit better. I tried the pad thai with the beef. However, I wasn't wow'd by it. It seemed salty and standard. It comes with a side of bean sprouts.

Overall, I would say it's alright but I wouldn't come here again.
author: Alice Y.

description:
What's the most important part of any restaurant? The food - and House of Thai knocks it out of the park. What else is important? Well, prices, atmosphere, and customer service. House of Thai scores big in all of these areas, too. The food and prices are like a hole in the wall place, but for once the facilities are well cared for and inviting...love this combination.
