We got the Panaeng curry beef, the pad thai, and the sweet basil chicken. Simply bursting with flavors. It was a pretty generous portion, too, so I probably could have taken some home - but I didn't want to! It was way too tasty; I had to keep eating. 

This area in particular seems to be rife with thai places - there are probably 5 or 6 within a 6 block radius. I'd love to try some of the others, too, but this one is definitely a shining star!! 

I can't wait to go back and sample more of their menu - there were so many tasty looking things.
author: Chris S.

description:
Can't say it was a special experience. I ordered the Kao Pad as I read in another review that it was great. I got the shrimp one, but I must say it was not special. The rice was kind of soggy and it lacked punch. 
My friends are vegetarian and they couldn't get most of the dishes because most contain fish oil, which was not very well communicated in the menu.
Service was friendly and place was clean.
author: Jose L.

description: I came here 3 weeks ago, and the 3 dishes we had was all very good. We ordered calamari, some house curry noodle, and red beef curry. The staff are very nice, the food came quickly but the location is in a ghetto area. As long as you are with friends or a guy, you should be safe. Just don't walk by yourself... lol
author: Christina H.

description:
I thought House of Thai was an excellent way to close out my trip to San Francisco. I was here on business for a technology conference.

I started with Thai Iced Tea. It was an interesting beverage. By for me, but if you want to try something sweet and different it might work.

I then moved to their Keaw Tod as an appetizer.  Very light, perfectly fried and absolutely delicious.  Shrimp and pork very good.  Sauce was also excellent.

My main was Pad Se-Ew with beef.  Also excellent.  Very similar to what I have had at other restaurants.  

I would overall recommend.  I paid $25 with a $4 tip for everything I had.  I thought very reasonable.  If I'm back in San Francisco, I would return if the mood for Thai is there.
author: Greg H.

description:
I'm always up for a plate of steamed chicken. No, I'm not your long-lost Chinese grandmother who head-butts you on MUNI to get a seat. I just happened to like steamed chicken with a little minced garlic and ginger oil for dipping. I'm finally recognizing that I prefer it at old-school Chinese restaurants where I can get a whole chicken cut up and served that way versus Thai restaurants where they make it with less conviction, something that became clear when I tried this place out on the busy corner of Larkin and Geary in the Tenderloin. It's a bustling place in the early evening, but I managed to secure a table quite easily.

Getting service once I sat down was more challenging, but the menu is fairly comprehensive so it took me a while to peruse it. I decided to order the $7 Por-Pier Sod, which sounded like a more carnivorous version of a spring roll since the thick rice paper wrapped Chinese sausage, egg, tofu and cucumber. I liked it enough since it had a nice crunch, although the gloopy sweet and sour tamarind sauce was ladled on far too thick to enjoy (photo: http://bit.ly/1cCGTGL). A proper peanut sauce positioned for optional dipping would have suited me just fine. For my entree, no surprise, I went for the $11 Kao Mun Kai. What is it, you ask?

Well, it turned out to be slices steamed white chicken on a mound of garlic and ginger rice. It was accompanied by a soy bean chili sauce (photo: http://bit.ly/1H6lnSJ). The reality was that there was little if any garlic or ginger in the brown rice, and the chicken was a bit dried out from being in the steamer too long. There are plenty more Thai dishes to consider here, so I wouldn't dismiss this place entirely based on my experience. It's just that based on the two dishes I had, they should consider tasting them again to continue refining the flavors. After all, the competition is pretty fierce in this neighborhood for good-tasting Thai. Lers Ros anyone?

FOOD - 3 stars...pretty average Thai dishes with steamed chicken that left me feeling meh
AMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...fairly spacious for a 'Loin restaurant with a nice view of the passing derelicts
SERVICE - 3 stars...fast and barely there
TOTAL - 3 stars...when is a house not a home?...when it's House of Thai, I guess
author: Ed U.

description: Pretty good thai food. Bursting with flavor. Good portions. Good variety. Good service. Generally prompt in getting your food out to you.
author: Carter C.

description:
Small portions, which is positive depending on how you look at it.

Pad thai is super bland though. And doesn't have peanuts, despite saying it has peanuts on the menu!! Tofu also tastes gross. If the menu had said it had tofu, I would've asked for no tofu.

edit: chicken also rubbery
author: B H.

description: I ordered via the yelp app 2 hours ago and now am unable to get in touch with the restaurant. I have not received my food and my phone call goes straight to voicemail. I saw a few complaints about length of time for delivery on here but if peed it. Do not ignore this.
author: Brendan E.

description:
Their pad-see-ew is edible but bland. I won't order from them again, but if I did, I'd avoid the beef since most of it is too tough and stringy to eat.

iThai around the corner isn't great, but it's significantly better than this.
author: Hunter L.

description:
Great thai restaurant in SF! I frequent this restaurant more than I would like to admit :)

Bonus - free delivery over $20! It is fastest to order directly from the restaurant (not through a reseller like Eat24, etc). The nice lady on the phone always quotes me one hour, but the food consistently arrives in 30 minutes (I live in the marina/cow hollow). The lady on the phone is really nice and always knows my address once I give her my phone number (love this!). Food always arrives as ordered and still hot.

#50 - Chan Pad Poo Noodle - Pad thai-like noodles that are a bit sweeter than pad thai, with crab added. It is also the peanuts which kinda sucks cause I LOVE peanuts. 3.5/5 stars.

#51 - Pad Thai Noodle - Very solid pad thai, one of favorites in the bay area (second only to White Elephant near SFO). I appreciate the tofu and healthy serving of bean sprouts that come with the dish. Also, this dish is very large, definitely two "healthy" servings...although I can usually eat almost all of it in one sitting (whoooops!). 4/5

#40 - Yellow Chicken Curry - Very good, although sometimes the chicken is overcooked and a bit dry (-1*). Wish it came with some more veggies other than just potatoes. My bf loves this dish. 4/5.

This place doesn't mess around on it's spicy scale. I usually order a "medium spicy" and it is just enough to make me need to drink water with my meal. I love spicy!
author: Amanda R.

description: I consistently order takeout from here and it is my go to place for takeout Thai. The Pad See Ew has really good flavor and the tom yum soup is also very good. Have never been in person but am eager to check it out.
author: Lukas F.

description: Cheap and good. It's not the best Thai food but it's really good for the price. I would recommend.
author: Rafael M.

description:
FREE THAI ICED TEA: CHECK-IN ON YELP! Show your server that you've checked-in!

Came here after running the Nike Women's Half Marathon. I'm not gonna lie, I was super hungry. Anything would've tasted amazing after a 13 mile run, LOL.

I played it safe and got my usual Pad Kee Mao. The beef was a bit overcooked and dry, which many Thai spots tend to do. The noodles were okay, sauce+oils made it a bit greasy and heavy. Service was decent! Nothing out of the ordinary. Overall, food and service was just OK.

There are probably better spots to eat Thai, likely would look around before coming back here.
author: Eileen L.

description: Was a bit too salty for my taste. The pumpkin curry was good but I wish they had more veggies and again, it was very salty. Overall, standard Thai.. just wasn't "wowed."
author: Monica L.

description: Food was good and service was alright but we did find a hair in our soup...they offered to comp it at that point. House of Thai really needs to work on their presentation and cleanliness because although the food was tasty, the dishes in which the foods were served weren't.
author: Emilie P.

description:
Good portion i always order the crispy pork belly with chili and basil medium is too spicy for me.
Food is great
author: Jhaydelyn E.

description:
We went to SF for a little weekend getaway to attend Bay Area Brewfest, stayed approx 4 blocks from this restaurant, we love Thai so when we found them on yelp we were sold based on reviews. 

Thankfully none of your reviews disappointed and the service, food, vibe of the restaurant, cleanliness of restaurant were all amazing. I will definitely be back when I am in the city!!
author: Cierra H.

description: Very good restaurant! We were 8 and i had the opportunity to eat many dishes ! It was excellent and not so expensive!:) i recommend it!
author: Isou Z.

description:
This is the Thai place that I came to first three years ago when I moved to SF.  I moved from Denver, Colorado, so I was ultra impressed.  Great range on the menu.  I randomly selected an appetizer, noodles and a main dish on my first visit because I was well into my apartment search and the Two-Buck Chuck.  

I'll take a break from my story to tell you, I've been back many times since.  And, it's always a good call.

I like their range.  I like their space.  And, they are still priced well.  I would love to bring a casual group of people here.  It's a great space.  But, they are very accommodating for take-out too.  I love their menu, because you can just keep looking for the perfect thing, and it's always solid.

I love their Nuer Sun Salad.  Grilled Spicy Beef.  I like their Sukiyaki and their Chan Pad Poo, both noodles and seafood.  The flavors are always fresh.  The Nuer Sun with the fresh Cucumbers and Tomatoes is great, particularly if you add their chili sauce.  I like spicy.

When I went to my first important meeting after moving here, I was told that this place was not "good Thai".  Three years later, it may be different, but I like it, and I can count on them for what I'm looking for.  It's a very accessible place to sample Thai food.
author: Adam S.

description:
I ordered delivery from house of that and it was quite disappointing. 

Chicken with eggplant: This had maybe 2 inches of oil floating on top
Streamed veggies: Overcooked 

And on top of the food not being great, they took 100 minutes or more for delivery and I live only a few blocks away. 

Very disappointed.
author: Priyanka P.

description: House of Thai is one of my favorite Thai spots in the city. The chicken and rice dish is delicious with the sauce being so ginger-y and filled with garlic flavor. The rice is nice and fatty with the perfect chew. The pork over rice is out of this world... pairs perfectly with the pickled veggies. I've also had their Tom yum noodle soup! It's not as spicy as I would like but it's packed with flavor and they are very generous with all their meats and toppings.
author: Michelle S.

description: Not many Thai places take a mortar and pestle to their hot peppers anymore, yet that one thing gives a dish so much flavor. You can tell they put in the work for a very adorable meal hear at House of Thai. Fresh Thai basil, good use of fish sauce, and some sous working over peppers make this place legit.
author: Zachary D.

description:
Hands down, the best Thai I've had in my 12+ years in San Francisco! I've tried many other Thai restaurants across the Bay Area, but none come close to this one. 

They have a terrific menu that's generally standard Thai fare that you do find everywhere else (though I wish they had dishes that featured oyster sauce, which I've come across at other places). 

Though I've tried many different menu items over the years, my favorites are the pad prik khing  with pork (pork & string beans in a spicy red chili sauce), any of the fried rices, and the tom yung goong soup (seafood lemongrass soup). They don't play around with their spices here, and I LOVE spicy food, so when you order Thai medium, just know that it's going to have a definite kick and that you'll want your water glass nearby.

Two small downsides to this place: 1) it's in sketchy area that has gotten somewhat better over the years, but is still a little gritty. No one will bother you at all, but you may have to step over a few unfortunate souls who may be in various stages of inebriated or passed out; 2) the prices have been creeping up over the years, so what actually used to be a good bargain in years past is becoming typically SF-expensive (e.g. if my large bowl of soup or rice had been around $9-$10 when I first moved here, now it's more like $13-$15). All in all, I'd still say it's worth it - the food is that good.
author: Rod V.

description: I came here just because I walked by. I looked at the menu and already was concerned because it looked like there was Chinese types of dishes on the menu so I had a feeling this was not authentic Thai food. I decided to go with the recommended dish by the waitress, duck noodle soup. I decided this place want 3 authentic, so I'd get what she recommended. I can't believe I wasted my money here, it makes me feel bad for myself. I tasted a lot of Chinese five spice in the broth. But the broth tasted bland. Then the vegetable they used was too strong. I've eaten this vegetable veggie in other dishes, but it didn't work in this soup. The whole thing was weird, it was not a good mix of flavors. My husband had the pad see ew. He says it was decent, so that's a 3/5, but portion sizes are small. We both left hungry and paid too much for what we had.
author: Kimberly P.

description:
I was craving Thai but didn't want to go out and eat. Decided to pick up House of Thai on the way home from work. Ordered thru Eat24 for pickup.

April 2013
Thai house combo ($12) http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/house-of-thai-san-francisco-2#qMpwyl7ArjETSpG9mdemPA
Pad thai (Hot) $9 http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/house-of-thai-san-francisco-2#tRwNSzNUatMkl8PHA81aiw
Gang khew-wan (A la carte) (Beef, Hot) $10 http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/house-of-thai-san-francisco-2#uW_OAOGwVaCiy7ne2U9o_w
Po tak (Hot) $11.50 http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/house-of-thai-san-francisco-2#izK3oXme9gU5_xpxjIqbMA
Pad gra-praw - A la carte (Chicken, Hot) $10 http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/house-of-thai-san-francisco-2#6Muc2DsacJIXUK9gM_ZxVg
Som tom (Salted crab, Hot) $7.50 http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/house-of-thai-san-francisco-2#qOzOQSmA9-hYU49IhTNDCg

I love papaya salad with salted crab, so I'm glad they offered this. The crab always gives it this salty fishiness that I love! Make it super spicy and I'm a happy girl! The curry however was really oily which I didn't like. And it could have been spicier. The pad thai noodles had a nice consistency and good flavor. The rest of the dishes were okay.

So my favorite dish was the papaya salad, but that's not really enough to make me come back. I may come by again if a friend wants to check it out. Maybe other dishes will be more memorable.
author: Elena N.

description: Portion sizes seem to be much smaller now.  Still delicious but not a go to spot for me anymore due to that!
author: Siv L.

description:
Great service & clean restaurant! 
Tom yum- so so. Too many ingredients in the soup. 
Chicken dish- straight boiled chicken with hot lettuce. Terrible. 
Pad Thai- I've never been a fan of pad Thai, but the friends I dined with enjoyed the dish
Salmon red Curry- DELICIOUS!!!!! Would definitely order again
Garlic rice is really yummy too!
author: Tina H.

description:
I didn't really like this place. Came here during Santa Con. Reasonably filled with Santas since it was so close to Union Square. 

Service was slow. Food was okay. Had their pad see ew. Nothing too amazing in my opinion. We also had condiments and sauce on our table that the server lady came and grabbed without saying anything and gave to another table with people. 

What if I wanted to use it? Didn't even ask me :( 

Also was dying of thirst but couldn't find anyone to ask for water.
author: Lara D.

description:
I am determined to find the best khao soi gai in the city. I have traveled to Thailand a couple of times and this is by far my favorite dish. House of Thai had khao soi gai which was a good start because most restaurants do not. It was mediocre but it was definitely lacking in spice. 

We also ordered the pad Thai which we never order and it was great. I will definitely give this place another try.

Their green curry with tofu or shrimp is amazing! 

We consistently takeout pad Thai and green curry!
author: H K.

description: I haven't eaten here in a while because I was in love with their Crispy Porkbelly dish, I was gaining some weight. So today I placed a delivery order for it because I was craving it. The two apps I ordered were good, the Thai Iced Tea was good, the Tom Yum soup was flavorless, it tasted like regular chicken soup, but more bland. The Pad See Ew which I have also had here and remember it being delicious was also devoid of flavor. The Crispy Porkbelly was very oily, had none of the delicious tasty sauce that I love and was pretty bland in flavor also. It and the Tom Yum soup were both ordered to be medium spicy, there was no spicy level to either one. I will definitely give this place another try, because the Crispy Porkbelly dish is usually so amazing, I hope today was a fluke. But next time I'll eat in so I can return it immediately if it isn't right. So sad, after 3 bites I gave up and threw it all out.
author: Jason B.

description:
Busy spot with efficient yet welcoming staff. 

Larb with roasted duck: very flavorful dish; a must. 

Pad Thai with chicken: I enjoyed the combination of the usual ingredients, this time we'll amalgamated, and not dry.

Pad kee mao with pork: tasty sauce, a good choice. 

Crispy pork belly: not a fan; the pork belly was tough. 

Overall, a good Thai restaurant with some dishes better than others. The Thai iced tea was way too sweet (and I love sweets).
author: Giacomo C.

description: I am writing this review which is not about the taste of food but the friendly customer service.  I ordered the food thru yelp but the carrier did not deliver the food on time and said that there was no access to my building.  I waited 80 minutes for my lunch and, finally, I made a call to House of Thai.  The lady was kind and told me they can re-deliver.  Well!  I was pretty upset and told her "forget my order and I want my refund".    My tone was not friendly.  But she tried to find out a solution for me.  I appreciate her friendly attitude.
author: Louise T.

description: My first time here was absolutely amazing. Trust me, the pad thai is GREAT and the transaction over Yelp Takeout was fast/easy. I came two minutes after the estimated pickup time and the food was ready & hot. Loved this place! Definitely will come back when I'm in SF.
author: Cindy R.

description:
This. Is. The. Place. Good lawd do I love spicy Thai food and House of Thai delivers on that promise...but beware, even the most brave of spicy-loving souls will likely need to take it slow.

I got the green curry with chicken, medium spicy to be cautious (comes with jasmine rice) and it is flavorful and delicious, but definitely has a stronger kick than the last time I ordered it. Also got the pad see ew made spicy and it's also quite good. Nice complimentary dish to binge watch Narcos 

Was delivered hot and timely.
author: Jackie G.

description: Horrible horrible service. Screams orders to the back while standing at the table. Everything tasted like dirty grease, even the dessert. Threw the dessert onto the table and completely  ignored us, we had to yell to get their attention more than three times.
author: Angel S.

description:
Don't order the seafood salad. 

I'm headed to Thailand in two weeks and my friend from Thailand decided to take us here. We were debating between this establishment and Sai Jai around the area, but laziness trumped. Maybe we should have walked that extra block. 

Ordered:

Tom Kha: Coconut soup with chicken breast. Chicken was overcooked and rough. 

Larb: A bit salty. Lacked depth compared to the ones I've had at Lers Ros.

Thai Sausage: I'll admit I've never had it, so I don't have much to compare it to. Flavors were good and great with rice. Only gripe was that the sausage was a bit dry and the peppers and ginger served with the meal weren't cut finely to eat with the sausage. Whole peppers and inch long ginger pieces were on the dish. My Thai friend says they're meant to be small to compliment the sausage.

Seafood Salad: I had such high hope for this, and it was such a let down. Not only did the seafood not taste fresh, but it made us sick. Nothing is worse than old fishy seafood....and to make us sick is even worse. 

Thai tea: Did the FB check in for this freebie. I probably can't complain on something that was given to me, but what the heck. It was overly sweet. I had to add most of my water to dilute it. 

With so many Thai options in the area I'll gladly walk a few blocks more for something that's better tasting and food poisoning free. As for my Thai friend... He felt terrible for taking us here.
author: Michelle C.

description:
Never again.  If you're thinking about Thai food in this neighborhood, you have MUCH better options - Basil Canteen, Lers Ros, and Sai Jai Thai to name a few.  Do yourself a favor and go to one of those instead.  Here's why:

The food:  the dishes we ordered we cold, totally bland of any flavor except for the overpowering salt, and the veggies tasted rotten.  We were both extremely ill after eating here.  If it's worth it to you to risk food poisoning, or you like living on the edge with your GI system then by all means eat here!

The service:  Without authorization, I received notification that a tip had been added to my credit card later on the same evening.  Totally unethical and disturbing business practice.  If you enjoy random fraudulent charges on your credit card, eat here!

Seriously, read the other negative reviews - many of them say similar things.  I wish I had listened!
author: Amber M.

description:
Nothing special. Nothing outta this world. Service is good. Food is just eh. Nothing memorable. Nothing to be like "I need to come here for this specific dish". 

Just some Thai on Haight lol.
author: Alaia L.

description:
Walked by this restaurant many times as I stayed near here and finally got to try the food there.
First impression is that the waitress is very friendly. When we saw the extensive menu, it is very surprisingly that there is so many types of foods choices in a Thai restaurant in United States. 
We ordered moo ka (pork leg) and stir fry egg plant with beef.
The moo ka is fantastic! Lots of tender meat and fats that melt in your mouth! Very delicious, hence I give this restaurant 4 stars.

The stir fry egg plant with beef is not delicious though. The beef is tough as leather and the dish was over and heavily seasoned. It is very very oily, salty and sweet. Just too much to take. We do not like that dish but love moo ka dish! 
Will come back and try the stir fry basil chicken and other dishes since they look very delicious.
author: Am T.

description: We always order from House of Thai when we don't want to cook at home, it's the best Thai around in my opinion.  We always get the Pad See Ew along with a fried rice.  Highly recommend!
author: Branden L.

description:
My boyfriend and I order from here pretty frequently, and it's never disappointed. The only piece of advice I would give is that everything runs on the spicier side. So if you're used to ordering food medium or hot, go for one level down. 

The pad Thai is amazing and so is the pumpkin curry, but again, be careful with the spices!
author: Megan F.

description:
Just ordered Tom Yum Noodle Soup with maximum spiciness for delivery. It was literally the best Tom Yum Noodle soup I have ever had in U.S. Very flavorful and the portion is huge as well (enough for 2 meals for me). 

I guarantee that this is truly authentic and it is probably more delicious than a lot of places you can find in Thailand as well.

[Update] Has been ordering the same noodle every weekend since then. The taste is so consistent and I was never disappointed at this. Sooo good.
author: Gott P.

description: Some of the best Thai food I've had.  The standard Pad Thai is flavorful with just the right amount of sweetness and tamarind flavor.  The fried catfish salad was also very interesting and flavorful and I highly recommend it for a textural adventure and a flavor explosion.  Service was decent - this place can really pick up and when it's full, it's hard for the waiters/waitresses to be on top of everything.  The take out portion appears much smaller, and unfortunately I had a piece of hard plastic in mine which I bit into and which is the reason for the -1 star.  But I'm sure that's a fluke..right???  Enjoy but chew before you swallow :)
author: Brandon K.

description: I had an excellent experience at the House of Thai, their Thai Iced tea was wonderful and I highly recommend the pineapple fried rice. We were sit and served super fast as well, will definitely be coming back here next time I'm in San Francisco!
author: Kelly F.

description:
I came here for lunch because of all the good review that I saw for this place. So, let me break it down for you: 
Food: 4 Star
- H O T Combo ($12): I really like this plate because you can try a variety of the appetizers. Normally, Thai restaurants don't do a sampler. Each appetizer was very unique and presentable and it also taste very good.
- Shrimp Pad Thai (11ish): Was average. Just like any other Thai place that has it.
- Tom Yum Noodle Soup ($11): This was really good. I got medium spicy. The broth was sweet and spicy. 
Service: 2 Star
Why was the service two stars, you may ask
Well, we just sat down for two minutes and the waitress came and ask what we want already. I felt kind of rush because the two waiter and waitress kept coming by and asking to take our plate, when we still have food on it.
Environment: 3 Star
The moment you open the door, a weird smell hits you. When you get seated there are gigantic flies flying around you the whole time. The restaurant although was very big, it was also very empty.
author: Irene Z.

description: One of the best papaya salads I've ever had! Same with their Thai tea. Service and food are always great.
author: Raeann L.

description:
House of Thai serves up some pretty decent Thai food. We had the golden sacks, a type of fried spring roll, and the pad thai. I have eaten better pad thai but it was still relatively good. The servers were accommodating and the food was served quickly. I wish the inside decor was better because it is a really great space. Just lacking in funky decor. 

Overall it was pretty good but I will continue searching for the best Pad Thai!
author: Aletta B.

description:
Enjoyed dinner here with friends and celebrated Akash's 21st birthday.

The Tom Yum soup was ok. Papaya salad was good but small quantities. Tofu with green beans was ok. Tofu with Japanese eggplants was not enjoyable. Tofu with other vegetables dish  was great

Overall a decent experience
author: Hemant D.

description:
We just ordered the delivery from Eat24.  And it arrived earlier than the time that they told us. 

We ordered Pad Ka prow,  kho pad name, and Kho mun gai , all were delicious.

It was very convenience and fast, maybe, it's slow night or they improve their delivery system, I am not sure. But in my case, this order was delivered so fast with fresh delicious Thai food. 

Will order online again.
author: Dom G.

description:
Friday nights are usually sushi nights, but I decided to change it up a little and try a new Thai place. This popped up on Eat24 and I thought it would be a most excellent idea. (It was.)

I ordered two curries - chicken and pumpkin. I foolishly didn't read that the chicken curry was a rice plate and accidentally ordered two extra boxes of rice. This ended up working out in the long run, because I had enough curry to last for two days and needed the rice anyway.

The curry isn't like any of the usual Thai places I go to, which leads me to believe that other Thai places are actually Americanized Thai places, which is fine. The curry here doesn't seem as creamy as others, so if that's not your thing, well, there you go. The chicken in my curry was lovely and fell apart easily from just a spoon! It wasn't the red curry I was expecting, but it was very comforting and quite filling.

The best part was that it was definitely cheaper than sushi, and the boyfriend and I had food for at least two days for just ~$30. Not bad! I'll be ordering from here again for sure.
author: Robbin A.

description: Came here with a couple of friends for lunch when we came to SF yesterday. I loved the atmosphere here, very bright and friendly. We ordered Salmon Curry, Pad Thai, and noodle. The soup of the Tom-Yum noodle is really tasty, but I feel like they put way too much meat in there. The pad Thai is alright, because it's a bit dried for me to eat. Besides the good food here, I want to commend the excellent customer service that we've gotten from a couple of outstanding employees! Always coming by to check and automatically refill our water glasses. Thank you for making my first experience here a memorable one. Def coming back to this place the next time I'm in San Fran!
author: Jen L.

description: Service was kind of slow, restaurant service was slow and overly loud. However the food itself was really good! ( i love thai food! ) we got the pad see kew and one of the cocunut curry dishes. The restaurant environment was really loud -- inhibiting our conversation, overall a positive experience however lots of things that could be better. :/
author: Peter W.

description:
Having been here a few times, I always try different things since they have a huge menu with a variety of thai dishes. I've tried the fried rice, noodle soup and red curry. They are all above average with affordable price range. As for beverage, I've had strawberry mojito which was more fruity than alcoholic, not the strongest given it was a $5 mojito but still pretty good as I personally prefer fruity drinks.

The only downside I'd say is the location, being near the heart of TL. One time a topless guy came in splashing water over the front area, and then got arrested by the police. It is still my go to Thai place in TL though.
author: Jaclyn C.

description:
I decided to bet on the odds instead of the one review I saw about a botched delivery... glad I did.

It took about an hour for my food to arrive at my hotel. House of Thai honored my request for extra sauces on the side. They also made my Pad Thai with Chicken as requested. The Spring rolls (Por-pier Park) were delicious and the Toong Yen Yung was good as well. The Pad Thai was on point! 

Why not 5 stars? Honestly trying to make the $20 minimum when ordering for yourself is a bit much and the portions are not huge. I'll take tastey over huge any day. I think a $15 minimum order would be perfect and I'd be happy to pay a $5 delivery charge instead of trying to find something else on the menu to order that covers the $2 I was missing. just my $.02 suggestion. 
Will definitely try to eat at this place in person... I bet it would be even better.
author: Neil M.

description:
This review is for UberEATS

The Pad Kee Mao arrived on time but only filled half of the container. It was extremely greasy and there were barely any rice noodles... Looking at other dine-in pictures, it seems that we got hosed. 

Not cool, House of Thai.
author: Michael L.

description: Not in the greatest of neighborhoods, but this corner Thai restaurant cooks a mean curry.  I had the green curry to be exact with chicken.  Tasty curry, ample serving, and good ingredients really hit the spot.  Service was friendly and helpful.  $12 lunch specials had lots of choices.
author: Ronny T.

description:
Excellent food, good service,good environment!! 
This restaurant is very well located, within walking distance from Union square, they are friendly and receptive even though business. I strongly recommend trying! This Thai cuisine restaurant have taste really similar to South American foods.
author: Rainiere R.

description: I am a vegetarian and had lot of options here to eat. I wasn't much hungry and so had a Green curry with Tofu and vegetables and it was amazing.
author: Ankita J.

description: Wonderful Thai restaurant. Wasn't crowded, but nicest and most flavorful food I have ever tasted. Going back here for sure...
author: M A.

description: I ordered online on a Wednesday and it took about an hour to get it to me. The pad Thai is bland and dry, but the fried rice is good. Overall, this restaurant is "okay".
author: Samantha S.

description: I only have tried this for take out! Was average, I got their cashew nut chicken - nothing special, I've had better and worse! Food was ready quickly although I was put on hold while placing order for 5mins!My experience was average, wouldn't be in a rush back but I will probably try some other items from the menu in the future
author: Anne-Marie R.

description:
BEST Thai restaurant ever !!! So delicious, cheap and clean! I ordered rise with shrimp and got big plate of it so fast! In my mind this place have to get 6 stars on Yelp! 

My friends and I recommend this restaurant  to everybody who like delicious and healthy food for good price! Cool location, clean restrooms, nice workers! The service was great!
author: Vladislav S.

description: Ordered Pad Kee Mao w/ beef and a side order of Peak Gai Tod (chicken wings). The food was excellent, and the order was ready and hot when I picked it up. Would've been 5 stars if the chicken wing pieces were separated from the tips!
author: Mario A.

description: Amazing food, lots a variety and a good price. I recommend the mint lemonade (one of the best drinks I've ever had). The pad Thai is to die for and will have you eating even when you're already full.
author: Dylan H.

description:
I had to grab a quick early lunch before my graduation at the Orpheum Theatre and this was just around the corner. I saw that it had 4 stars and being a thai restaurant I knew service would have been relatively quick.

They're pretty spacious located right on the corner of Larkin and Geary. We were seated immediately. They weren't very busy yet, which worked in my favor.

After looking through Yelp, we decided to order the Tom Yum noodle soup and the Duck Noodle Soup. The pictures and descriptions just sounded delicious. Our orders came out pretty quickly. And to our surprise the noodle soups were just delicious. The broths were rich and flavorful and full of meat and toppings. They run a close tie to each other, I tend to favor duck so the duck noodle soup wins just by a little.

Prices are real reasonable too about $10 per bowl. The bowls are decent sized too.

Service was as expected. Very quick and the waitresses were very attentive that morning.

I was very happy with what we stumbled across. I will definitely come back to try their Pork Leg Stew Noodle Soup.
author: Stephanie L.

description:
I order food through Eat24 to be delivered to my hotel. When the food arrived my drink order was not only wrong but it was half empty as the rest of it spilled in the bag. They did not give me silverware to eat my meal so I had use the cabbage it came with as a spoon. As I was eating my meal I found a bug in it!!! Needless to say, I just couldn't ignore it longer. It looked like a small roach but I am no expert. I was ok with the drink being wrong and half empty and even no silverware but bugs in my food is a no no unless I order it and that would never happen.

I did have the roti with thai ice tea ice cream which was pretty good but that could be bc they deep fry the roti. I'm not from this area and I have tried thai food in San Francisco numerous times, but it can't seem to ever compare to Thai food in LA. Don't get me wrong they mess up orders in LA all the time but the food just tastes different, MSG perhaps?
author: Luckkana M.

description: Above average I must say. I'm a huge Thai food fan. The items I order was more than enough. It was a bit drench on the noodle side ( Pad see ew and pad Thai). Service it was busy so coming around the table was average. They do have a full menu, Tv's yes. I'd get it 3.5 overall but I rounded up.
author: Dang D.

description: Tried the red curry with Rice, it was really good! Service was quick and very friendly!
author: Simon S.

description: Found this place on Yelp and decided to go in and it was pretty good I got the Pad Thai with just tofu. I liked the overall taste of the plate but the tofu was kind of dry if that makes sense. The portions are very fully tho and not that expense my plate was $10 and the hospitality was ok .
author: Cynthia R.

description: Beware of ordering delivery, the portion size is small for the price. For a $13 entree Only got a small container of food and it's not even filled. The price should've been half of the listed price for the portion size.
author: Jonmark D.

description: The food was freshly prepared after we ordered. The medium panang was hot, but not too hot. If you don't like spice, stick with the mild! The meat fell apart. The phad thai was delicious too with a side of carrot and bean sprouts. I tried the strawberry mojito...very fresh and tasty, as well as the mint lemonade.
author: Deanna R.

description: I've had delivery twice now and both times the food was highly mediocre.  The chicken noodle soup didn't come with any limes or jalapeño and the broth was not full-flavored. The pad see ew was similarly boring.  The pumpkin curry was pretty decent, but the chicken was dry and overlooked.  The yellow curry chicken had no carrots. Just chicken and potatoes. Why? Nothing terrible here, but nothing good either.
author: Tom M.

description:
Legit Soup Dishes

Another Asian restaurant on Larkin with flair!!

- FOOD, tasty
- PRICES, cheap/affordable
- SERVICE, fair
- AMBIANCE, tenderloin-ish

Inebriated from SantaCon, we walked from Polk to Larkin in search for greasy Asian food and the first restaurant we all came to agree was this spot. There were more then 10 of us and they squished 4 tables together. The other drunk 10 were nowhere to be found.

HEFER STATUS 

KAO SOY - I was so out of it, I forgot to order this. Didn't see it on the menu but it's available. Hard to find in the BayArea but heard this place is pretty good for it. I will need to come back!!! I want I want I want.

TOM YUM NOODLE SOUP ($9) - minced pork, sliced pork, pork balls, bean sprouts, chili paste, ground peanuts in a delicious chili lime soup. Oh my! Make you say Tom "YUM". Half the group ordered this. It's not the typical tum yum soup you get as a side at traditional Thai restaurants, it's a bit different. It has noodles, tons of flavor and meats, and was very filling for its price. I really liked this soup.

PAD GRA-TIEM #100 ($9) - cooked with garlic and peppers served on steamed vegetables. Very tasty, huge portions, and the vegetables were so good by itself without the rice or chicken. I could have ate the veggies by its self.

PINEAPPLE FRIED RICE - tasted typical. Looked typical. Tasty of course but typical. The pineapple pieces were huge, wish they were a bit smaller.

Pumpkin Thai Curry, other rice plates, ETC were also ordered but didn't have enough room to dabble. 

WILL I BE BACK? Yes. I must taste their Kao Soy to test it's legit ness. 

JABA APPROVED. Until the next review...
author: Jane A.

description: Fairly mediocre and bland, however we did enjoy the Tom Gha soup, but everything else was average with little spiciness. Not cheap enough to make a return visit worth it
author: bud e.

description: My new fav in the Bay Area. Pad Ke Mao, cashew nut chicken were brilliant. Will come back definitely ...
author: Vinay G.

description: Love this place. Ordered duck soup and broth was amazing. So many spices complimenting each other, and that duck really melts in your mouth. Would come here again, love this place.
author: Bee H.

description: I got the green curry, and it was very good. Ambience is decent - nothing too special. Service was fine. Good place to check out if you're in the neighborhood.
author: Vikram S.

description:
I must say that their Thai larb (duck) salad was fantastic.  When you order it up spicy, it surely is spicy.  Mix the duck meat with the sweet and sour sauce salad, then the dish is too good to not have more of!  It becomes quite an addiction.  

Their House Pork Belly over mustard greens and with your choice of brown/white rice, was good, but I, personally, didn't become a lover over it.

This place can get stuffy and hot since it is an open kitchen.  It doesn't help that the food ordered up, may be spicy and/or hot as well.  It adds to the flames and zest of Thai cuisine.

Servers were attentive.  Kudos to that. 

I will be more than willing to be sheltered under the House of Thai again.
author: Tiffany D.

description: Cute place, good beer selection food is just like every other place in Columbus below average which makes me want to cry every time I have to come here for work.
author: Khalid k.

description: My friend and I came here for dinner on a Monday night. We were seated right away but there was a wait after us. My friend got a beef salad and I got the steamed golden pompano. They steam it as a whole fish. I asked for it very spicy and it definitely was. The fish was cooked perfectly and the broth that came with it was delicious. Would definitely come here again!
author: Zainub A.

description:
Ordered delivery and it was great.

Nicely packaged in recyclable plastic containers.
Delivery guy looked unhappy, but recovered nicely with a "Happy New Year"

I love fried rice and the pork version here didn't disappoint.
Pad Thai and Cucumber Salad were good too.

$20 minimum for delivery.
author: Andrew H.

description:
House of Thai's green curry is awesome. Closest curry in the states I've had to the curry I had in Thailand. Spice levels are pretty generous so even if you're brave or a seasoned spice-girl or boy, consider for just a second longer if you really want your curry 'spicy' or even 'extra spicy'. Quality is generally consistent, though the last time I went, the curry was too sweet.

Food is really great, as is service. Servers are attentive and kind and maybe too much so since last time I went one server pointed out the giant snot hanging off my face. Which was embarrassing, but necessary. So thanks for some awesome food and more!
author: Sherry S.

description:
This place used to be Thai House Express right?!
I'm confused after spending few minutes at Yelp app, walking around few blocks, I still can't find this restaurant. Only after I asked the passerby, they told me, the restaurant changed their name. 
Few 5+ years ago the food used to be soo soo good, and after that kinda degrading, but today I'm reviewing their deep fried Calamari only. I think the calamari is the only consistent during all those years, but not the sauce tho they changed the sauce, both I like. So it doesn't matter, overall still the best calamari that I tasted so far. 

Their hot Thai tea is strong and still so flavorful.
Complementary Thai ice tea if you check in in yelp. That's nice!
Service is fast and friendly.
I'll be back to try their other menus.
author: Icey M.

description: Consistent good thai food for take away
author: Sharon M.

description: Outstanding food, very authentic and has some cool original dishes too. Try the Pumpkin Curry with chicken! Service is excellent- they really appreciate your business. The owner even bought us a round of beers because we shared that we were on our way to another Thai place and stumbled across House if Thai instead.  Can't go wrong here, give it a try.
author: Jason D.

description:
Me and the girlfriend just moved up from LA and woke up from a post-move 5 hour nap. We were starving and craving something to coat the belly before hitting up and getting to know the local bars. We were wanting a sit-down spot that was open late, so we decided to hit them up close to midnight. 

I decided to go with a classic, Pad See Ew with Chicken, my girl got the Tom Yum soup with seafood. My dish was on point, the greens were cooked perfectly, had a nice bite to them to compliment the soft noodles. The Tom Yum was delicious too, lots and lots of shrimp, mussels, scallops, etc. It was a bit spicey, made both of us choke a little, but we loved it. Finally, a thai place that packed the heat! A little different from LA. 

The Lycheetini paired nicely with the spice.

Anyways, next time we'll definitely venture out and try other things on the menu. For sure the spot to hit up!
author: Roman V.

description: The dungeness crab pad Thai is out of this world and the price is very reasonable. The noodle was perfectly cooked, the dish was perfectly seasoned. There were quite a few big chunks of crab in it. My boyfriend and I requested extremely spicy level for our pad Thai but it didn't come out as spicy as it should. However, everything just tasted so wonderful that I would not change anything about the pad Thai.
author: Catherine T.

description: Drove here with my little sister on Sunday night. We were seated by a guy right away as we walked in. We ordered a pad Thai and a Tom yum noodle soup. The pad Thai was flavorful but the sauce was just slightly too strong/thick. The Tom yum noodle soup was not bad. There was a little too much meat for my liking. Overall, I prefer the pad Thai more. The portion is a little less compared to other Thai restaurants I've been to for the price. Total came out about $30. Service is great and waiters were attentive. However, do note that they ask for tips again when you sign the receipt after they swiped your card (bill already included 18% gratitude). Just incase some may overlook the bill and wondered whether you tipped or not. I wouldn't mind paying additional few dollars for the excellent service though.
author: Sam N.

description: This place is great! The food was phenomenal. I got pad Thai and was pleasantly surprised that it was so good. Also the fried bananas and ice cream was to die for. Delivery was quick and delivery person was very nice. Would recommend and would order again!!
author: Ellie L.

description:
Don't bother!! I ordered via Eat 24 a few minutes after they opened (shouldn't have been busy) and it took an hour and a half. Eat 24 told me "Your order is ready and will leave the restaurant soon." about an hour after the food arrived. Once I got the food it was barely warm, definitely not hot, and the delivery person was pushy about me leaving a tip and never apologized for being so late. 

Other than being too spicy, the Pad Thai lacked any flavor. Boring and small portioned for the price. 

The two stars for the Tod Mun. It was very good, despite also being very cold by the time it was delivered, but I would only recommend them if dining in.
author: Maya B.

description: Great place for Thai. Food here is great tasting, especially for the price. Had the duck and also a BBQ pork. Service is also very prompt and nice.
author: Eric Z.

description: Loved this place.  Cool atmosphere.  Great Service.  Killer Food.  Great menu.  Had zero complaints about this restaurant.  Highly recommend them!
author: Jason H.

description: Food was yummy, but ambiance did not seem to match the photos.
author: Sabra M.
Wendy T.

description: Was looking for a thai place near Bill Graham since my friends and I were in the area. This place seemed a little fancy cause people claimed that they made reservations and all. However, it was nice that they took us in since they had an opening. The food was really good. I got the pad kee mao, which was very flavorful although it wasn't as spicy as I expected. Many places make pad kee mao hecka salty but this place made it just right. We got satay chicken as an appetizer, which I personally think it was a bit bland, not much flavor. We had to dig in the peanut sauce for some flavor in there. The service was okay. Overall, my experience was good.
author: Katelyn N.

description:
I swear Yelp has been steering me wrong lately. Again, with the star count - I don't understand! :(
I stopped by here a couple nights ago with my boyfriend, hungry and ready to try a new Thai spot. The place was pretty busy when we walked in - we got seated and waited way too long for a server to arrive, and even longer to order a drink. We were surprised to see the only tea thy had to offer was hot Thai tea but I will give their minted lemonade 5 stars! Delicious!

Then we move along to our food. I ordered a cucumber salad & drunken noodle. The cucumber salad came and the dressing tasted a bit off and was a little room temperature... But what really made me disappointed was the drunken noodle (which my boyfriend also ordered). It was swimming in sauce! I mean really it was like drunken noodle soup - way to heavy - I felt so nauseous from it actually in the middle of eating it. We had to chase down our waitress to get the bill. I've had way better food and service. Sorry guys, it's a pass for me!
author: Callan B.

description:
I ordered delivery from here after 3 hours of deciding what to eat for dinner. It was a very rainy night and I needed food ASAP! Mixed reviews on yelp but I went with my gut and ordered using the yelp delivery (eat24). 

The reason why I am giving this place 3 stars instead of 4 is because it took 2 hours to deliver the items. To be fair, it must have been a very busy night for them. That bing said, I will definitely order again and will update my review if it's quicker. 

The food was very tasty! I ordered the pad see ew, golden bags, and the fresh coconut water. I devoured the coconut water in less than a minute, there is also real coconut meat in the drink. Highly recommend all of the 3 items.
author: Natasha S.

description:
When my friend told me there was a Thai restaurant in the TL that was just as good as Lers Ros but without the lines, I was pretty stoked to check them out.  As much as I love Lers Ros, it sucks that they're always so busy!

Given how my friend sold me on House of Thai's typical lack of lines, it was quite ironic that we ended up having to wait about 15-20 minutes for a table (it was an abnormally busy night downtown/in the TL).  Not a big deal, but it seemed like the rest of the service went a little slow.  In particular, there was a drag before our first plate came out.  Then again, maybe we were just that hungry...

- TOONG GYEN YUNG - Minced Chicken, Onion, Carrot and Potatoes wrapped in a "Golden Bag" with Cucumber Salad...$7.00
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/house-of-thai-san-francisco-2?select=JTOkkAc_mEeocpOAh_zbWA#irdePvDg5INkeflnlVwMAQ)
My friend ordered it for the table to share since it's one of her favorites.  The "pouch" is essentially a dumpling skin that's been tied off and baked.  Kind of a neat idea, and it really was tasty, but it's not something I would crave for either.  

- KAO KA MOO - Pork Leg Stew over Rice with Special Secret Sauce...$8.00
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/house-of-thai-san-francisco-2?select=JTOkkAc_mEeocpOAh_zbWA#0luta6DtQBDq9NyJ5k8raA)
While the dish looked great (albeit seemingly smaller than in the photos on Yelp), I have mixed feelings.  The pork was amazingly tender, and the taste was pretty good.  However, it was a little heavy on the herbs, and the dipping sauce was very sweet.
 
Although I wasn't as impressed with the Pork Leg Stew as others, I did get to try their Chan Pad Poo (spicy crab noodles) and it was pretty solid.  The flavors were spot on, and they weren't kidding when they said it was spicy - just the way I like it!

Still, until I get the chance to try more of their food, I'm rounding down from THREE AND A HALF STARS for now.  The menu certainly has potential, but I feel like I can get some of these dishes elsewhere (Amphawa on Geary has a similar Chan Pad Poo, and it's both closer and easier to park by).  Plus, since I don't frequent the TL often, I'd rather head over to Lers Ros to make the trip worthwhile.
author: Mike L.

description:
Remember in the movie Selena when Chris put hot sauce all over his pizza & then couldn't eat it? Ok, am I the only one admitting to watching a movie with JLo?? So be it. Bidi bidi bom bom y'all! 

I order delivery at least once a week from here because it's so freaking good. When they say hot, it is "holy duck my mouth is on fire and will be for the rest of the night" hot. I'm a creature of habit, so if any potential kidnappers are reading this please pick from these options: wontons, wonton soup, Pad Gra-Praw and Pad Kee Mao. I'm kind of obsessed with the pad gra-praw to be honest. It definitely has the potential to be oily, so be sure to mix it up. The wonton soup here is the best I've had since moving to SF, although I wish they'd ixnay the roast pork and endless cabbage. Sometimes simple is better. 

Delivery to my 'hood (FiDi) sometimes takes a while, and my belly starts grumbling, and then I make bad life choices by eating cheese curls but I promise it is worth the wait. Honestly, I've considered ending my current lease & moving closer to this place. There is no shame in my game. 

So the TL;DR version is just eat here. And make it hot.
author: Bianca B.

description:
New year, new restaurant. So sad they no longer offer free iced tea with check-in. Still a great place for some affordable authentic good eats. Their tom yum noodle soup is still my favorite.

A tip for the hungry eaters: order an entree dish a la cart and add on a side of rice of your choice. You'll get more meat plus bonus veggies. Perfect post-workout gainz!
author: Minh N.

description: the steam fish is sooo freaky good & as spicy as I want it, sooo delicious. can be crowded at dinner time. luckily we called ahead of time & our table was ready by the time we taxi there. everything was good
author: KAY KAY L.

description: Food was good but then we both had a pretty bad stomach within 1 hour.  It's sad that in today's day and age, we're still fighting basic hygiene.
author: Satyan C.

description: Just ate here the food was great the service was a little slow but to be expected they are very busy... my only complaint was when the check came the total said $79 and as soon as they came back to collect the money for the tab they then said sorry we for got to add your drinks and dropped a new check for the total of $106.33 it's not that we could not pay it's the fact that it's there job to bring the correct check when you are ready to leave not bring you an incorrect tab to begin with
author: Ron G.

description: Got the late night munchies and this was one of the few restaurants within walking distance of the hotel. Pad see ew and beef rice noodles with an assortment of beef balls and tripe. The rice noodles were good but the pad see ew was a disappointment. Good place to satisfy your hunger but I wouldn't come here again.
author: Hana A.

description:
I ordered through Caviar and got the Tom Yum soup with vegetables and a side of ginger garlic rice. 

The Tom Yum - when I requested it be made 'spicy' I wasn't expecting they would just dump a massive amount of chili paste in it and call it a day. The broth was extremely bland, all I tasted was chili with a hint of sour. Vegetables were average. After about 30 seconds of eating it my lips were burning. I can eat spicy, but this was straight up fire water and highly lacking in flavor. I hate to waste food, eslecually food I just spent $13 on, but less than a quarter in I decided it wasn't worth the near tasteless torture and threw it out. 

The garlic rice was okay, but nothing to write home about. Adds the second star to this review and that's about it. 

Needless to say, I don't plan on ordering from here again.
author: Julie G.

description: Not good.  90 minute delivery was more like 100 minutes.  Food Luke warm.  The duck was fat and skin in cool broth.  The rolls edible but bland and boring.  The chicken dish is still pink and it appears to be a solid heart of some type of animal.  I honestly cannot identify it.  This food was not good.  Got enough in me to not feel hungry but that's probably the worst Thai food I've ever eaten.  Oh and the delivery guy demanded a tip.  I gave it to him (5 bucks) because he looked like such a bum.  But really this was one of my worst take out experiences of all time.
author: Holden C.

description: I've been here multiple times for take-out. I would say that the food is good to average, and nothing special. It works as an easy option.
author: Nathan B.

description: This place was so delicious!! I would add a food pic but it was too good and I was too hungry! Simple inside, easy to get a seat, open late, area is alright, not great but tolerable. Friendly service and very fast. Come and try this! I had the Toong Gyen Yung, and Pad Prik King with shrimp. The Toong Gyen Yung was good, your basic thai version of a samosa, but the Pad Prik King was amazing. The sauce was clearly homemade and beyond flavorful, I mean really spiced well and not overly salty. So good! I can't wait to come back and try more.
author: Stephanie J.

description:
I love Thai food and have it often.  House of Thai is not bad and I'd eat there again, but is easily in the bottom half of Thai places I've been to.  

Note that we ate at the restaurant.  Perhaps this ranks higher on the "take-out" scale, but for sit-down it wasn't great.

Biggest take aways:
  - Got beef pad see ewe.  The noodles were tasty, but the beef was very dry and bland.  Did not taste fresh or well seasoned.  I dumped chilis and curry on it to give it some flavor.  
  - Got the pumpkin curry.  Was pretty good, but still not in my top half of Thai curries.  Nothing wrong with this dish, but could have used some spice or something.  Little bit too sweet.
  - Got the rolls as appetizers.  Not great, not terrible.  
  - None of the food was spicy (maybe I could specifically request some spice?)
  -   Thai iced tea was good, really creamy.

Overview: Most of the food was middle of the road for Thai, not one dish was standout.  Beef was particularly bad for a Thai place.
author: Casey P.

description: Excellent duck fried rice! The fried rice was cooked when ordered, the duck was tender and fresh. I went there a few times while I was in San Francisco for business, I also ordered delivery, and referred this place to my colleagues which they loved it:-)
author: Dana C.

description: Very good. Had it delivered to our hotel. Delivery took a long time but the estimate was accurate and delivery lady was pleasant. I selected "spicy" for the noodle dish and that was my mistake. I love spicy food, but I suppose that does not apply to the Thai spicy scale. Typing this with ice in my mouth and burning in my chest! The food itself was good just too spicy for me. The two others I am with loved their food. We all had noodle dishes.
author: Emily C.

description: Good standard Thai food. Wasn't spectacular but was affordable, fast, and tasty.
author: Lillian V.

description:
My Thai friend recommended me this place because they have really amazing and authentic Thai food.


We ordered: 

Papaya salads (second favorite)
Fried fish appetizer (tod mun pla)
Green curry chicken (best green curry I have ever had)
Pork stew (ka moo) ( our favorite)
Minced pork

They are all super delicious! Probably the best Thai food I have ever had. I can't wait to go back again!
author: Jie C.

description:
Our family has placed over 245 orders with House of Thai.  We are regular and loyal customers.  We have eaten there, picked up orders, and had deliveries.

This evening we were subjected to non-apologetic rudeness and apathy by not one, but two employees at House of Thai.

1.  After receiving the order confirmation from Eat24, I noticed it would be  2 hours before they could deliver.  Realizing I would have to leave before then, I immediately telephoned House of Thai.
2.  I got the usual woman who answers the phone yet barely speaks or understands English.  I patiently tried to explain I needed to have the food delivered to the other family address.  She, as usual, was rude and curt.  I asked for the manager.  Spoke with a male staffer who assured me the address would be changed.
3.   I wrote to Eat24 and explained I had changed the address.  All of this within the first couple of minutes of placing the initial order.
4.  Eat24 also contacted House of Thai and were assured that the updated address was noted.
5.  After waiting over two hours, no food.
6.  I phoned House of Thai.  Got yelled at and berated repeatedly that their driver was at the original address and there was no answer.  *sigh*
7.  Instead of acknowledging that both Eat24 and I had contacted them, and that they had indeed confirmed the address change with both of us, the again non-able-to-communicate-properly woman was unprofessional and rude.  I asked for the manager, and she continued to yell at me.  Then she kept repeating loud enough for me to hear and making fun of my voice,  "I want the manager now".  That's not how you treat people lady!  Its not my fault you don't speak or understand English properly, and its just plain rude to make fun of people, especially when you are the one who erred.  Everyone in this family has been more than patient and understanding despite your many, many mess ups of orders.  You see, we believe in the adage "treat people the way you want to be treated."
8.  A different person, calling herself the manager then came on the phone and continued berating me for not being at the first address.  She was even ruder.   She said the place was busy and noisy and she couldn't hear me.  When I suggested she go to a quiet part where she could hear, it made her even more irate.
9. The order for tonight was a large, expensive one.  Now, thanks to your rude employees, we will not be ordering, coming in, or suggesting your restaurant again.  There are many wonderful Thai places in our fine city.  You have lost our loyalty.
10.  And finally, we fully understand that not everyone speaks English.  Not everyone in our family does either.  Our diversity of people is one of the things that help make America such a great nation.  You should not have a person who cannot adequately communicate by phone (both with lack of language skills and unprofessional behavior) ever answering the phone.
author: Alex C.

description: So we saw this place from our hotel room (carlton) this place is the spot. I ordered the cashew nut. Amazing. My husband ordered the pad thai and he loved it.  The flavors are on the spot and the service is fast!
author: Claudia M.

description: Even though it gets busy there, never once had bad service or slow service. Parking is a bitch but its worth the food. Yummy and tasty food. Will continue to come. My fav is number 16 naked lady
author: Tran T.

description:
This place is aweful!! Do not order here!! 

Service was beyond terrible!!! 2 hours for food to be delivered to a 0.2 mile destination. 

 They hung up on us 2 times!!!!  

The man who delivered the food told us "fuck you" even after being 2 hours late!!!

Just awful service!! Very disappointing! !
NO STAR!!!!
author: Bernard A.

description:
I heard a lot about this restaurant and i have been there twice ; the food is just ok i was served rice with shrimp that was almost cold, the host have the worst customer service and is very vulgar and unwelcoming also the kitchen are the rudest i will never go to this restaurant ever again.
If are looking for a nice customer service i ensure u this stuff is 1/ 10 they can ruin your beautiful day with their attitude!especially if you are just picking up food.
author: Sandy J.

description: Food is pretty good. We were actually looking for a Vietnamese restaurant to dine in, but a couple of them decided to close without informing Yelp. One Vietnamese sandwich shop was open, but violated all health regulations on the list which includes handle money, then making a sandwich with no gloves. I was so grossed out so we went to the Thai restaurant next door and it turned out to be very good. The staff are not too friendly. They wouldn't refill your water after they brought you the food.
author: Twee W.

description:
This is another great experience I had in San Francisco. Our hotel was near this Thai restaurant and Yelp did it again with the great find. 


We had fried rice and the pad kee Mao and it was so good.  I have a go to place in my hometown but this place beats it.

I took it take out and it was delicious! The open kitchen gave me access to look at all the native cooks that were working so it's not Thai food cooked by non Thais. Great overall. 


One thing I have to point out tho, they were a little slow with the cooking and wait time  but well worth it.
author: Andrew C.

description: RUDE DELIVERY MAN, COLD FOOD, AND NO UTENSILS! . ordered for delivery to a hotel a block down the street. After the delivery man calls me to come down to the lobby and run down. I meet him and he does not greet me and hands me the food. I proceeded to talk to him but he turns around and sushes me with a rude hand gesture and walks away without letting me finish what I was going to say. I proceeded to say hey I left a tip online however.... If he would have been respectful and let me finish I was about to say... here is a little extra tip for the delivery. I suppose in retrospect it was a good thing he was rude and took off since obviously that attitude does not deserve a tip. check ur delivery boys attitude. As for the food. COLD!
author: Eddie J.

description:
This place is awesome. I live just araound the corner and I order take out from this place maybe once a week. 
I usually get the Pad Thai or the Pad Kee Mao. 
I can't really say much about customer service as I always take it to-go, but when I come to pay I'm always greeted with a smile(:
author: Abe B.

description: Great service and food! The homemade drinks were way too sweet!! I didn't like the cubed cut chicken in my Pad thai but that's my preference. The duck and rice were good but I think if the dish came with a veggie on the side, it would've balanced out better. The roti and coconut dessert was good but hard to cut and tastes similar to a funnel cake. Overall, food was good. I will def be coming back!
author: Noor S.

description: The yellow curry chicken with potatoes are the best. Also the minced beef with basil and spice over rice. Service is prompt and courteous. There have been the slow periods of the restaurant where you begin to wonder if anyone even works here. However, very rarely will you get that kind of service during rush hours, lunch and dinner around 6:00-8:00 (as far as I know).
author: L L.

description:
I think I've probably come here (Thai House Express) at least 50+ times over the course of the past 6 years. I'd have to say this is my favorite restaurant in SF for a quick relaxing meal. Their food is top notch, they bring it out quicker than any other sit-down restaurant I've ever been to. It's usually piping hot, almost too hot to eat but the fact that it's right there in front of you within minutes is great. Their meat is always cooked perfectly and their veggies always fresh. Servings are plentiful and the drinks are great and strong as well. 

The atmosphere here is really great. Nice spacious seating, and even on the busiest of nights I don't think I've EVER waited for a table here. it's a very relaxing place, one of the only places where I feel totally comfortable just sitting down and enjoying a meal alone. 

My only complaint is that the service has had its' ups and downs over the years but its' never been bad enough to scare me off. Also, as often and for as long as I've been coming, they've still not really come to recognize me or hook me up with any free drinks or anything so don't expect any special treatment if you plan on making this your regular spot.
author: Dan D.

description: Food is great. But no utensil for delivery to a hotel room was an unpleasant surprise.
author: Yasuko T.

description: Went with 7 friends. We ordered4 pad thai's, 3 coconut curries with beef, mango rice and deep fried banana tempura. So two key things here: 1. We were all STUFFED, 2. We each paid $16.5 (including tip) for DELICIOUS food. Also, this place is very well kept and clean. Bathrooms are also clean and renovated (in other words, this is not a dive joint or hole in the wall). Definitely coming back!!
author: Anisa M.

description:
4.5 stars!
 I went to Hawaii for a week and the food there were so so so disgusting, then my first meal at late night after landing to San Francisco was in here, we were almost cried.
Had stir fried basil chicken and beef noodle soup
Excellent!! 
If I didn't go to Hawaii, this place would still worth 4 stars +!
author: Angus L.

description:
Update:

FRAUD - just got notified by EAT24 updated email; so the delivery guy altered my signed receipt and change the tips amount from $0 to $4. I have elevated this to EAT24 and may file a fraud against it since it is very illegal to altered any signed receipts.
author: Hunter S.

description:
Dont eat Tom Yum Seafood Here, so expensive 2 small prawns, small calamari and 2 mussels.
Just mushroom and soup wtf.
Taste so so not real Thai Tom Yum flavor.
author: Mojo J.

description: This was the best duck and rice dish I have ever had. It was well marinated and cooked very nicely. They also had a great chili sauce on the side.
author: John E.

description:
Ordered a batted fried fish with plum sauce. For my taste, it turned out to be too sweet. 
We also ordered a tofu entree which didn't have any sauce in it which is served with rice. Overall a very mediocre experience. Will try something else next time and update review.
author: Neil S.

description: Ordered delivery before from this place, which attract me to their local resultant. The food here is actually not as good as the delivery. Ordered pad Thai and the coconut soup with chicken for dinner, which is the traditional Thai food. The service is actually good and I like the restroom design a lot .
author: Peizhi Z.

description:
This neighborhood of SF has the highest density of Thai restaurants among all the places I've lived in. House of Thai has become the one I eat at most frequently.

It's not because of the quality of the food. The food's fine, but there are other Thai restaurants within a couple of blocks whose food is flat-out excellent. ('Flat-out excellent' outranks 'fine', in case you're not keeping track.) But House of Thai is *convenient*. It's nearby, it's open till midnight, and it's on EAT24, so I can order online and go pick it up, rather than spending ten minutes there playing with my phone while they cook my food.

The food, as I said, is fine, but it does have one other thing going for it: variety. In addition to all the usual Thai restaurant staples, this place has a few slightly less common options on the menu, such as khao soi, khao man gai, and phad pong garee (try it with shrimp or catfish).

Most entrees can be ordered as a rice plate for $10+, in a lunch-sized portion, or a la carte for a couple of bucks more (larger portion, but doesn't include rice). In more ways than one, House of Thai is right in between the little hole-in-the-wall places (Sai Jai, Zen Yai) and needlessly fancy sit-down places (Lers Ros, Osha).
author: Nath A.

description: This is my go to place when I'm in SF shopping around Union Square. The only complaint about this place is the area it's located in. It's on the corner and that's great to locate but the surrounding area has a lot of homeless, questionable characters. There's yucky businesses around but that's typical SF for you. It's great location if you love people watching. It hasn't stopped me from going there though! They have excellent food! I have had the papaya salad, beef noodle soup, duck noodle soup, pad see ew, yum soon sen, curry soup, sausage fried rice, amongst other things. My favorite is the crispy fried pork belly over Chinese broccoli over rice. It's so tasty and cooked to perfection! You usually could get seating easily. The plus side is they open pretty late too! It's not a nice, fancy restaurant. I consider it kind of a whole in the wall with amazing service and amazing food!
author: Jen S.

description: Good but not spectacular. The ambiance is nice, but loud as the kitchen is open to the dining room. If you're getting take-out, there are cheaper options in the neighborhood that are just as good.
author: Lara H.

description:
My first Thai food meal and review in 3 years. You can tell many of you know I'm not a Thai food eater. I guess I know why many of my admirers simply would not go out with me, because I am an "extremely fussy" eater! 

What makes me decide to eat Thai cuisines? My date loves Thai food!

Also, if she jumps off the bridge, I join her too. 

But when I do crave for Thai food, it would be curry. I ordered the #45:  Pumpkin Curry with a choice of meat. I chose chicken. The featured $10.00 entrée had a thick pumpkin puree mixed with Thai spices, basil and bell peppers. I also get a side of Brown rice with my entrée. I love this entrée very much. But you know, I infrequently eat Thai food and know little of other places that can make a better dish than here. My meal: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/vKBW6SWFrIYXW1kIOFY_Ng?select=P6sv788Nl5IKGZ1DUiX-Ug#P6sv788Nl5IKGZ1DUiX-Ug

My date ordered the popular Pad Se Ew. The $8.00 pasta dish has stir-fry thick rice noodle, chicken (or your choice of meat or vegetarian), Chinese broccoli, eggs, soy sauce, scramble egg and spices. She noticed a funky taste on the Chinese broccoli. And that funky taste that I tasted was the bad batch of the vegetable. She scraped all the vegetables aside and ate the rest of the dish.  Her dish: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/vKBW6SWFrIYXW1kIOFY_Ng?select=P6sv788Nl5IKGZ1DUiX-Ug#ASiG8zxw1oifbjTwZKVMvg 

I also ordered the Strawberry Soju Mojito. For $5.00 the drink has a strawberry puree mixed with the Korean wine with a mint-leaf garnish. This is a very refreshing drink and good enough to get the night going with your date =P 

My drink: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/vKBW6SWFrIYXW1kIOFY_Ng?select=P6sv788Nl5IKGZ1DUiX-Ug#qA-EqR5ksNaY-B-JjsFoSg

Despite the restaurant is located in the jagged Tenderloin location, this restaurant is somewhat clean. The cute lady workers were very nice to us. Joe Cool did a good job in not eyeing the lady workers often. 

My first Thai food in many years did not disappoint. I would definitely come here again for the curries and hopefully the workers would correct the minor problem with my date's dish.
author: Matt G.

description: Always stop here when I'm in the city! It's my go-to Thai restaurant. I love how they give u the option of how spicy or mild you want your food
author: Ellie O.

description:
I am a big fan of Thai foods and Thai House is my favorite place so far! Totally love this restaurant! The foods are so delicious that keeps me going back there. 

Their location is not great cuz they are in the tenderloin (safe though), and sometimes I have random guys asking me for money when I parked and walked out of my car. I still like to go there during lunch time cuz parking is easier in the afternoon on Larkin! 

My top favorites are: 
Appetizer: Golden Bags
Rice: Pineapple fried rice
Entrees: Pumpkin Curry! (I give a five star for this entree), Pad Kee Mao, Minced chicken with lots of basil! 

Have been going there for several years and it doesn't disappoint so far.

Would recommend folks who are looking for a delicious and not-too-expensive Thai foods.
author: Lena H.

description: We love House of Thai! We've never had a bad meal here, in either delivery or in-person. We've had almost everything on the menu - I can't even provide a recommendation, other than if you're hungry, order or get yourself here. Service is quick, and your belly will thank you.
author: Jenny K.

description: Amazing food, service is second to none, and employees are always making sure to go above and beyond to ensure happy customers! My favorite place in the city hands down
author: Elizabeth W.

description: This place never disappoints! I love ordering takeout from here and sitting in the window with a beer people watching while I wait. Although, I never have to wait too long since they're always pretty quick with the prep (around 10-15 minutes, every time). The food is great, and so is the service - very friendly, and always willing to accommodate :).
author: Stephanie S.

description: Probably one of the top 5 Thai places in SF. They have great menu items, some very traditional and you can't find other Americanized Thai places BUT no Kao Soi which is one of my favorite dishes. The food here never disappoints and it's probably the one I order most for delivery!
author: Brittini S.

description:
I tried ordering delivery from them tonight... after an hour, the delivery person called and said he was downstairs. I went down and ended up waiting 20 minutes, he never showed up. I then contacted the restaurant, there was no explanation, they just asked if I wanted redelivery. WTF?

The food is okay... when they decide to actually deliver it.
author: Reece W.

description:
Before I ordered through eat24 I decided to check this place out on yelp. At 4 stars with over 800 reviews I thought it seemed solid. I read a review where someone was complaining about the delivery person and I thought, someone had a bad experience and may be over exaggerating. He was not. 

The delivery guy called me as he was about to arrive-"this is delivery, please come downstairs and meet me, I am almost there", I responded with "uh no you can call the keypad and I will buzz you in" he let out a ugh and a sigh but agreed. Dude, I already tipped you 15% on my order and you are going to make me come down in my pajamas? Ever wonder why people order delivery sometimes? Because they don't want to go out in the world. 

He calls again once he is here. This time he is claiming the buzzer doesn't work. I said to him "nope, it works, try again". Thankfully someone was leaving at the moment so he got in. The keypad is not anything state of the art by any means...

When he gets out of the elevator he hands me my food and I tell him "you know, when people tip you, you shouldn't make them come down to you. It's rude" he looked at me like he couldn't believe that I actually said something to him. He was shocked. And I am never ordering from this place again. I really don't want to have to deal with that BS every time I want to order from them. 

There are plenty of other Thai spots in the city. 

Lastly, my green curry had good flavor but the veggies were cooked down to mush and the chicken was dry, dry, dry. My boyfriends rice noodle dish was swimming in oil as if it were oil soup...
author: Sarah M.

description:
i had catfish larb and it was oversalted, lemongrass was too hard/woody and the whole thing didnt taste like larb should taste.  it was so salty, i still have a dry mouth 4h later

then we had a fried noodle dish, which had far too much soy sauce in there.
author: joerg s.
