description: Returned over the first weekend in January with a visiting  friend for lunch. A rainy and cold day. I chose the Pork Leg Noodles soup....delicious and filling.  I didn't check back on the curry in my previous review, but I can only say I would order this dish again.
author: Laura A.

description:
I love this place. A reliable thai restaurant in lower knob hill/tenderloin.

Does all your favourites and then some. Their delivery service is good too.
author: Emma D.

description: I ordered food to go. The food was such small portions. I ordered Tom kha and the employee did not place spoons in the bag. I asked for some spoons and with attitude she said they are in the bag. I showed her that she only placed forks she was upset and felt forced to give me 2 plastic spoons. Horrible service. There are so many great places for Thai in SF never returning here. Overpriced
author: Princess Jasmine J.

description:
Hard to beat a free thai tea when you check in! Still looking for a go-to Thai place in the city, but I'd definitely come back here.

+ Good food. Had an item off the special menu and tried the girlfriend's pad thai. No complaints at all.
+ TV with sports. Went on a Saturday and they had college football on.
- Prices seemed a bit on the high side of the average range of places I've tried. Not saying it's expensive here and still thought I got a good value for what I had.
author: John H.

description: Never been in, but have ordered delivery several times. Most often get some variation of the pumpkin curry with brown rice. It's da besst!
author: David C.

description: Visiting over the weekend and wanted delivery to our hotel since we were exhausted from site seeing. Ordered online with Yelp Eats. We called to get delivery time and they said an hour and a half! It's less than 10 minutes away from our hotel. We called a few other places and found a shorter delivery time so called back to cancel our order (this all took place less than 5 minutes of placing our order online). When we called back, she said we couldn't cancel because our food was already ready. Then she said our delivery was going be delivered  in half an hour. How could our 4 dishes be ready that quickly and then be waiting around for delivery? Were they planning to deliver us cold food? And how did the delivery time change? She then told us we can cancel online and hung up on us. Unfortunately she didn't give us her name but she was extremely rude and we will not try to eat here again.
author: C M.

description:
My favorite Thai dish in the world (er.. in the world of Thai cuisine) is khao soi. Sometimes spelled kao soi, or khao soy, or some variation. Long story short, their version is pretty good. It's like curry, and noodles and some crispy noodles, and sometimes pickled stuff, all thrown into a bowl and served up for your eating pleasure.

The folks at House of Thai are pretty slick. Our food came out quick. The ambiance isn't much, in fact it feels a little corporate and strip-mally, but I don't hold that against them.

Since you have to make hay while the sun shines, we split this dish before going on to dinner number two, so I wish I had more to go off of. But that fact that I'd like to try more of their dishes is a good sign.
author: Jeffrey S.

description: House of Thai/Thai House Express in the Tenderloin is one of the most consistent Thai Street/Casual Thai food place that keeps their taste true to the motherland in San Francisco. I'm picky with my Thai Food having spent time there eating the real deal and since my college years when this place used to be called Thai House Express and before Twitter moved into the background, I know I can always count on getting a good plate of "pad" whatever at this establishment. I really do hope House of Thai keeps on keeping on being true to what it is serving.
author: Taffany H.

description:
Ok so I love this place I'm a creature of habit so I'm gradually trying new things but the  pineapple friend rice wonton soup and pad sent eww are awesome. 

I use eat24 it takes about an hour because they're pretty busy but it's great food. I'll try to update the review as I explore the menu
author: Kitt B.

description: The food from this place is so very fresh I could not believe it. I ordered delivery at 10:30pm at my hotel through the Yelp app, it gave him the wrong location, and he still found me without being upset. Very nice delivery guy, very nice phone guy, very nice experience so far, I'm so sorry I had trouble understanding your accent. The food was amazing, it tasted so fresh like they grew it where I'm from. The amount of food I got for the price was fantastic! I ordered duck noodle soup, silver noodles, and cucumber salad. Would eat again if you delivered to Flagstaff! Thank you for a full tummy and a good nights rest.
author: Crystal R.

description:
Fair and square, these guys win the 5-star update.

The kao soi dish continues to kill it. Pineapple fried rice with beef is a nice substitute for kao soi when I'm feeling too predictable. And the sticky rice with egg custard dessert continues to derail any no-sweets regimen I've subscribed to.

Your delivery is in good hands with House of Thai, because they're generally fast and the packaging is solid and leak-proof. Is this love? You know, I think it just may be.
author: Jelena Z.

description:
I have ordered delivery from this place before from a friends house,food was really good Tum Yum was spicy but delish and their fried rice with extra veggies is one of the best! 
Tonight I made a mistake, just moved and put 6th st as my address instead of 6th ave! Whoops 6th street is on the almost complete opposite side of the city I felt so bad but the guy was so incredibly nice about it even though technically this address they don't even deliver to! said it would take awhile to get to me but made it here in a jiffy! Food was still hot and just as good as the last time I ordered! Thank you!
author: Mary R.

description: This restaurant's ambiance definitely attracts aesthetic eyes! Very modern decor. It is located on the corner and stands out among other businesses on that street. I came with a group of friends for a late lunch and we were seated right away. Most of us ordered the pad thai. It was on the sweeter side and wasn't as spicy as I am used to. However, the portion did fill us quite satisfyingly, and for a relatively good price of $10! As for customer service, they definitely deserve the 5 stars. Most restaurants wouldn't split the bill for each person especially with a big party, but they were willing to do that for us due to our circumstances, which we greatly appreciate. I would recommend giving this restaurant a try if you're ever in the area and craving some thai food :)
author: Vivian T.

description: We ordered pad Thai and pad see ewe for delivery and were quoted an hour and ten minutes. Cool, but not only did it take close to 2 hours but our food was COLD and the pad see ewe was sooo bland. The beef in the pad see ewe was tough and so dry. Definitely very disappointed since this place has so many "good" reviews. We were really hungry by the time we got our food and it was barely decent. Not ordering from here again.
author: J L.

description: Food was ok.  Convenience was a key driver in our decision.  They delivered, met their timeline, and food was fine.  As with any delivered food, just not as freshly prepared as dining in the restaurant.
author: Steffanie S.

description: We got the good delivered to home using Eat 24 . Pad Thai felt like eggs were not cooked fully and tasted bad
author: Yuva m.

description:
My fiance lives right by this joint and talked me into ordering in from here, even though I can't stand Thai food (or so I thought).  

I ordered the Tom Yum and my fiance got the Pad Se Ew, and we got the Papaya Salad to share.  Needless to say we BOTH loved our dishes, and the Papaya Salad and the rest is history as they say.  

We frequently order take out from this place now, and I have tried quite a few different selections from their menu and have always been pleased.  Definitely a place to hit up if you're in the neighborhood.  One of these days we want to try their $11 lunch special (Dine in Only) which includes an appetizer, soup, salad, and and an entree or something along those lines.  For $11 not a bad deal at ALL, if you ask me.  
  
Give this place a shot, it's worth it!
author: Morgan B.

description: We were visiting from LA and i would say the best food we had in San Fran was definitely House of Thai! We had the coconut soup, the tom yum soup, chicken curry which was absolutely delicious & chicken fried rice. Everything was great, fresh & delicious. I would highly recommend this place for some bomb Thai food. Oh!!! And the service was exceptional!
author: Dal Z.

description:
2nd time to THE I tried the Five-spice duck noodle soup $9 with wide rice noodle.  I thought the duck was dry, soup was very salty, noodles were ok, not the best I've had.

Service was pretty good.  Water was refilled at other tables, my glass was never empty.

I wanted to try the New Dessert I saw a sign for: Coconut Jelly $3, but I was too full from my dish.

Charged it.

Separate bathrooms (you need a key) both upstairs.

Hrs: Daily Noon to Midnight!
author: Ann L.

description:
On Wednesday, 4/2, I visited this establishment for the 2nd time.  I was with two business associates and we needed a really good quick lunch.  We started our meal off with the Tom Yum soup.  It was amazing.  I love soups and can critique any soup to death.  However, this divey joint in the Tenderloin has killer Tom Yum soup.  Wow!

While my business friends had Pad Thai I continued my soup fetish with their house special wonton.  Yum! Yum! Yum!  Tons of noodles, pork balls, veggies - wow!  I was very happy.

What a great lunch.  Only my second trip here; however, I shall return again and again.

Folks whom work here are very nice.  I like the place.  Don't change a thing and I shall return.
author: Jay A.

description: This is my favorite thai place in SF. Not to pricey and the food is amazing. But the wait staff is very hit and miss. Highly recommended.
author: Alli N.

description: I ordered a coconut milk soup with tofu in it, but it wasn't so good compared to what I've tried at other Thai restaurant before. It tasted too sour.
author: Liang L.

description:
I placed an online order for delivery, and was quoted 1 hour delivery times at first, but was pleasantly surprised with a knock on my door within 35 minutes.

Pad See-ew was good, a bit salty but satisfying and spicy enough. Tom Yum also had great flavour, balanced amount of cilantro and lemongrass. I'd be happy to order from there again.
author: Jordan W.

description:
I have never had anything here that wasnt AMAZING. 

Tom Yum soup- on point
Red curry- on point
Beef Jerky (appetizer)- undoubtedly the most delicious thing I've ever tasted. It's incredible. 
Spring rolls- pretty awesome
Mango Mojito- mmmmmmmmm

By far my favorite thai in san francisco. It's simply the best.
author: Hannah B.

description: Great Thai place.  Very fast and friendly service.  Worth a try if you like Thai!!!  The neighborhood is a little sketchy, but I like the mix.
author: Randall S. B.

description:
Always quality. 
Great service.
Great food.
Great prices.
Horrible location.

Solid.

I've been here a few times and although the ambiance is nothing special, it's the heart of the TL after all, the food is really good. I need to go here more often and so do you.  

Thai Chicken Basil - Great!
Pumpkin Curry with Chicken - Great
Green Curry Chicken - Great
author: Justin S.

description: Awesome Thai food! Ordered #54,#55 on a holiday for a delivery and were told to expect delivery in 1 hour and 15 min. To our surprise food was delivered within 35 minutes, deliciously prepared, nicely packaged and hot. Great service! Highly recommended!
author: Aleksandra R.

description: One of the best thai places in the city (: the pad thai is soo good! The service is awesome and theyre usually really fast!
author: Nicolette T.

description: Here we go.  I know people are passionate about their Thai food.  This restaurant seems to use fresh ingredients.  We ordered the fresh rolls as an appetizer, they were different.  Tasty, but the sweet and sour tamarind sauce was overpowering for us.  Pra ram with chicken was good.  We had an order of pad Thai which was pretty standard.  Service was good and the atmosphere was modern and not loud.  I don't think we will come back just because it was just decent Thai food, but nothing to go out of our way for.  The walk from Union Square is a little dicey at times, you might want to Uber if you're not in the neighborhood.  Prices were reasonable for the city.
author: Rob C.

description: The food is good, but the service is very poor. They made a big deal about splitting a check for 6 people on a slow night. The waiter gave us a self righteous lecture about how we inconvenienced them. To top it off, they charged is an 18% gratuity. I like my food salty, not my service!
author: Rachael D.

description: This place hit the spot. I was craving a spicy chicken curry and that's what I got! The curry sauce had good flavor and there was plenty of veggies and chicken in it. I liked that they offered brown rice as well.
author: Kelly G.

description:
Great Thai food ever, this is a real test of Thai always remind me of Bangkok city. 
Thanks
author: Yudany J.

description: The food is amazing and the price is too!!! I highly recommend the papaya salad and the chan pad pu!My boyfriend and I wrapped up the night with two  scoops of their green tea and vanilla ice cream and it was heavenly. If you're debating on whether or not to eat here just do it you won't be disappointed.
author: Daniela A.

description:
Pork stew over garlic rice at a Thai place? I love trying new food and this was an unexpected dish to find at a Thai restaurant. It tastes really similar to the Taiwanese style pork stew rice, albeit missing a few extra ingredients but close enough!

Also tried the duck larb salad for the first time which was absolutely delicious besides the burning sensation from a spicy level higher than what I'm used to. A great alternative to eating the usual papaya salad found at most places.

Service was friendly and quick, place looked cleaner than most dingy Thai restaurants in the TL too and you'll notice that they're more "upscale" than other hole in the walls due to better plating.
author: Steven C.

description: Delivery was hot & fast. Both the pad Thai and the fried rice were swimming in oil. Great as a hangover treatment, but a recipe for indigestion when eaten at night.
author: Ashley S.

description: Very loud. We could barely talk to the people next to us let alone someone two feet away across the table. Food was pretty good, but somewhat tasteless. Good Thai iced tea.
author: K K.

description: Just spicy enough and attention to detail with all substitutions made perfectly.  Fast service with prompt service. Enjoyed the football on the large screen tv while waiting for my food to be ready.
author: Nilu S.

description:
Great food.
Watch out, medium spicy means very spicy.
author: Javier R.

description:
I swore I wrote a review for this place before. I compare this place with King of Thai and Osha Thai. This place is trying to be nicer than King of Thai by wanting to be an Osha Thai. They are far from being an Osha Thai since their place isn't that clean and their waitresses are not that nice. 

 So I would say they are more of a King of Thai with closer to Osha Thai prices.
author: M C.

description: Lifesavers!! After a busy day this is one of the few places open later in SF that has food you'd actually enjoy.
author: Ibi S.

description:
**3.5**

Pretty solid Thai food - fast, too. Pumpkin curry was probably my favorite, more so than the pad see ew and pad thai.  Also, there's a  free Thai iced tea with Yelp check-in. 

There's no real ambiance here, almost resembling a diner. It's also located in the Tenderloin, which isn't the most appealing neighborhood. Still, a good place to just grab some grub if you're with 3 hungry girlfriends post workout.
author: Diana K.

description:
EXCELLENT FOOD!!!
After 6 years in this city have finally found one that does it right!  Great choices for vegetarians like myself.  Can't speak of their meats because I don't eat abused animals.
author: Lynne P.

description: Great food. Would recommend pad thai and chicken on rice. Got our delivery within a hour.
author: Alliv S.

description:
To start with for those not from San Fran this is a dicey neighborhood.  Use caution walking in the area.  Decided to venture from a local hotel to this restaurant after reading good reviews on Yelp but it was not a pleasant walk.

I didn't hate it but won't go back.  First impression the air in the place is heavy with a cooking oil smell and feel.  I felt like every surface was coated in this oily substance.  Didn't care for the appetizer I ordered but I am willing to write this off to personal taste.  

I had red curry for my entree.  The chicken in the curry tasted a little off to me but I did eat the rice and the veggies and they were very good.  With all the great choices in San Fran I would say go elsewhere.
author: Jeanne T.

description:
I would give them a five star just for making food as spicy as I wanted. Most restaurants, I find, refrain from the unadulterated capsaicin levels found in the cuisines native country; and to be able to make it that spicy while not losing any of the underlying flavours. Bravo!!
The food? I had the sausage which was good. Better than any store bought franks, hotdogs, kheilbasa and whatnot.
Main course was the Pad See Ew, perfectly spicy, perfectly cooked noodles for once, flavour not drowned by soy sauce, the chicken was freshly cooked and not dry ( gasp ), and oh did I say spicy??
author: Aryan N.

description:
Yikes.  Ordered delivery from Seamless.  

Pros:
Kao Pad Goong Pong-Ga-Ree Fried Rice was delicious.  Perfectly flavored.


Cons:
Tom Yum Noodle Soup. Lots of oil on top. Kind of gross and a little bit too sweet.

WORST:
Ordered a "Fresh Coconut Juice" and got a bag of frozen coconut juice fresh from your local Marina Foods (see picture)
author: Traveling Tasters I.

description: Great and inexpensive local thai place. Chicken pad see ew was on point, and a meal for two came in at under $25. Servers were friendly and the food arrived quickly. Ambiance is nothing special, but this is a great spot for a casual bite.
author: Jai S.

description:
Ordered delivery from here because I heard it rivaled Lers Ros and was hoping for a shorter delivery time.  Unfortunately, their wait for delivery seems to be about the same - I believe it was an hour and 15 minutes.  The papaya salad was good but smaller and not quite as spicy as I'm used to.  Pumpkin red curry was tasty and came with plenty of veggies and pumpkin.  It could definitely have been spicier tho.  Overall I think Lers Ros is better and given the comparable wait times would choose the former in a heartbeat. 

Caveat- this place is way better than your average Thai restaurant in SF or other cities - I am just spoiled when it comes to Thai food.
author: Andrea L.

description:
Delivery took 75 minutes (as estimated) but it worth it! food was fresh and accurate!
I ordered the papaya salad added fresh shrimps for 1$, was perfect!!!
for my main dish I tried the Pad Gra Tiem with chicken & tofu, it wasn't the best thai I've ever eaten but certainly worth every penny !
author: Inbal M.

description:
An hour and half for delivery on a Monday night, nothing is worth waiting that long for. And our order said it was out for delivery 20
Min after we ordered. Will never order from here again!!!!!
author: Pamela R.

description: Pretty good thai food, service wasn't anything to write home about and nobody seemed especially polite.  Prices seemed a tad high but not out of the ballpark.
author: Rob M.

description:
Came here after reading all the rave reviews.  Not particularly blown away by this place.  it does the job, but I wasn't wow'd by it like how everyone else loves it.  I'm not going to give up on this place and I will give it another try.  I did order what seems to be the favorites like the Tom Yum noodle soup and the Crispy Pork belly with green beans.  The Tom Yum didn't have that flavor I wanted.  I guess it didn't have quite the tartness that I'm use to with the hot/sour soup.  The pork belly was tasty though, but it wasn't crispy by any means.  

The decor of this place is more like a cafeteria than a restaurant given the open style kitchen (not a fan).  I hate these open kitchen and you come out smelling like the food you just ate.  BLAH! 

Anyways, I'll see about coming back if I'm in the mood.
author: Meshell C.

description:
Thai House Express was  always here after my drinking sprees  in the tenderloin.  decades ago. my usual orders of pad thai and curries did not disappoint.  of course, my taste buds were drunk too. 

thanks for the memories and.. 

4 stars for being around all these years..
author: Victor G.

description: I've gotten delivery from here at least 5 times and it is always great and really reasonably priced. Highly recommend the green curry and pad Thai.
author: Jessica P.

description: Taste is ok, price is right, proportions are small. Service is good. Overall ok, I have had better thai.
author: Viktor K.

description: Really great for Thai food. It's cheap and really good. Service is quick and they don't mind to split the bill when you are going with a group of friend.
author: Thomas F.

description:
This place is now called House of Thai.  I've been coming here for several years now.  There are plenty of other Thai restaurants in the area, and a few that are really good.  This is one of the few restaurants where a large majority of the menu items are really good, however, there are a few dishes that really stand out.

One of those dishes is Kanom Jean.  There are actually many variations of Kanom Jean, but House of Thai serves only Kanom Jean Nam Ya.  This is only the second place I've seen in the Bay Area that serves this dish and it's far better than the other place.

The dish is essentially a coconut milk-based curry seasoned with lemongrass, fish paste, and several other spices, and contains fish balls.  The dish is typically served with the curry sauce in a bowl and the other components on a plate.  The other components being a type of rice noodle (kanom jean), cut green beans, dried chili peppers, pickled mustard/cabbage?,  raw cabbage,  bean sprouts, and basil.  Of course, depending on where you go, they may have more or less items.

Anyhow, if you truly enjoy Thai food, this dish is worth trying.  Quit getting only Pad Thai or Pad See Ew already.  Seriously, if that's your main/only benchmark for a good Thai restaurant, I pretty much don't care what you think.
author: Dennis Z.

description:
I didn't order the dishes so it could be a dish selection problem. But most of things were too salty, avoid the beef curry and the coconut shrimp soup which are almost inedible. the worst asian meal i had in months!

the duck and pad thai were OK, at least something to fill one's stomach.
author: Rebecca C.

description:
For casual authentic Thai food that opens late, Thai House Express is my favorite place in the city. 

My favorite items to order here are:
Dungeness Crab Fried Rice, made with fresh crab, always light and fluffy
Pad Thai, excellent overall dish, hallmark of a good Thai restaurant
Pork Leg Stew over rice or soup noodles, a unique dish with lots of herbs, worth trying
Chicken Pad See Eu, very flavorful

The wait staff are all very friendly and have adjusted my orders whenever I have made requests for food to be cooked with less salt, no MSG, or less oil.

One tip: If you are a girl and dining alone, it's worth noting the outside area might be a bit scary to walk around at night, but so far I've never had any major issues in the years I've been coming here.
author: Mark Y.

description: My boyfriend and I were visiting San Fran and after 8 hours of sitting in a car we were STARVING. This place was down the street and walking seemed a lot more enjoyable then getting in the car again. It wasn't very crowded so we got seated right away which was a plus. I've eaten Thai food multiple times and love it but it was my boyfriend's first time so the fact that the menu also had numbers for the entrees was great because we didn't have to butcher the names. The Thai tea was super yummy and sweet like I like it. The food was nicely plated and was also very good. The food wasn't the best Thai food I've had but it was still very enjoyable. If I was back in the area I would definitely come back again.
author: Yessenia P.

description: Not much to say. Basically, if you're in the mood for some good late night Thai food...this is definitely one of the places to seek out. Unfortunately, being in the Tenderloin area...the neighborhood was rather...adventurous...especially at 11 o'clock at night lol..but what are you gonna do when a Big Mac or Whopper just doesn't cut it.
author: Orlando J.

description:
Used to be good now is it just OK... I been coming to this place for over 10 yrs and wanted that good ole feeling and came here recently. It definitely seemed glossed up the place and lost it initial essence that kept me coming back year after year. 
The food portions have went down tremendously and rouse to good presentation. 
The prices have gone way up and the service seem to have gone down. 
Now with the big windows I must say this is a very entertaining place to people watch, as it is the Hear of the TL. 

I know the great portions are not going to come back but now it is so expensive that I rather pull out a cook book and make it myself.
author: Dwayne A.

description:
We came here while waiting for a show to start at the Great American Music Hall. The surrounding neighborhood isn't the most glamorous (that's one way to put it), but the restaurant itself is sort of a little refuge from the streets outside.

We started with the naked ladies - raw shrimps topped with a spicy lime dressing. They definitely had a big heat to them, but were delicious, tender, and definitely a must-try!

I went with the pumpkin curry (my favorite) - it comes in a red curry with a good spice to it, huge chunks of pumpkin, bell pepper, basil, and (my choice) roasted chicken! It's more than a decent serving for one person, and even with help, I couldn't finish it all.

Finally, we had the pad woon sen, extra spicy. At first, I was secretly mourning the fact that the boy didn't get my favorite, pad see ew, but this was a welcome surprise! The noodles came with cabbage, tomatoes, egg, beef, and lots of green onions. At one point, it seemed like there were more vegetables than noodles, but it was still a flavorful dish, well worth the price.

I can't foresee being in the area in the near future, but this is definitely a restaurant I'd want to hit up if I was.
author: Claire S.

description:
Curry chicken was basically two pieces of chicken meat w half sizes of potatoes in a curry sauce. I eat a lot of curry and can say that this one was the worst. Also had Pad Thai... Lots of noodles but dry with no sauce - complete lack of creativity or skill.
Delivery guy was very nice though.
author: Tim B.

description: Everything was received in the fashion it was expected. The go-to's for us as always is the soft shell crab papaya salad, pad thai, roti and the crispy spicy pork. Of course I wish delivery was always faster, but it's understandable.
author: Derek H.

description: Flavorless seafood fried rice and over-cooked shrimp in the Pad Thai.   What happened?  Did you change chefs?  I used to like your food so much!
author: A D.

description: I love this place, the food is delicious and is reminiscent of all the food I ate growing up. Literally my comfort food!!! Try everything, that's my advice... Yum!
author: Kristy W.

description: The food was delicious and the service was great. It was a more casual environment than expected but otherwise no complaints! :)
author: Cyn D.

description: We had the pad kee mao and red curry (both with fried tofu). Was excellent. Best Thai I've had since leaving SoCal. All the workers appeared to be Thai, and most of the patrons were Asian people in general. That's how I know this place is legitimate [authentic] Thai.
author: Anthony C.

description:
Very good food,
I enjoy coming here
Just the service was like not there.
Seat table, ask for food, then order and never until the check comes 
But it's very good Thai food
author: Kenneth G.

description: The food here was great! We had the Pad See Ew and the Chicken Larb. Both delicious. The service was also very fast.
author: Colin O.

description: No menu modifications. No chicken satay. They can't even make coffee without sugar. Weird place.
author: Jeremiah R.

description: Pretty good thai for for a decent price in the city.  I ordered for pick up and it was ready within 15 minutes.  I ordered the pad thai (which was good), the Tom Yum soup (medium spicy, heads up this was pretty spicy even for someone that enjoys a little heat), and the Toong Gyen Yung  (aka golden bag, these were just okay.. pretty plain). I would definitely go back for the soup and try something else!
author: Natalie S.

description:
I'm so sad that this place turned out to not be good. I was craving good thai food one day and after reading the good reviews on yelp, I thought I would give this place a shot. We arrived and the server told us to sit anywhere. After picking a table to sit at, she came to us and asked us to move; if she had a preference for where we sat, why could't she just seat up properly in the first place? 

Anyways, we got over that and decided what to order: thai iced tea, red curry tofu, and pad woon sen noodles with tofu. The red curry tasted like we were eating a bowl of salt and spicy powder. On the other hang, the pas woon sen noodels tasted like rice noodles soaked in soy sauce. The highlight of the meal was definitely the thai iced tea! Wouldn't recommend any of the other 2 dishes at all.

The service was horrible throughout our meal; they never asked us how our food was or filled up our water glasses. To top all of that, there was a huge-cockroach looking bug roaming around the floor of the restaurant. To say the least, I will not be returning and don't recommend this place.
author: Malika R.

description: Really tasty food. Atmosphere is aight. But fairly unique Thai flavors. We'll go back.
author: David D.

description: A year ago, I ate at this restaurant and it was delicious. Today, I ate there again, but I noticed that there is new menu and new people working there. I ordered 7 dishes and they weren't taste good as before. Very disappointed !
author: Mark C.

description: Brainless and rude waitress, mediocre food , doesn't worth your time and stomach.
author: Sutida V.

description: I took the pineapple rice with beef, and the plate was generous and really tasty. The price are really affordable and they open late. The only thing is the atmosphere is not really warm. But nothing to criticize on the food !
author: Sara-Fleur S.

description:
The food here is really spicy. If you get 3-Medium spice level at another thai place, consider getting a 1 or 2 here.

The service and everything else is okay. We had to wait a while to get the check, but that was the least of our problems.
author: Karan A.

description:
This place cannot get delivery right, and they refuse to fix their mistakes. They'll claim to be too busy.  I wish they would focus on getting it right the first time.  

If you are craving something specific, order from a different Thai restaurant. If you are down to just eat whatever Thai stuff that winds up in a bag, go for it!
author: Regina M.

description: Love the gang dang (the spicy is REALLY spicy). Usually order through yelp Eat24, painless.
author: Justin C.

description: They took a while to deliver and they were 5 min from my hotel or they would have gotten 5 stars. They also made me buy Thai Tea because the delivery minimum is $20. I do not regret getting the tea it was delicious. I only eat fish so I choose the Salmon red curry in coconut milk. With the brown rice. It was amazing. I saved some for the next day and it was even better. Talk about food that makes you want to dance.
author: T L.

description: It's the tom yum soup with flat noodles that's good here .. The other stuff not as outstanding .. Their soups are what they should showcase
author: Juliana R.

description: YUM!  We absolutely loved our food.  We split the drunken noodles, and wished we had gotten another.  Hope I can find a place in Dallas with flavor like this!  The service was unremarkable, same with decor - but food is mmmmmmm good.
author: Rachel M.

description:
Having heard about it a lot from fellow Yelpers, I finally made the plunge, not to get married, but to go taste the sins in the house of Thai.

We started with the chicken deep fried dim-sum; it was very interesting with flavours ranging from sweet to savoury and was something I couldn't quite put a finger on. It was quite possibly the best dish of the entire meal.

The wonton soup was humongous - a clear soup bursting with flavors supporting a flotilla of healthy cabbage leaves and gobs of wonton. I was a tad disappointed that the wonton fillings tasted a little weird and did not meet the expectations set by my first slurpful of the soup; but it was still good!

For the main course, us two greedy dudes, to horribly translate an (India) Indian proverb, "our eyes were bigger than our tummy," decided to go for the Green Chicken Curry, the Five Spice Duck, and steamed Jasmine Rice (don't ask me why I am needlessly capitalizing the words).

The Green Chicken curry was really good; the green sauce being one of the best that I've had in quite a while, unlike some of the joints that totally rely on the richness of the coconut milk to mask and ameliorate their lack of talent in harnessing the rich range of herbs and spices at their disposal. The loads of vegetables in the curry were a little visually distracting but once you devour them, they aren't so distracting anymore.

The Five-Spice duck was pretty good with a soy based sauce but my benchmark "roasted duck on rice" at Chao Praya (in Novato) is yet to be surpassed.

Having been taught a lesson in overindulgence midway through the meal, we decided to box the remaining 2/3rd and 1/3rd of the green chicken curry and five spice duck respectively; It made for three more meals (yep, ~I~ took them all! heh heh)

The check came to less than $40 for the two of us after all that we had. It was more than bang-for-the-buck as I am sure this would have fed 4 people!

Lastly, the very cute waitress was really sweet --- definitely going back ;-)
author: Umesh T.

description:
I went to SF to visit my friend and this place was really close my friends' house like 2 blocks. When we went and there were a lot of people, so we had to wait for a little bit since we were a group of 10. After we sat, there were a lot of lining up waiting for the food or seats, which my expectation was really high since a lot of people are waiting. Even though it was busy, the servers were really nice by refilling the waters and stopping by asking if we needed anything. 

THE FOOD was AWESOME! THE BEST THAI FOOD I EVER ATE BEFORE :) I loved this place, which all my thai friends were saying that this taste is the original thai tastes compared to other Americanize Thai style food. I would definitely come back here but it is kinda far for come for thai food. But I would really recommend this place :)
author: Alice C.

description: Pad Kee mao is our go to dish #55.  We also tried #76 Fried rice (spicy).  Didn't care for the sausage in it.  Had a bit of a twang.  We will try the pineapple fried rice next time.  Love this place!  Oh... and we've been going here for a few years now and it definitely looks like the portion size has gotten smaller.  :(
author: Brenda M.

description: Maybe we were just very hungry, but everything we ordered was really good. My friends were vegans, and while it was difficult for them to pick out something due to limited options - they liked the salad, appetizer and entree they ordered. I got the reliable Pad Thai and it did not disappoint. Definitely going back to try out a few other things on the menu.
author: Neha M.

description: I did not enjoy the meal I had at all. The meat was broiled and tasteless and the sauce had very little flavor. So disappointed as was looking forward to Thai which I haven't had in a while.
author: Lisa S.

description:
Solid pad thai.  I like it 'thai spicy' and they made it great!  Good sized portions and they also deliver though only after 5pm. 

Can't say much about the service as I got it to go.
author: Farid V.

description: I haven't been here for a while. I used to come here for dinner before going to the AMC on Van Ness. The restaurant used to be Thai House Express and the menu is still pretty much the same accept prices went up a couple dollars. Oh well, this is San Francisco, everthing is expensice, can't blame them. We ordered deep fried egg rolls, yellow chicken curry and the Pad GA Prow. Everything was tasty. Will come back again.
author: David L.

description:
While sitting for one of my clients pets, I decided to check out who was delivering in the area. This place came up and had pretty good reviews. 

I decided to order the Pad Thai with prawns, pad see eww medium spicy and a thai iced tea. The delivery only took about 35min, although, the guy forgot my drink and had to go back. It took about 10min for him to come back so my food was a little cool by then. 

The portion of the food was really big and I thought the pad thai was OK. My hubby ate the pad see eww and noted that it was nice and spicy and full of flavor. The Thai iced tea was a little watered down by the time he brought it to me but it was still drinkable.

Overall, the food was pretty decent, huge portions and quick delivery. The prices were pretty reasonable and came to about $26 with two entree's, a drink and tip. I just had to knock off the star for them forgetting my drink, making the food get cold while waiting.
author: Petra S.

description: In for business and a colleague and I dined here last night. She had the chicken broth soup and it was a huge portion. Definitely shareable. I had a rice plate with tofu and vegetables along with the vegetarian egg rolls which were delicious! The food was great, quick and inexpensive. I gave it a 4 star because it's simple (old tables and chairs, no tablecloths, basic everything) surrounded by homeless (which is sad to eat and see others hungry) and it doesn't appear the cleanest.  All in all it was delicious food.
author: Tiffany L.

description: I placed an order through Eat24 and got the usual 45-90 mins delivery time. This was my first time ordering from this restaurant. I was having this delivered to my work place and noted to please call me when they arrived. I'm watching the time and was getting worried when the order hadn't arrived at the estimated delivery time. I chatted the receptionist in case they didn't see my note about calling me. I contacted Eat24 and they let me know that my order was out for delivery. Almost 2 hours now, my order arrives. It is lukewarm but also cold. I complained to Eat24 and they contacted the restaurant on my behalf. The restaurant made it right and I am a very happy customer. I will give them another chance and hopefully this first experience was just them having a bad day or being short staffed. I'll definitely give an update on my next order that goes wrong. But hoping there won't be anymore bad experiences.
Not the best but it was good they did have good customer service I think they need to work on being a little faster
author: Bhandari C.

description:
I seriously haven't written a Yelp review for my favorite Thai place in Little Saigon? 

I've been getting House of Thai delivered for over a year now. It's without a doubt my most patronized Thai restaurant in SF. Ler Ros gets an honorable mention for being awesome as well and also highly frequented. Though I've never actually been inside House of Thai. Being the lazy and apartment dwelling bum that I am I get House of Thai delivered.

Favorites include:
Po Tak Soup - Jam packed full of sea critters. I get it almost every time. It's especially perfect on a cold day, or when you're sick.

Larb Salad - Get it with duck, you won't be disappointed. I love this one!

Pla Mauk Tod - Perfect appetizer, I always ask for a 2nd sweet and sour sauce and one time I even got one!

Nuer Kem - All dat protein. This is the kinda thing I add to my order just to meet the delivery minimum but then it makes a perfect snack later or the next day.

Mint Lemonade - So good! And if you're the type to booze, it mixes really well with vodka. 

Thai Iced Tea - It's Thai iced tea

While these are my favorites I always add something like Pad Thai, Pad Se-Ew, Fried Rice, the Pork Leg Stew Noodles Soup, etc. Also, their crispy pork belly is good but not as good as Ler Ros. House of Thai has a huge menu and I love ordering a one or two of my favorites and then trying something new as well. I've yet to be disappointed. I love every meal I get from House of Thai (and you should too).
author: Vivian A.

description: The food is great if you come here in person. However they have truly absurd delivery times. We're talking 2+ hours at times. When the food arrives it's clear the dishes were made over an hour prior to delivery. Many dishes will not survive the ridiculously long delivery times and arrive a soggy mess.
author: Derek D.

description: I went out to dinner with my family including my two year old.  He was hungry and stubborn and hey children are part of life so sometimes they can be unpleasant.  We were trying to eat and keep him from throwing a fit at the same time.  He insisted on ringing the bells at the front entrance and we felt like it was better than him screaming.  Unfortunately, a waitress came over and screamed at us to be quiet and was very aggressive and mean about it.  She appeared to be the only person disturbed by the bell ringing,  that occurred for no more than a minute or two.  So if you have children and want to eat out spend your money elsewhere.  Not all of us can enjoy eating at home every night and sometimes the little people need to get out too.  Just show my child any respect that you would to an adult.  I live a couple blocks away but I'll spend my $55 elsewhere and will never return here again.
author: Olivia L.

description: I ordered the pad Thai for pick up, it was good and fresh but it lacked shrimp, only 3 pieces in the entire dish!
author: Jackie C.

description: The worse service ever. They tell you your food would be ready in 20 minutes and hour and a half later your food is lost. They cant figure out where it is, they even tell you to contact the driver personally, oh and let's not forget the times when they Hang up on you if they cannot give you an answer. Don't order here if you are hungry, your food will never arrive.
author: Yali F.

description: Not a fan of their noodle dishes, but great curry and all other main courses. I love spicy food and they live up to the "very spicy"option. But they also respect the "mild" option, as it should be. Full disclosure I've never lied pad Thai in general and that's what I mean by noodle dishes. All in all great Thai food.
author: Daniel H.

description:
Having to eat Thai food half of the week, I rarely go out for Thai. But I decided to give House of Thai a try since my date really wanted to. And I'm glad I did. 

We had the curry bag (This one is not very impressive) and the Kao Soi and the fried fish with ginger sauce.

I love their Kao Soi, very balanced and tasty. I wish they gave me a little more fried noodle garnish though. I love dipping those in the curry.

The dipping sauce that came with the fish was delish ! I can eat that with steamed rice and be happy.

And hey, mango mojito rocks !

I took out 1 star because the curry bag smelled funny
author: Alan T.

description: Was it the hoodie? Being in the vicinity of my work place, I have been a regular for the last couple of years and always recommend this place to my guests (I work at hotel). I know it's not going to make any difference, but I won't be coming here anymore. It was around 11:15PM. I sat at a table for about 15 minutes and no one approached me. NO MENU, NO WATER. Four staffs chitchatting by the cashier station pretending like they don't see me. There was only one other customer at the time. Not that anyone is going to take any action, just felt like putting out there. I will happily direct my guests towards ZEN YAI THAI, only two blocks away on Ellis. Better food, Better pricing and BETTER SERVICE (even though they are always busy) !!!
author: Ten A.

description:
Came here on a lark, and ordered some yellow curry (my go-to dish at Thai places to determine how good they are, because it's one of my faves and they have it just about everywhere). 

The curry was fantastic. The sauce was amazing, and the chicken and potato were good as well. The pieces were big, but easily cut into, even with a fork. 

My only issue would be that you have to be very specific what you're ordering. (My Thai is nonexistent, and the server's English was passable.) I thought I was getting the manageable yellow curry portion that came with rice. But I wound up with the large portion and having to order rice separately. It was a bit much, and there was some potato and rice left over. (I decided that such delicious chicken should not go to waste, and crammed it down.) 

Overall, I enjoyed the food quite a bit, and would call it one of the better yellow curries that I've had. There just needs to be a little more work on the occasional language barrier.
author: Br. S.

description:
I had the best green curry here, tonight.  It had the perfect heat for me.  My eyes got watery.  I got a little runny nose.  TMI, but that's my story and I'm sticking to it. 
 
Service was adequate and efficient. No complaints in this area.

I do want to go back and try their pumpkin. curry. unfortunately, it is only served on the ala carte menu. That'll probably be ok. I can take the leftovers home.
author: Debbie T.

description:
I ordered this restaurant from GrubHub today and was unfortunately a little underwhelmed.  The food came half an hour earlier than expected which was great, but the container my curry came in must have opened up on the way here because some was spilled out in the bag, it wasn't a significant amount at least though.

The fried tofu was good, the chili sauce it came with really made that dish.  The green curry was good, I've had better though.  I ordered it hot and felt like it could have been a bit spicier.

I will probably give this place another try, hopefully my next experience is better.
author: Annette E.

description: While I preferred my dish and the ambience at House of Thai 2, this location was also delicious.  Highly recommended if you're looking for some reasonably-priced, quick, and tasty Thai food.
author: Josh B.

description:
(See pics) Updated review. Great post concert dinner that served delicious spicy dishes and dessert!

Beef jerky and larb (minced prok lettuce salad)  were both good with rich flavor and spicy. Pork belly with chili was definitely a popular and favorite dish with its crispy lardy taste that had the happy grease exuding, also fairly spicy. Chicken curry and deep fried catfish were both also very good with a lot of flavors in them.

The dessert roti was flaky with condensed milk that was a great happy sweetness.

The great thing about this place was while it's casual, the dishes were in very good quality with a relaxing ambiance and friendly service.
author: T L.

description: Haven't been here for a while and decided to stop by for dinner. Not sure if they have new ownership or new chef, but the food was definitely not the same. Ordered a plate chicken for my mom and kids, they took one bite and put it back down. It was so dry and bland.
author: Y C.

description:
The five stars is for the Ka Moo here. The rest of the dishes are around 3-4.

Ka moo is a perfect trinity of stewed pork shank, served over rice, with pickled mustard greens on the side.

Each spoonful of this tender meat, stewed in a base of soy sauce and star anise further deepened by the pork shank, is barely held together by the collagen that has already slightly thickened the broth. This is further enhanced by the vinegary spicy dipping sauce, a piquant high note cutting through the undertone of sweetness and fattiness. The rice, rich from soaking up all the stewing juices, dulls the spiciness of the dipping sauce, and the pickled mustard provides a welcomed textured contrast to the rest of the dish.

If one pork dish is not enough for you, there's also the Moo Tod, golden-crispy outside and tender inside, with a sweet-sour dipping sauce.

All the fried rice are good, but I have a special fondness for the shrimp paste fried rice. Not everyone's thing, but if you like shrimp paste, you might want to try this.
author: C C.

description:
We went here for the first time on Labor Day, after discovering that most of our regular spots were closed for the holiday. The place was hopping, but we weren't sure how many were regulars and how many were finding themselves in a situation similar to ours.

While nothing catastrophic happened, it was just 'meh'. Very underwhelming and not worth a second visit.
author: Michelle M.

description:
One of my favorites in the area. I have eaten at House of Thai in the restaurant and through delivery at least twenty times over the past year and I am consistently pleased with the food and service. The staff is friendly and quick to get people seated even on busy nights, and the food and drink prices are very good. Delivery is always prompt and generally beats the Eat24 time estimates, but that may be in part because I live close by. 

Our normal orders are typically the Moo Tod crispy pork, the Gang Ga-Ree Gai yellow curry and the pad thai. Other notables include the Pad Kee Mao Noodle (can be super spicy depending on how you order it) and the Gai Tod. We generally order two of the above a la carte and add one or two orders of the garlic rice. 

I have tried most of the thai restaurants in the Polk Gulch area and always end up coming back to House of Thai.
author: Taylor B.

description: Ordered the Kao Soy Noodle dish and thought the curry sauce was very bland and tasteless. I have had much better thai food.
author: Eric B.

description:
If you are ever in Frisko and stay the night and had too much fun to get back out to get you something to eat. ORDER FROM HERE! Can you say FREE DELIVERY.

The food here was sooooo good. Chowed down on Naked Ladies Salad, Por-Pier Pak, Kao Pad-Wok Fried Rice, Pad Thai Noodle, Pad Se-Ew Noodle & of course Thai Ice Tea.
It was very flavorful. Super convenient online ordering and again Free Delivery :-)
author: Tameka X.

description:
WARNING:  Do not underestimate the spiciness of the NAKED LADIES.  Your mouth and tongue will experience an excruciating and extreme burning sensation.

Just thinking about the naked ladies makes my tongue burn with the residual memory of the spicy hotness of the Thai chili peppers.  If you order naked ladies, you'll get some raw shrimp covered with minced garlic, onions, and other garnishments, drizzled with the chef's spicy lime dressing.  There's also a side of this dressing served on the side, in case you really want to feel the burn, and perhaps ruin your ability to eat anything else.  They use Thai chilies that have a slow, long burn.

NOTE, however, that you can ask them to tone down the hotness.  Friends of ours arrived after us, and ordered the naked ladies, but asked that they make it not as spicy after watching us guzzle down glasses of water (and for one friend, multiple glasses of water, and finally a glass of milk).  Their naked ladies weren't as spicy.

All the other food we ordered was good.  My Pad Kee Mao noodles were perfection.  The rice dishes were just so-so, but I can't give an accurate review of the other dishes because my tongue was still burning after the naked ladies for most of the meal, and right after the naked ladies, it actually kinda hurt to put food on my tongue.

All in all, I will come back for some more naked ladies.  Next time, though, I'll probably ask them to tone down the spiciness of the naked ladies, so I can better taste the other food.
author: Christina L.

description: Awesome food. The pumpkin curry is spicy and yummy. Brown rice is the bomb. Veggies are fresh.
author: Michelle S.

description:
Came here for dinner with 2 friends. Ordered the pad kee mao tofu spicy since the portion for fried rice seemed a bit on the smaller side. My friends ordered vegetable curry with white rice and pad kee mao tofu mild spicy. 

Wait wasn't too bad from time ordered. However, the portion I received was a little underwhelming. I was also not excited that the appearance of the dish was a reflection of how the entree was about to taste: extremely bland! I've had Thai House Express on Castro Street before and didn't like it. Once again, I'm not satisfied. The guay tiew flat noodles were not slippery enough and just had absolutely no wok flavor that Thai food is renowned for. I had to add tons and tons of chili powder and even that didn't help. 

Definitely would not recommend this place even though people leaving were raving about it. Obviously these people do not have high standards for Thai cuisine.
author: Dominic T.

description:
Came here on a Thursday with a group of co workers and we called ahead for reservation. Nine of us enjoyed a variety of dishes including curry and noodles. Noodles seem to be the best bang for your appetite and money. I ordered red curry or gang thag i believe it was called. A nice portion of rice and red curry with carrots, beef, basil, and other veges in red curry. It was tasty, spiced perfectly and good to the last bite. For dessert we ordered fried banana, ice cream, and rice pudding. Excellent desserts and a pretty big portion. The fried banana is not easy to eat alone, but doable. Service was great, no complaints in that area. With thai food, i wish they served bigger dishes because its so good till the last bite. Thats my only complaint. 

Overall: delicious food, great service, great price.
author: Nestor G.

description: The fried tofu wasn't very good and neither was the yellow curry. :/
author: Laura L.

description:
Excellent pumpkin curry. Rice a la carte. Skip the Yum salad. Free thai iced tea with yelp/facebook check-in. 5% student discount.

Dismal customer service.
author: Cami R.

description:
I think the only negative thing I can say about the place is the area. A bit sketchy and intimidating, but get over it and it's well worth it. We came in around 7 and got seated right away. Place was a bit more full upon leaving around 8:30, but not sure there was a wait then even. 

Service was phenomenal, refilling water before our glasses were even half empty, and thanking us after doing so; very friendly all around. As soon as we were ready to order, someone was upon us to take our order, and similarly with finishing plates and our meal, with the check (though not in a pushy way). We ordered 2 entrees between the two of us, and being hungry, I was starting to regret not ordering an appetizer or salad as I looked jealously around, and then our food arrived in about 5 minutes anyway, wow. So fast.

We got:
- Koo Kao Moo (pork leg stew over rice), with garlic rice: pork was incredibly tender and soft, easy to cut through with a fork. Fairly fatty, and quite a bit of skin, but well worth the indulgence. Almost ordered the dish as a noodle soup, but the waitress said this version was actually more famous, and no regrets. Garlic rice was new to me, and I loved it; very moist and flavorful. Came with a nice little sweet and spicy sauce too, which was spicier than it looked. 
- Broccoli with salted fish: Mostly broccoli, and only a little bit of salted fish, but damn was the salted fish good. Not much to say, but very salty and quite savory, each piece really melting in my mouth. A little sad with how little fish there was, but the pork serving was pretty generous, so didn't leave me too hungry. Broccoli was well done too, with some nice leaves, and the stems cut nicely into good-size pieces, and kept fairly firm, but flavorful, with a fairly light soy-like sauce. Garlic rice from the pork was great for soaking it up. 

Prices were pretty reasonable; not cheap, but not expensive. Maybe slightly pricier than other things in the immediate vicinity, but we're talking $2-3/dish, so not much. Only thing keeping me away is the location really, being a bit out of the way for me. Lots of salads, appetizers, and other dishes I would happily return to try. Wish I'd had a bigger party or more stomach space for it this time around.
author: Kris K.

description:
Great authentic Thai food in SF. 

Hit this place up at like 1am after some TU and man this place hit the spot!

Got the spicy combination fried rice and egg rolls
author: Derren V.

description:
The only reason they get 4 stars is because even though we were one of three tables in the restaurant, their service was a bit slow. 

The food however is surprisingly delicious. We were going to a bar that day except it seemed that it was closed so we started walking back and found this place. We decided to give it a shot because we could have thia iced tea. Their pad thia and red curry was some of the best we have had! I have never had better pad thai noodles and the curry was among the best I've had.
author: Jhesse G.

description: Great experience- I would totally eat here again. I was looking for Thai takeout close to my hotel and I'm glad I settled on this place. Food was hot and tasty and the service was quick and friendly. Definitely recommend!
author: Sarah T.

description:
The undisputed king of late night Thai food dining, for downtown SF.

It's located in one of the worse areas in SF, but I've never had any problems. Many times I've seen police making arrests at that intersection. Look around u, don't be careless. A lot of people come here, the bus stops right in the corner.

There's a white board of specials posted above the kitchen, but don't stress out trying to read it. All those "specials" are listed on the one page specials menu, provided with the regular menu. The staff are friendly, so feel free to ask any questions about the menu.

Some of the dishes I remember ordering are:

I really like the toong gern yeung (minced chicken and veggie pouches) appetizer, because I seem to order it every chance I get. http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/FnVTg0L7fLy5c5lo5j9lBw/l http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/dQH-A0mHkWz875qnDtXEjw/l

The gui chai (vegetarian chives cakes) http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/7UfUM7mS4qpfkUpaTqaexw/l are a little bland, but at least it's a true vegetarian dish. Compared to Chinese chive pancakes at dim sum places which are not vegetarian (it has dried shrimp). Just a tip for any veggie fan readers.

The larb pedd (minced duck salad) is too salty for my taste. http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/dYZ5i05kqreT3OXdgSVHNQ/l

Kao mun gai (steamed chicken over garlic rice) is a simple good dish. http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/XF3ho4jKNzFy9PInhRbBWg/l

Pork leg stew noodle soup is very popular. http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/tVCqx8A-ozDwpBNL3WemAQ/l

Pork leg over rice, is less fatty than LRT's version. This is the same as "pig knuckle" from the Roli Roti cart, but without the bone and stewed. http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/X5bUfMgi_Qumagq_M1j0gg/l

Rad na - choice of meat, Chinese broccoli, and flat noodles with gravy. http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/I-E38Gey_Iy0NfOT8wYmIA/l Just FYI, Pad see ew is the non-soupy version of this dish.

On the specials menu - grilled skirt steak with house sauce. http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/hoZvqE_pf3nXhnoqrDkyUw/l

There are 2 fried banana desserts, one with ice cream and one with honey and peanuts. I like the latter one best. http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/wTAitRUOyy9ALVq1K4jO2A/l

I don't think the roti dessert is that great, it's deep fried and oily. http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/7mP8WusxNe2Jc7_YEMx8Rg/l Not bad, but Roti Kaya from Banana Island restaurant is best (that's the only item I recommend from that place). And Roti from Lime Tree restaurant is also good but that's an appetizer, not a dessert.

The restrooms are located upstairs, but u need to get the key from the register counter first. The men's bathroom key is attached to a metal spoon, http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/Zg9Q7iJowprGh9Ly2qw4qQ/l and the women's bathroom key is attached to a metal measuring cup.

Hear, hear! Long live T.H.E. king of Thai cuisine!!
author: Luis C.

description:
Solid Thai spot. I've had better but I can't complain. The free Thai iced tea with the yelp check in was nice! Ha

The location is quasi shady and the parking can be tricky but I suppose that can happen from time to time in SF. 

To date, my favorite Thai food spots have been in NY (and I even went to Thailand once).
author: Lucky B.

description: Was in Thailand in February and wanted to remember my experience with Thai food. This place was not particularly attractive but it was clean. I must also say that I got good service, probably better than what I get at Thai places. Delicious Pad Thai, my all time favorite in Thailand! Great curries and shrimp dishes. So popular that they opened a second restaurant in September, just find out and have to try the new one too!.
author: Pancho M.

description:
Move over Osha, this is my new favorite thai place. They don't charge $12/plate, and they deliver. What more can I ask for.

Pad See Ew, Pumpkin Curry and the Garlic Chicken is amazing.  The total + tax and tip = $38.
author: Claire C.

description:
Best pra ram so far in Sanfran. 
Good portions and a nice stuff. 
Restroom is not the hit..
author: Fatih B.

description:
I haven't been to this place in person yet, but based on delivery, I have no doubt that it's a pleasant experience in-restaurant as well. 

Speaking of delivery, it was prompt and the food was very well-packaged. I ordered a mint lemonade (which was very, very good, even if it was a tad sweet for my tastes) and it came in its own bag for extra protection. It also had a piece of tape over the place where the straw is inserted. Probably not important to most people, but the attention to detail was appreciated. 

For our meals, I had the pumpkin curry with chicken (which has to be ordered with a side of rice if you want it, I chose brown) and my boyfriend had the Pad See-Ew. 

The pumpkin curry was to die for! Seriously. I am a huge curry fan and it was perfect. I have never had pumpkin curry before, so it was a pleasant surprise. Huge, dense, tender pieces of pumpkin, perfectly cooked veggies, and big pieces of chicken. The curry itself was delicious--a red curry that I ordered mild, and it was the perfect amount of spice. I found out last week that I was allergic to dairy, so I've been feeling a bit deprived in terms of good food. Seeing as this is made with coconut milk, as is traditional, I wasn't robbed of delicious comfort food. It hit the spot and the portion, for me at least, was huge! I was able to have it for lunch for two days afterward! Love, love, love.

My boyfriend was thrilled with his Pad See-Ew. It's his go-to dish at thai restaurants, so he's had it many times in many different ways. Here, however, he had the option to order it with a "hot" heat level... and his reaction was priceless! He was so happy that a place followed through and actually served its food very spicy! So happy, in fact, that he called his brother up (who lives in LA) in the middle of dinner to tell him that they have to go to House of Thai next time his brother visits! 

Overall, we were very happy with our meals and will certainly be return customers here!
author: Ashley-Jayne O.

description: Food was pretty good but beware the spice level. I can handle spicy but even a "medium" had me reaching for my thai ice tea.
author: Julia P.

description:
Stayed at a hotel nearby so we decided to try this place out. Ordered for pickup and got the beef panang and pumpkin curry. Both were real good! The pumpkin curry was delicious and with just the right amount of spice. However, they didn't put enough meat. It's ok though coz the panang had lots of meat! Ended up having lots of leftovers for the next day.

We didn't get dessert the first time so we HAD to go back the next day and try the mangos with sticky rice and the taro with coconut milk. Mmmmmm! Is all I gotta say bout that! :)
author: Maria G.

description:
Decently priced and large portions. 

Meet a friend here during my numerous visits to SF.  Got their Tom Yum Goong which is a hot and sour prawns soup with tomatoes, lemongrass, straw mushrooms, onions and galangal ($8.95)  It was a very flavorful soup (as Thai soups usually are) that is like a mixture of pho and tom yum soup.  The level of spiciness was a bit much even for my taste buds, but the flavors of the soup were delicious!
author: Theresa V.

description: Genuine Thai with abundant flavors. Table service is first-rate. Specialty cocktails are equally good; full of flavor and kick. Is this an everyday 'go to' Thai restaurant? In this Yelper's opinion, no. This is the perfect Thai spot for moderately fussy but 'oh so delicious' authentic eats, first-rate service and great bar service. Highly recommend. Tip: Sit at 1 of 2 high-tops adjacent bar and near door and overlook the entire venue. And make sure to come back again!
author: Christopher K.

description:
If you want good Thai food in this area, might as well go to king of Thai. 

Grew up in the neighborhood and haven't had house of Thai in a minute. Never really liked it when I was younger so I went back today to see if things might have changed. It didn't. Service was alright. Food was not that good. Got some spicy tofu/vegetable sour soup and fried chicken w fried rice. The soup was too sour and chicken was almost burnt!! Ugh.
author: Jennifer S.

description:
I used to be indifferent about Thai food, but after eating at Thai House Express it completely changed my mind. And for me to give a thai restaurant 5 stars, it must be that damn good. I've tried their pad thai, pad kee mao, pork stew leg over rice (my favorite!), duck over rice, and all were amazing. 

FYI, if you ask for spicy, you better be korean or something, cause they really don't joke around when you say spicy, so be warned.

For a restaurant situated in the TL, I was surprised by the comforting interior; it's always kept very clean and they have nice paintings hung on the wall.

If you have a craving for Thai food, come here and I promise you you won't be disappointed!
author: Angela K.

description:
Do not order for delivery. It will not arrive. 

I have not had their food, but am warning you not to place an order for delivery. I've been waiting for 2 hours, and have called for an ETA three times. Everytime they say the same thing and yet the food doesn't arrive.
author: Elizabeth S.

description:
The Tom Yum soup was the best I've had. Also tried one of the chicken dishes and it was decent. 
Their delivery service through eat24 sucks though. Says 45-60 mins, but its more like 1.5 hours. The first time I was hungry and annoyed, but now I just order real early.
author: Vin A.

description: Pumpkin curry was pretty horrible. Not much flavor and loads of grease floating to the top. The rest was not very impressive either. Maybe just got the wrong thing, but would not go back.
author: John T.

description: I gave House of Thai two attempts (take out both times) and the food isn't bad, it just wasn't very good either. Pad Thai was almost soupy with more of a bright orange sauce and a different flavor than normal. Sticky rice is not sticky whatsoever, it's just a block of hard rice that is difficult to eat.
author: Kate S.

description:
One of my favorite Thai place around, for they have quick service, friendly servers, and consistently good food. I live in the neighborhood so I order take-out and eat here often. It's not fancy and gourmet like Lers Rose, but you can expect quick service and good food. 

Some of my favorite dishes: Naked Ladies salad, duck noodle soup, tom yum soup, duck curry and pork leg noodle soup. 

Note: if you havent been here, go with mild medium spicy first. I love spicy food but medium is quite spicy for me.
author: Ying Ying S.

description: They have a cool little deal for a free Thai iced tea by checking in. Otherwise it was $3. Good selection of dishes. I had the rice and loved the sausage. Spicy!
author: Maurice M.

description: Got the tom yum and some pad thai.  Both were good.  Delivery was faster than expected.
author: Garrett D.

description:
Thai House Express -- I thought this would be Thai version of Panda Express.  Wrong!  What a find -- the food is awesome.

Pad Thai is probably the best I've had in the city.  It even has pieces of tofu that are soft and fresh -- not overfried, like so many places seem to do.  And they also used very fresh white meat chicken -- white-meat-chicken-snob that I am, it made me very happy.

Oddly, they don't have chicken satay here (she said they don't have there right cooking area for it(?)), so instead I had the crispy beef appetizer -- which was excellent. 

I liked it so much I went back two more nights.  First night I had their mild yellow chicken curry.  The curry was great -- but, for some reason, they used dark meat for the curry, so everything ISN'T white meat, like I had thought (so those like me, take note -- or maybe you can order the curry with white meat?).  

The time after that I had their beef chunk red curry (pa nang nuer).  Very good, although I have to say that this is one dish that I like better at Cha Am on Folsom, despite the fact that almost everything else on their menu doesn't hold a candle to Thai House Express.

They also have some cool drinks.  Thai Iced Tea, of course, with its usual greatness; but they also have mint lemonade, which is AWESOME!, very freshly made, and lychee iced tea, a cool variation.

And finally, this place has a great-looking staff.  The women, the men, both on the serving floor and in the kitchen are all nicely dressed and well-coiffed, as well as  being geniunely friendly.

Be forewarned that if you plan on eating here. it's NOISY!!   They need some soundproofing on the walls and ceilings.

But for a big Thai food fan like me, I was really happy to find this place.
author: Merrick W.

description:
The food was great! The pad Thai was pretty much perfect and was the stand out dish compared to the cashew chicken and red curry.

The service was somewhat lacking, with mains being brought out before the appetizers but when the food is so cheap and tasty I don't really mind!
author: Laura D.

description: I went in here pretty hungry and was really excited to eat. We got the Gow Se-Mee and the Five Spices Duck Noodle Soup. The Gow Se-Mee had crispy egg noodles and thats what I was going for. However, it had like 0 sauce. It was just fried noodles and then some steamed chicken and vegetables on top. It didn't really hit the spot. The duck soup was pretty flavorful. I wish there was more duck, but overall I enjoyed that one. At the end, I did end up pretty content/full so the amount of food is very solid. Maybe it was because I drank a lot of water and soup, but either way my hunger disappeared.
author: Victor D.

description:
Food = delicious.  Great flavors.  Perfect harmony of sweet, spicy and savory.  Heat upon request.  ;)

Service = friendly.

Prices = reasonable.  

Overall, I'd be back here for another late night of dinner... I was here around 10:30 p.m. for dinner last night.  And this place was hopping!
author: Fannie S.

description:
This place is THE BEST.  I have never had a bad meal here, or a bad take out experience.  I feel so lucky to live a block away!  They use real Dungeness crab (and lots of it) in their dishes, especially in the crab fried rice dish. 

The only thing i don't love is that they don't offer sides of their soup. You have to order a giant tom yum for $9, you can't get a small with your meal :/ but they make up for it with their consistently friendly, fast service :)
author: Jamie B.

description: To be honest, we set our expectations way too high. No flexibility when it comes replacing incredients, way too salty salad and tasteless chicken. Not the best way to start your Saturday night.
author: Jason I.

description: It's my go-to delivery place for Thai. I only get takeout or delivery from here, but it is usually pretty quick and spot on.
author: Judit H.

description:
Stewed pork!!    So tender and juicy. the sauce awesome too, it reminded me of chinese duck in sweet soy sauce or something.  it's not too salty and not too sweet, but certainly very savory

Pumpkin curry very flavorful witha nutty undertone.  it went very well with the rice and there was a large flavor of lime leaf which made it taste unique and it is better than Osha's pumpkin curry.

Pad kee Mao was better than your average, but just a little spicier.

Water service was pretty good, around every 5 - 10 minutes which is perfect.  

I would come here again and recommend this place to others based on the stewed prok and pumpkin curry alone
author: Tina A.

description:
Best service, quality and taste @ house of Thai. They got many tables so its not a long wait. Highly recommended to try their lunch specials too. 
Keep up the good work!
author: Hems B.

description: I came here with family and the food was excellent. Our favorites are Chan Pad Poo, Ka Moo, Som Tum, and Pad Prig King with Crispy Pork. The food tastes as authentic as it can get in the US, and the service is top notch.
author: Pim D.

description:
DELICIOUS! 
originally wanted to go to the thai restaurant located at 730 Larkin, thank goodness they were remodeling today cause we ended up coming here.  I'm glad we did

ENVIRONMENT: super clean, good for large/small groups AMAZING waitress. she was so charming and in a good mood (which is sooooo rare for waiters here in sf) 

FOOD: yes yes yes yes!!!!! I just had the best PAD KEE MAO of my life, you can choose how spicy you want it, and we got the medium and it was HAWT (but perfect) so flavorful. SIMPLY AMAZING pad kee mao. the pad tai was delicious as well i just can't stop thinking about the BOMB pad kee mao. deliciouuusss!! definitely can't pass up on it. 

overall, amazing place!
author: Mina S.

description:
The food was really good. It was fresh and spicy, very spicy. I would definitely recommend. There were so many items to choose from, and everything being brought out of the kitchen looked and smelled great.

I will definitely be eating here again. Best part is they offer delivery so I left with a menu. :)
author: A C.

description:
So I ordered food from here the other night, here is what I got:

5 Tofu Tod: This was so good I ate it all under ten minutes.
15 Som Tom Salad: I didn't like it at all.
31 Tom Yum Soup: I usually love this kind of soup, because I like sour things, but this one had more of a fishy under base to it, I ate most of it because the veggies were so fresh and soft, but I wish it had more of a sour flavor to it.
51 Pad Thai Noodle: This was so good, the tofu came in little mini cube shapes and it had a very sweet tangy sauce that clinged to the noodles.
Taro Cake: The top had a very thick taro , so I ate that up right away, the rest was layers upon layers of white cake mixed with taro and crème, I wouldn't order this again , it was wayyyy too sweet (and I love sweet things)
Thai syrup Crème Soda: When I ordered over the phone the waitress didn't ask me wethere I wanted it with crème or soda , so when it arrived it came with crème.  I drank it rather fast, but I really over all didn't like it.  I will order it again next time with soda instead, and maybe it will have more of a lighter flavor to it.

Out of all the food I got from here I would just order the tofu again , it was sooooo ggooood , but I will eat their food again , just next time I will order different things.
author: Jennifer G.

description:
OMG, my friend recommended this place to me and now I'm addicted. I really love their noodle soups and their Moo-dang dish, don't forget to try their coconut water! 
The service is always splendid and they are very fast with their turn-around time!
author: Mari B.

description:
I got the pad thai and the red curry with beef for delivery.

The pad thai was pretty good. Definitely better than the other places I've tried nearby (although that isn't really saying much). I was also pleasantly surprised by the curry. The other places I've tried thus far when I've ordered "medium" curry, I've wound up with "not at all spicy" curry. This was much closer to what I would call medium, although perhaps a smidge on the mild side still. What really surprised me was the beef. I tend to be hesitant to get things with beef as a lot of the time it winds up being low quality and chewy/stringy. This was not at all the case! The beef was incredibly tender on the level that I normally associate with slow cooker or stew beef. It was great!

The one thing I'd improve is that there wasn't much curry sauce, but I think that might be because it splashed into the rice partition of the container and got absorbed.

Either way, I really liked it and will definitely be ordering from here again.
author: Emily F.

description: I recently got delivery and it was quick and delicious! I'd recommend the sweet sticky rice with ice cream for dessert :).
author: Abby B.

description:
Went here twice while I was in SF. Their Tom Yum soup is delicious. However, do not ask for the hottest kind. Your face will get melted! Seriously.

The service was speedy and friendly. They asked me if I was okay when I was sweating profusely from the lava soup. When I went in the next day, I asked for the next level down of spiceyness. It suited me like a treat!
author: Joey C.

description: The WORST delivery driver on the planet. Ordered thru Eat24...received a call from them 90 min after placing my order saying there was confusion about whether or not I made an order. Which I did. The delivery driver never went to my door...called my number once, then drove off. He never attempted to go to my door where he could've hit one button and been buzzed in. 30 min later, he came back...finally buzzed in, then asked for a cash tip. He left...then I noticed he forgot my damn tea. The dude is the WORST. There are plenty other mediocre Thai places out there...this place can bite it.
author: Karl N.

description: I rushed to get here just before they closed (10 minutes) only to be told that they were only taking to-go orders. Fair enough. I got the anchovy fried rice anyways and rushed home to eat it while still hot.  It was okay. There was plenty of anchovies but it was in big chunks. I would have preferred if it was chopped a little smaller so it could be mixed better with the fried rice.
author: Jean K.

description:
