Formally known as Thai House Express... Man I love this place it's my go to for Thai food... Must haves are the deep fried pork belly Thai basil style, Pad Thai with beef, Pad See Ew, Beef Red Curry, Beef Larb, Tom Kha and so on.... Basically everything in the menu is bomb shiggity... 

The location of the place is in a not so nice area but "who cares when the food is that good" but inside the Restuarant it's nice and clean and the wait staff are really friendly "love this place" it's a must try ...
author: YennyMack L.

description: I come here every time I'm in San Francisco. It's my favorite place to get naked ladies (raw prawns). It's amazing! Whenever my cousins and I go out to dinner, this is the place to go. We usually get sausages, naked ladies, pad se ew, basil ground pork(?), and garlic rice.
author: Sandy Z.

description:
This place is solid, but nothing out of the ordinary. 

I came here to take a nice break from the craziness that was Pride. They had a nice happy hour deal - 5 dollars for cocktails. The cocktails were delicious, and they really helped to relax and cool me down after running around all weekend haha. Sometimes, booze is the answer to all your prayers.

I had the papaya salad and it was SPICY. I couldn't handle it, and I've got a relatively high spice tolerance. I mean, I ATE it all, but it was painful. Deliciously painful, but still painful nonetheless. 

Someone else in our group ordered mango with sticky rice. She said it was a little too sweet. It had some sort of sauce over it which I think put it over the edge. But she still enjoyed it.

If you want good Thai food, you can come here. But I can assure you there are better places. And in less sketchy neighborhoods, no doubt!
author: Jade R.

description: It was my first time ordering here. My dinner was Simply delicious! I ordered the coconut soup, brown rice w/ peanut butter topping and Tahi tea. They delivered earlier than expected and the delivery guy was very nice!
author: Zulma T.

description:
2.5*s The duck noodle soup totally missed the spot... too many bean sprouts, not enough noodles, the broth wasn't very flavourful, and where was the duck meat? all i saw was duck fat!!

But the pad Thai in the past has been alright. they claim a minimum charge but i haven't been kicked out for hanging out w friends sans ordering before....
author: Sam W.

description: After 800+ reviews this place can't Identify  the general reviews on the plate when you order you dish and my concerns is that they're  providing such small pieces of  BBQ chicken lately.I left this place starving and I have to cook at home after a few walk from house of Thai . The yelp has pointing out overall trends to be so excellent , but my last visit had enough evidence to change my perspectives of this place.Since I came here multiple times I have the reason to stop coming here.. They filled half of the plate with rice so it can cover the luck of meat.. By analyzing and comparing with others places it has potential to be better.Two of my friends share the same thoughts stating that uncertainly is on the rise on house of Thai..
author: Pedro D.

description: I ordered food for a delivery order and they exceeded the expected delivery order so extremely, I will never order from here again.
author: Bryanna S.

description:
The place is awesome! I've only gotten takeout via Eat24 from here, but it was some of the best takeout thai food I've ever had. The dishes were very authentic, they didn't seem americanized, and well flavored with fish paste. And the spice level actually corresponds to how spicy it is (unlike most American ethnic restaurants that assume when you ask for super spicy you mean to say slightly more spicy than mild...). 

We ordered the pad see ew with chicken, the gang dang curry with beef, and the shrimp paste fried rice as well as the fried banana with green tea ice cream for desert. Everything was amazing and tasted truly authentic and quite spicy! Rivals some really amazing food we had while traveling in thailand. Delivery was very fast, and accurate. Would definitely order from here again!
author: Piyali F.

description: hmm, not sure why the high reviews. i got the beef noodle soup and it was hmm not good. the soup base was funky and it just tasted kinda weird and not pleasant. Many other thai places do it better. you know what it is, almost like i bought those soup mullions at the asian markets advertised as thai noodle soup base and then just cooked it at home. All in all, just not that good. plus, they didn't describe what meat would be in it on the online menu. Thus, all this tripe and other stuff I didn't want came with it. including pork blood. it is not even good pork blood. All in all, not good.
author: P L.

description:
Delicious.
This place is awesome. Got takeout at 11:30PM and they were still kind enough to take the order.
I got the Moo Tod, Pad Kee Mao, Gan-Khew Wan. EVERYTHING was awesome.

I highly recommend this place.
author: Melissa N.

description: Absolutely delicious, quick delivery... love the curries!
author: Alec W.

description: Free Delivery with $20 Minimum. Gets my order right every time. Highly recommend Chan Pad Poo (Spicy) and Pad See Ew (Medium Spicy - the Spicy level is too intense to for me)!
author: Karen T.

description:
The food is good. I love Thai cuisine, and this place has is the best Tom Yum soup I've had in San Francisco this far

HOWEVER......... I have noticed that this place is infested with BUGS!!! On more than one occasion, I have seen bugs either crawling on my table, or in the straw I was given.. and most recently floating in my water. GROSS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  I stopped coming to this place for awhile after complaining and in hopes they'd clean up their act, but I've recently found out that nothings changed. Someone call the Health Dept. STAT! smh!!
author: Marie T.

description:
I must say i was hesitant to come here because the "express"  name bit it was a pleasant surprise when i tried the food.

we ordered :

sauteed crispy pork belly = heaven delicious
&
red curry = super good

the bill was $19

 i saw a whole bunch of food i want to try on nearby tables, I will definitely  go back
author: Fran M.

description: Never, ever again. Two and a half hours later, I'm delivered quite possibly the most disgusting Thai I've ever encountered. Cold, rubbery egg rolls, clumpy mushy rice, a pumpkin curry that had about 7 pounds of salt. This is seriously inedible. Oh and the delivery guy was an asshole. Do not go here. Ever.
author: Gina L.

description:
My GF and I were a bit hungry after a long day of exploring parts of SF. We decided to yelp Thai food that offered delivery to our hotel. Made the call and they said they do offer delivery to our area so we ordered the following: 

Som Tum (papaya salad) - not the best I've had but it's still real good. Seems pretty authentic and not "Americanized". 

Tom Yum soup - requested chicken with it. Although a bit spicy, it was delicious. Made to perfection and probably one of the best I've had. 

Pad See Ew - Really good. Like, 5 star good. Nothing else to say about it. 

Overall, a 4 star rating. Courteous over the phone, fast delivery, and great Thai food. Price is average but worth every penny.
author: Albert J.

description:
For some reason, this place gives me the same satisfaction as a home-cooked meal from my grandmother, even though I'm German. Good comfort food. Eating here is like having a long-lost friend find you, and give you a big hug. 
I should warn all of you that spicy here is VERY spicy. I usually order spicy food from all the Thai places I go to, but they take it to another level here. I was literally crying when eating my Tom Yum Soup, although that may be because it was the best Tom Yum Soup I have ever had. 

Things to Try:
- Tom Yum Noodle Soup! Oh wow is this good. I have gotten this soup about five times now and it always leave me satisfied. As i mentioned this dish is ridiculously spicy but it is the perfect thing to get if you are feeling a bit sick. It comes with loads of shredded pork, pork balls, and your choice of noodle. There are quite a few choices when it comes to the noodles, but I usually get the wide rice noodles. Yum.

- Pumpkin Curry! I have tried pumpkin curry at other places and this is my favorite. Nice big pieces of pumpkin, and I just love drizzling that curry sauce over everything I order. 

- Pad See Ew! A bit saucier than most places, but that is just the way I like it. Definitely a guilty pleasure for me. 

- Drinks! I went in there with my family and they accidentally brought us this minty/lemonade sort of thing and it was delicious. I have no idea what it was but I would get it again if I could figure out what it was. I think it is on their cocktail menu. They also have a few different types of wine too, if that is your thing. 

Did I mention that this place is open till midnight? I have called at 11:30pm before and they took my order, and even greeted me with a big smile when I picked it up. The food is always consistent whether you come in for lunch, or order late-night takeout. This place is just downstairs from my apartment, and I feel like the luckiest guy in San Francisco.
author: Kyle H.

description: Best Thai food! I enjoy different types of food but when it comes to Thai, I'm usually picky and this place was magnificent.
author: Kimberly V.

description:
This review is not so much to discuss the food, but rather the lack of customer service from this restaurant . I recently ordered from this place through EAT 24

They have either sent me the wrong items or made excuses that someone "else" packed up the food. Tonight when I ordered the food, I made all attempts to make sure that they had the "right "order. Not only was the food over 1 hour and 20 minutes late- the driver hands me a leaking, dripping, finger burning bag of food. I hadn't realized that it was dripping until I turned to go into my apt. The tom yum soup  I ordered has been poorly packed so it has spilled out all over the entire bag, ruining the contents of the rest of my meal. I have fish sauce smelling soup spilled all over my shoes, the hall way and my clothes. My amazement pertains to the driver- he had to have seen the dripping as it now stains the hallway leading to my apt door.  

I am further amazed by the lack of customer service from the restaurant itself. When I called to complain about the late food and the damage,  they stated that they were late because they were busy and its raining, okay- I can understand that. The soup leaking- well someone must have packed it wrong- you think? That's your response? Its not his fault, but someone else's?

Not, I am sorry that your dinner has been ruined and that your personal property is now damaged, what can we do? No, they tell me that Eat24 has to fix it and that they can't do anything. I presume they mean that they won't give me my  money back. 

At this point I've gone from frustrated to just pissed off. Take ownership and even if its just empty words- just say it.... "I'm sorry that you didn't receive the level of service you should have received, what can we do to make it up" That alone would have diffused the situation and I would have probably chalked it up to an honest mistake.

Now, I am just disgusted and annoyed and need to vent on YELP. Don't go into business if you can do a good job about delivering quality service.

Now, I can't order good food because I don't want to risk receiving poor service and having my belongings damaged. 

Now, I am still hungry...
author: Ms J K.

description: Delivere service is terrible.  They said the driver has  waited outside trying to contact me for 30 mins.  But I didn't get a single call or a text. And after that Yelp text me said that the deliverer is waiting outside but I don't see a anybody outside.  I took more than 2.5 hours and now it's 11:30pm. All restaurants are closed, I have no choice but stay hungry, it's ridiculous.
author: Qifeng H.

description:
Came to SF to see Book of Mormon and stayed in the Tenderloin. We wanted something yummy before the show and House of Thai was right outside our Motel 6 window....read the reviews and immediately called in our order. The lady was very nice on the phone and got everything down correctly. 10 minutes later we walked in, picked up our food (which was expertly packed for take out) trotted back to the motel and commenced to GRUB DOWN. The restaurant itself was clean and bright, with your standard import store decor. 
We ordered the Pad Thai with chicken (the dish had tofu and shrimp in it by default--we wanted chicken too and there was lots of it!) I forgot to say "medium heat/spice" on the phone so i wasnt sure if it would be hot or not. It was NOT spicy--not even a little. Next time I'll definitely ask for a little heat, but its better to error on the side of "not enough heat" than to have a dish "too spicy to eat"....
The pad thai had great flavor and the tofu was very tender but kept its shape in nice little cubes. The chicken was sooooo tasty and the egg was AMAZING too (i love the egg in my pad thai--one of life's little perks!) Fyi, i didnt eat the shrimp--gave them to the BF. There were 3 big shrimp and he said they tasted good. The bean sprouts were placed on top of the dish--fresh and crunchy. (This was helpful, as i only like a few bean sprouts so i hate it when the sprouts are mixed with the pad thai noodles so I must rummage around my dish, pulling out sprouts. Its time consuming and looks janky...)  Props to House of Thai for putting them on top!! The sauce was great and stuck to the noodles, which were cooked perfectly. The pad thai gets a solid '4 stars'. I knocked off a star because i had to add chicken ($) and there was no spice.
We also got the #1 Golden Bag appetizer which was my fave thing about the meal. There were 5 deep fried, crunchy bags of goodness each tied with its own little deep fried tie wrapped around the top. The presentation was cool. I should've snapped a pic but ate those little fuckers pretty quick. They're made with minced chicken with excellent flavor, tiny potato cubes and green onion. YUUUMMMMERS.
These golden bags get '5 stars' as they were the highlight of the meal. 
Also ordered a side of jasmine rice and sticky rice--- upon recommendation from another reviewer,  we got a side of peanut sauce to dip the sticky rice into. Jasmine was okay--not great--and the sticky rice was tasty. Btw, i think this was your standard thai sticky rice. They also had mango sticky rice on the menu, but, I'm fairly certain this was not the mango variety.  It was very good dipped in the peanut sauce.
One note about the peanut sauce: i was expecting a usual little side of peanut sauce. What i got was a container of sauce which i actually saved for the next day. I think it was around $4. Next time I'll either get more things to dip or pour the sauce over, OR I'll ask for just a couple little condiment-sized peanut sauce containers, rather than a CUP of sauce. 
(*Note* I would've loved some chicken skewers to go with the peanut sauce but i didnt see it anywhere on the menu and forgot to ask.)
The bill came to $28 and change (tipped $6) so...$35 out the door: a bit pricey for one main dish, one appetizer and 2 sides of rice BUT i did add chicken and of course, my small vat of peanut sauce.
Next time we're near the Loin and craving some quick, tasty morsels, I'll definitely remember House of Thai and make a few small adjustments to my order. Overall, a nice thai experience
author: Lanie S.

description:
I was in SF for a weekend and my friend and I just happened to stumble upon this cute little Thai restaurant just 2 blocks away from where we were staying. We were really hungry and I honestly wasn't expecting such authentic, tasty Thai food!! I've eaten at various Americanized Thai restaurants in So. Cal, but had never had Thai food like this before. The wide range of exotic spices and flavors in our dishes were exciting. I enjoyed every bite here.

Here's what we ordered:

1. Por Pier Sod (Fresh rice paper rolls stuffed with Chinese sausage, egg, tofu, and cucumber, topped with sweet and sour tamarind sauce): $7
**LOVED this appetizer!! This was my favorite dish of the meal.

2. Sai Oou (Deep-fried homemade Thai-style sausage served with Thai fresh chili, fresh ginger, peanut, cabbage, and red onion): $7
**Interesting presentation. We ordered this because we were curious and it was recommended by our server. However, we didn't know how to properly eat it at first, so we had to ask our server =P. The sausage, chili, ginger, peanuts, & onions were arranged separately on the plate. I guess you're supposed to use the cabbage leaves and wrap all the ingredients together to create your own "cabbage wrap" (similar to "lettuce wraps"). The taste was interesting and VERY good, but it was too cumbersome to prep for eating.

3. Pad Pak (Wok fried Mixed Vegetables w/side of Jasmine rice): $8
**DELICIOUS! We added chicken to this stir fry. Soooo good. 

4. Thai House Beef (Marinated beef broiled to order; served with cilantro-tangy sauce over rice): $9
**Tender, flavorful, thinly sliced beef. Loved the tangy cilantro sauce with the meat and rice.


We finished allllll the dishes!!! I was beyond full, but still wanted to eat because the food was just so good.

Stellar and attentive service. Our waiter checked up on us frequently and constantly refilled our waters & soft drinks when needed. Very nice staff.

I definitely want to come back again the next time I'm in SF area!
author: Juliet Rachel C.

description:
Fast. Fresh. Tasty.

Yup, those 3 words on the menu pretty much sum up Thai House Express!

Came here STARVED after rushing around all day and I had another appointment in 2 hours :t Basically, I just wanted something filling, delicious, and fast that I could eat between appointments. Thai House Express to the rescue!!

I got Pad King with chicken (sauteed with ginger, onion, bell pepper, carrot, jalapeno, and black fungus). EXACTLY what I needed to satisfy my growling belly! I literally waited less than 10 minutes and BAM! Food! Loved the flavors (ginger yum!!).

The workers here are so nice! I also really like the laid-back atmosphere here. Even though it seems like a restaurant-y place, there were actually a lot of people just sitting by themselves, reading the newspaper, working on papers, reflecting on life (?) Usually I get that kind of feeling from cafes, but I really liked that Thai House Express had a similar atmosphere. It can be awkward (and intimidating) going into a restaurant alone, but not here! :)

Yay! I need more Thai House Express in my life!
author: Kei H.

description:
I have been searching and searching San Francisco for a bowl of Tom Yum Noodle Soup as good as what I had at Rod Dee in Boston (yes, I know, sadly, I should be saying Thailand, ....anyhow)... And I would have to say that this is even BETTER than Rod Dee's. 

This bowl of soup is the most perfect concoction and epitomizes why I love thai food. It's spicy, sour, fragrant, and even toasty at times, with an amalgam of textures of crunchy peanuts, ground pork, spongy fish cake, fresh sprouts and slippery noodles. (Yes, I did just use the word "amalgam")

It's not just a bowl of noodle soup, it's an experience. It's takes your senses for a delicious ride to Thailand and back. (My 4th grade teacher would had given me an "A" for this last cheesy sentence).

The reason it's better than Rod Dee's is this is even more balanced as far as the spicy and sour, and there is a toasty note in there at times - not sure what it is - toasted garlic, lemongrass or peppers perhaps? Whatever it is - it pushes it over into awesome-ville. 

Only downside is I didn't feel like there were enough noodles - had about 3 slurps of noodles and the rest were sprouts.

Nevertheless, even that wasn't enough for me to take away a star. If you're a Tom Yum Noodle Soup fan, I highly recommend checking it out. It's definitely worth the trek through the loin'.
author: Bonnie H.

description:
This is a review of delivery from Thai House Express.

It is easy to order via Grubhub.com.

Delivery - The order was placed at 5:34 PM.  The estimated delivery time was 6:22 PM.  The order was delivered at 6:03 PM.  At 29 minutes, the delivery was very fast.  There was no delivery fee.  The delivery person was professional and polite.

Order Minimum - It is relatively low ($15).

Gai Gra-Pra Rice Plate  - While I prefer sliced chicken to ground chicken, this was still a very good dish.  It was very spicy.  The veggies were fresh and crisp.  For the price, the portion was very good.

http://tinyurl.com/3txxxu5

Pad Prik King Rice Plate - This dish was also very good.  The beef was very tender.  While not as spicy as the chicken dish, it was very tasty.  Once again, the vegetable were crisp and fresh.  The rice in both dishes was very well prepared.

http://tinyurl.com/43byz7n

Packing - Both entrees were neatly packed into easy to reseal plastic containers.

Pricing - The prices were affordable.  They were very much inline with what I expect to pay for quality Thai food.

1  Gai Gra-Pra Rice Plate  $ 8.00
1  Pad Prik King Rice Plate  $ 8.00
2  Coke  $ 3.50
Subtotal  $19.50
Tax  $1.66
Total  $21.16

Overall - This was very good Thai food.  The delivery was fast.  The food was all neatly packed and the prices are decent.   I would definitely order from Thai House Express again.
author: Mark D.

description:
I came to Thai House Express for dinner the other day and had a pleasant experience. 
I liked the open kitchen concept of the place, making the place feel lively and inviting. The place was pretty packed, but the waitress immediately seated us by the corner. They had a TV with the giants game playing, which was definitely a plus for many.
I found the menu to be solid, with your typical Thai restaurant dishes. We opted for the Spicy Green Curry and a Pad Kee Mao. They were very accommodating and allowed me to switch the bamboo shoots in the curry to eggplant. I really appreciated that.
The food came out promptly and portions were decent. I loved how there was enough of a kick to both dishes. The curry had plenty of meat and vegetables. We also ordered a thai iced tea, which was made well too. Not like the watered down ice teas that you get at some other thai places. 
Overall, I had a really good experience at Thai House Express, and I would definitely come back again to sample more of their dishes.
author: Helen Y.

description: I don't like this place. I ordered Pad thai and it had too much oil, somewhat yellow liquid was on the plate. Maybe they have other food staff which I have not tasted but this dish definitely was not good. Mt wife had chicken curry and she was not happy as well
author: John D.

description: Dishes you can't order at any other Thai restaurants in SF. And it's quite true to the authentic tastes.
author: Joe C.

description: Came here feeling kind of nauseated, but the Gang Jerd Woon-Sen really hit the spot! It's a comforting soup and feels very healthy, with light silver noodles and lots of veggies. The broth wasn't the most flavorful, but was mild and soothing for me. I ordered it with ground pork and liked the garlic flavor. It's good as a light meal if you want something warm. My bf ordered the pad see ew, which was very flavorful and just the right amount of saltiness. They were actually pretty generous with the veggies as well so I felt like it was a pretty well-balanced meal. I would say the portions aren't super huge and most people could probably finish it if they're hungry. The only downside is that the service is kind of lacking, since the place is so huge and the servers are just running around everywhere.
author: Jacqueline K.

description: The most horrible service I've ever experienced, the cashier women is the rudest thai person I've ever met in SF, yelled and throw the bill at me to sign.... couldn't believe...... waitress are brainless, can not explain properly about the bill, definitely the worst thai  restaurant experience ever, will not go again and won't recommend to anybody!
author: Lynn H.

description: Absolutely delicious, my boyfriend and I went for dinner, he had the pulled pork stew that was divine and I had the panaang curry spicy which was probably one of the best currys I've had in a long time. Service was quick and friendly; well priced as well. I'll most certainly come again
author: Darlina E.

description:
A semi large group of my friends (7 people) had planned on eating dinner at Lers Ros, however, they had a long wait time.  So we walked up the street to Thai House Express and they seated us right away.  Awesome!

The staff were super nice, food was bomb ass delicious.  Our friend got a spicy mango salad, he liked it's level of spiciness.  I liked they had a vegetarian section to the menu.  Glad we tried this place.  Prices ranged around $9 per dish.  Appetizers were $6
author: Michelle M.

description:
1-October, Monday:
Sodium Infused Pumpkin Curry, hmmm hmm DISGUSTING.
author: Ty T.

description:
This has quickly become our "goto" thai place. The first thing you will notice is the quality of the meat, it is unlike any other thai place I have ever patronized in any other city. The beef is juicy and cooked to perfection, the pork melts in your mouth and the seafood feels exquisitely fresh.
The noodle dishes and curries are consistently incredible. My favorite is the Pad See Ew with beef or the Red or Yellow Curry with chicken. The noodles are cooked perfectly and the combination of sauce, veggies and beef sings on your palate.
They are open late, inexpensive and good for groups. If you just want a quick meal after a long day they also do takeout and free delivery. I've been here several times and have ordered out many more times and will continue to do so as long as I am in the neighborhood.
This is truly one of the gems of the TL.
author: Scott C.

description:
Me: Can I get the Pork Leg Stew over rice?
Waitress: Do you want the pork with skin? And fat?
Me: um, no thanks?

Sounds disgusting, but tastes delicious. And for $7.95 for dinner, you can't beat the price.

-----------------------------

* Pork Leg Stew - This is probably my favorite dish. The a la carte portion is huge! Love that it is served over chinese broccoli.

* Green Curry Fried Rice - This was pretty good, but in terms of fried rice, I think I've had better and generally prefer the noodle dishes here more (Pad See Ew!).

* Yum Woon Sen - This is exactly what you would expect if you've ever had it, although there were a bit too many green onions for my taste. It's basically a clear noodle stir fry with a lemony / vinegary dressing, and a small wedge of iceberg on the side. Not sure how this qualifies as a salad, but I ate it like a lettuce wrap, and it was good, but I still prefer the flank steak Thai Salad.

* Thai Beef Soup - Good, but on the sweet side.
author: Jess C.

description: The yellow curry was very good. Wait staff was friendly food arrived timely no complaints
author: Aaron C.

description:
I give props to a place that can remind me of what actual Thai food should taste like.  After studying abroad in Thailand, I admit I've become pretty picky about my Thai food.  In fact, I've simply avoided eating it for the longest time.  

On this particular day, my friend ordered the Pumpkin Curry while I ordered the Khao Soi.  Ever since I fell in love with it while in northern Thailand, since that is their specialty, khao soi has become something I order every time I see it on a restaurant's menu and no place has been able to recreate that same magic moment for me.  Even here.  I appreciate the attempt though.  All the ingredients were authentic in the dish but it just didn't taste the same.  Nevertheless, it tasted all right.  One note though: the crispy noodles on top were not crispy at all.  Moving on, the pumpkin curry that my friend had was what REALLY reminded me of what I had a in Thailand.  I had one taste and bam!  I was like, "This is exactly what the curry tasted like when I had it on the streets in Thailand!"  Spicy but sour with a funky kind of pungency.  Not how I like my food but definitely authentic.  

I didn't have a chance to taste the other food, as the portions are generous.  But I still thought $10 for the pumpkin curry (w/o rice) is a little steep, while an order of plain jasmine rice is $1.50.  My khao soi was $8, which I thought was reasonable.  Overall, the meal was enjoyable.  Service could've been better as it was hard to get the waiters' attention when we were just one of two tables at the restaurant.  One final note: The prices on the website are not accurate.  Assume maybe a $.75 increase for some of their items.
author: Vanessa C.

description:
Not a good experience this evening, had a red curry but ate a piece of plastic from the curry. 
Staff waiver the whole dinner and i left with 5 dollars on the table. 
But over all, the sauce is too strong and the dish came out doesn't really look like the picture shown.
author: Isaac X.

description:
I really want to give this place a better rating but I simply can't!

I had a BIG craving for non-authentic Thai boat noodles today so I came here after a recommendation from my friend, who happens to be Thai, so if he says the food is good, then it probably is! (More on the non-authentic noodles part later)

My friend and I stopped by today around 2:30 for a late lunch. I agree that 2:30 is rather late for lunch, but it's not too incredibly late. Anyway, they close at 3 (we didn't know that). We asked if we could still dine there since we had 25 minutes till 3:00 and they didn't look too busy. The waitress told us that they'd wait 5-10 mins for us if we didn't finish our meals before 3. Really, just 5-10 mins?!?! Granted this place is under a new management team, but come on here! We took our business down the street to Ler Ros Thai. Great food with great service there! The waitress at H.O.T. needs an attitude adjustment.

As for the authenticity part? Thai Boat noodles is usually made with a broth that is infused with herbs and blood. The blood gives the broth its depth and cloudy texture. I love the flavor of the soup and the noodles, but am not a fan of the blood. It doesn't taste like blood, but it's mind over matter I suppose. LOL. Anyway, I hope anyone who goes here finds better luck. I am sure the food is great, just wish I was allowed to try it!
author: J T.

description: Awesome Thai food.  Every dish is full of bold favors.  Causal and inexpensive.
author: Anna W.

description: They recently changed their name to House of Thai. I went here for lunch since it's right near my apartment and was surprised how good it was! For $11, you get soup, salad, appetizer, entree + rice. Wish it was maybe under $10 but there was enough food to make two meals out of it. Service was attentive and food was delicious and well presented. I had the tofu ginger basil and veggie egg rolls. The soup that came out (coconut milk, mushroom) was lite and flavorful. I'll definitely be back here probably for dinner next time.
author: Semuteh F.

description: First time there so our table (4 of us) ordered 2 salads, one noodle, two pork and one appetizer.  I forgot the names of them all but it actually doesn't matter because nothing tasted that good except for the pork dishes.  If you are in the area and feel like some Thai food, order the pork (like a ham hock) and skip the rest.
author: Lily L.

description: I am always looking for khao soy and was pleasantly surprised at the one here. It was very filling and had a great flavor profile with the proper egg noodles which I believe bring the whole dish together. We also got a red curry with beef and lime leaves that came with incredibly tender meat, a hefty portion and perfect rice. The calamari appetizer was disappointing but overall this place is a great value for some good food and fast service.
author: Arshia K.

description:
As I was walking through the neighborhood to get here, I thought "oh shit. I'm either going to get shot or mugged." But my hunger was stronger than any fear of the TL. The walk was worth it. Their pad thai and Thai iced tea was fantastic.

Their food is delicious. If I ever want to eat dangerously, I'll make the trek here. The element of danger makes it that much more delicious...well not really...but this place is definitely worth a visit. Check it out if you're looking for good food in the area.
author: Nancy C.

description: I am not sure if the food is good or not... because I have been waiting more than 2 hours for the delivery. They didn't seem too concerned when I called. In fact they said the delivery person left 20 minutes ago. Wonder how warm it will be?
author: Jef H.

description:
Love Thai food? So do I. Will this restaurant satiate your craving? Sure. If you're expecting to get your mind blown, make sure to lower your expectations. 

Pro's: 
1. Surprisingly fast delivery time 
2. Plenty of vegetarian options
3. Relatively inexpensive

Con's:
1. Food is usually delivered cold - lukewarm
2. If you don't specify the level of spice then expect to lose a few taste buds. They have a heavy hand on the spicy. 
3. The service is never quite consistent. One day you're warmly greeted and the next you're yelled at by the hostess that she has too many people in line to take your call. 

Try the Egg Roll, Cashew Nut Entree or Pad Kee Mao. Good Stuff!
author: Monika K.

description: One of my favorite Thai restaurants in SF. I've never had to wait for a seat and the food is delicious. They have the most flavorful pad see ew....although the portion could be bigger. The tom yum noodle soup is a favorite too. Prices are fair and service is good.
author: Lester W.

description:
I'm not sure what happened to this place. Food was outrageously spicy and mediocre tasting on my recent visits. It's safe to say that after three mediocre meals this will no longer be my go-to Thai restaurant. 

*Tom ka kai soup: not so much chicken or mushroom, but a long stalk of lemongrass. Grated galangal, and chilies add a spicy kick to this tasty soup.
*Gai ka prow: basil chicken over rice was spicier than what I had in Bangkok, although I asked for mild. 
*Larb gai: again the chicken salad was way too spicy for mild. It goes well with jamine rice.
*Fried wontons: a-ok, crispy and not greasy.

The person sitting next to me also sent his food back because it was too spicy to eat. I'm not sure what's gotten into the chef here. I consider myself having a good tolerance for spicy food and I have traveled in Thailand 5 times. Their dishes here have been so spicy that I couldn't even taste the food. 

The Thai House Express on Castro at 19th, which to my understanding is now unaffiliated to this one, is better.
author: Matt Y.

description:
Me to waiter: Spicy, please.
Waiter: Thai spicy?
Me: Yes, Thai spicy!

The result? An embarrassing amount of sweat noticeably glistening on my face as I shove spoonfuls of the spiciest beef noodle soup into my mouth. And despite the fact there's pain as well as pleasure (or maybe because of it?), I just can't stop eating the spicy, slightly sour, pungent broth and its slices of beef, beef balls, bean sprouts, and rice noodles. Even when the topic of the table's conversation turns to how sweaty I look. 

Also, the raw shrimp salad was interesting. It was less "salad" than a plate of butterflied, completely raw shrimp, each topped with garnish and seasoned with fish sauce (?). Pretty good and worth ordering, if you like shrimp sashimi. 

I like how this place seems to always have interesting dishes like the shrimp salad and means actual business when it comes to spiciness levels (although I'm going with "medium spicy" next time!). This place is also great for groups, and the food comes out fast.
author: Carolyn F.

description: Solid thai. Highly recommended if you want great thai food at a very good price. Atmosphere is not great but good for mid week dinner.
author: Yasi N.

description:
I came here with 2 friends as they opened for dinner. The service was nice and we got our food pretty quickly without a problem.

The crab version of their Pad Thai (Chan Pad Poo) was good. Flavors were on point, however some noodles were not cooked thoroughly.

The larb salad and sukiyaki tasted odd/awful. The flavors were not what I had anticipated and made me regret ordering those dishes. I barely touched the two entrees. 

The pumpkin curry was okay, rich in spices but the chicken was very dry and thin. It was saltier than my typical preference. 

Overall, I was disappointed with my meal because I had expected better food based on the reviews it had on yelp.
author: Ilene L.

description: Thai green curry, hot and sour soup, papaya salad-AMAZING!!! Note that Medium = extremely spicy. Can't wait to order from here again!!!!
author: Stefania O.

description:
I'm going to add to the 638 reviews already out there so that I can be one of the hundreds who've eaten at this delicious establishment.  I stumbled upon this thai restaurant with a friend visiting SF and we yelped the closest thai place in the area.  Thai House Express pops up and we go on a whim because it's close.  Best random find ever.  

I was able to find it again thanks to yelp and I took my hunny who was a bit skeptical about this "best tom yum noodle soup" dish because he has a favorite restaurant back at home that does the same, exact dish.  To our surprise, my hunny and I have officially deemed this restaurant our "go-to Thai place" so it takes a little warm spot in my belly.  You MUST get the tom yum noodle soup.  It will blow your mind away.  THE best tom yum noodle soup I've ever had in my life to date.  I've always thought tom yum soup would taste good with noodles in it yet it was hard to see that as a standard menu item without asking for noodles separately.  Good thing Thai House Express got it right. 

Plus I wanted to add to the nearly 700 reviews because I think Lers Ros Thai (which has 800) is just alright.  Despite its lackluster name, the food is stellar at Thai House Express.  Ain't nothing express about it, in a good way.
author: Tori Q.

description: Stopped in for dinner and was very pleased with both the friendly and attentive service, and also the flavorful dishes we all ordered.  Everyone left happy.  Would definitely return when in San Francisco, and will recommend to friends and family!
author: Adam S.

description:
WORST DELIVERY GUY EVER!!

Food is good but the delivery service was horrible. Just horrible. Ordered on Eat24 with a 75min delivery confirmation (I'm a 10 minute drive away). 1h50 minutes later the delivery guy showed up and he was shockingly rude. . He was abrasive and outright confrontational when I said that it was unfortunate that our food was late. I'm actually uncomfortable with him knowing my home address, it was that bad.

Do not order delivery from here.
author: Jason S.

description: Ordered delivery from this place because it was conveniently located and had a good looking menu...it was unfortunately the worst thai food I've ever experienced :( Flavors were weird and more Chinese tasting than thai, noodles had a distinct burnt flavor, and everything was a little greasy. Sorry, will not be eating here again.
author: Kyla E.

description:
Changed their name to HOUSE OF THAI. 
On a Sunday night, street parking was super easy to find.  It's the Tenderloin but given Daylight Savings it didn't feel totally unsafe with a group of people.  House of Thai/Thai House Express has affordable and delicious food - good for large groups and service is quick. I've heard this described as "better than Lers Ros Thai."  I haven't had enough of either to judge.  The Khao/Kao Man Gai (white chicken with rice) is delicious.  As is the pork stew, pompano and even the basic pad thai.  I love the chewiness of the pad thai noodle and it's the right amount of moisture too.  Nothing was too salty or too greasy. Thumbs up.
author: Alias A.

description:
The pork leg stew is a winner with just the right amount of sauce, pork, and fat to meld the flavors together over rice.  They also serve a version in soup.  There are so many other delicious dishes especially the curries.  

Service is friendly and fast.  The ambiance is simple, clean and spacious.  Parking can be tough on the street, but it's a great option for something fast, yummy, and cheap.
author: Jenny L.

description:
A pretty girl with an ankh tattoo was the best part about this nondescript corner stop in the Tenderloin, although the really large windows are a draw,  allowing you to check out the meandering middle aged prostitutes and web developers conspicuously tagging boarded up buildings on their lunch break.

There's free wifi and the service is excellent.  Unfortunately, however, the food seemed a little phoned-in.  There was a "dungeness pad thai" advertised on the door, which seemed like a great idea.  After ordering an ice cold Chang and waiting not long at all, the piping hot order arrives, which was sadly tepid, almost a lazy execution.  I ended up getting the order to-go, and 4 blocks down gave it to some punched-in-the-face transient, slumped alongside a wall. 

I'd maybe recommend another place for noodles, but for the meshed lives stammering outside Thai Express is probably perfect.
author: Jason A.

description: Don't waste your time or money. We ordered number 81,118 and 121 truly a disappointment. Tasted flat and bland to make the experience even worse we waited 2hrs to get the food delivered.
author: Aaron P.

description: If I'm ever back in the area I wouldn't mind coming back here for their cheap lunch! Service was fast, they kept our drinks filled and the food was tasty.
author: Meryl C.

description: Delivery girl came to my door and insisted I give a tip I felt very uncomfortable and I don't think a tip was deserved since she forgot my drink and delivered after about 2 hours! Tips should be given for good service which I didn't receive. Food was just ok.
author: S M.

description:
Ordered delivery from this place (never been there before!) and it turned out to be perfect. Food was fresh and yummy (some too spicy for my taste, but everyone se loved them). The yellow curry and the pad Thai were the winning dishes. 

Deliver was on time and well packed (no leaks!). 

Definitely ordering from here again!
author: Em D.

description: The service was poor. My orders weren't correct and when mine  did come  my friend had to wait an extra 15 min for theirs to arrive. Normally good food good service but I was completely embarrassed  after bragging on this place. Also my food came before we even got our utensils! Wtf!??
author: Warren D.

description:
The food here has always been consistent over the years even though they went through some changes in the kitchen crew last year. 

My favorite has always been sukiyaki (you can order it with soup or stir-fried). If you have never tried Thai sukiyaki, give it a shot. It comes with bean thread noodles (silver noodles) and loads of ingredients (fish balls, shrimp balls, shrimps, squid, chicken and white wood ear mushrooms). The soup is rich in flavor with the special sauce made with fermented tofu, garlic and chilies.

I had my first meal in San Francisco at Thai House Express during my first visit in 2004. Eight years later, I finally live here. This restaurant brings me good memories and is always on the top of my list of Thai restaurants in the city. Still as good as the first time.
author: Saran R.

description: This place was good, had a bunch of different dishes to choose from, only draw back is every items description didnt tell too much of what the dish really was, pictures off yelp help. I love thai and have my top favorite items so i went with a sure thing that i know is good, the green curry with beef (extra spicy) i liked trying different dishes that my family ordered as well, i know i will be ordering the beef thai basil next time ot was good
author: Will S.

description:
A friend and I came here and ordered the papaya salad (medium spicy) and some fried noodle dish that isn't on their yelp menu. The salad was very, very spicy. I loved it, but the other dish was terrible. The restaurant wasn't that busy but we had trouble flagging down the waitress. She only checked on us once, despite being there for over an hour and a half. 

The roti with ice cream and the thai iced tea were good, but not enough to make me come back. There's plenty of other Thai restaurants in the area, I'd suggest visiting one of those instead.
author: Adriana N.

description: Get the pork leg stew and fried tofu.... Yummy!
author: James W.

description:
Living "at the edge of" Tenderloin, there are TONS of choices when it comes to Thai restaurants who delivers. 

I use eat24.com for the food delivery, and I use them a LOT (*I hate eating alone at restaurants, so I order and get it delivered instead).

House of Thai (*previously known as Thai House Express or something) is only a block away from my place. Not in the best part of the neighborhood, but the food quality has been pretty solid for the past 10+ times I ordered.

--
My favorites are...

Pumpkin Curry: Nice portion, yummy huge chunks of pumpkin, very solid.

Beef Noodle Soup: Unlike Vietnamese beef noodle soup, Thai version's broth is very thick and rich. I love the fact that it has tons of meats!

Wonton Soup: VERY GOOD especially for the hangover cure. 

Mango with Sweet Sticky Rice: Simply delish. Good portion too.
======

The only reason why i have 4 stars instead of 5... 

They tend to take quite a long time for delivery.
Again, I live only one block from this place, but still average delivery time is about 1 hour+.

One time, after chatting with eat24.com operator to check the status, I was told that the delivery guy is on the way and should be at my place in 15 minutes. I LIVE NEXT BLOCK!! 

Other than that, their quality is pretty solid and hundreds of choices they have is pretty appealing for me to keep coming back to them.
author: Joji H.

description:
The food is REALLY tasty. My favorite is the pork belly, not a lot of places have this.



Portions are kinda small IMHO.
I think it's an expensive restaurant relatively speaking. A take out meal which is fairly small runs around $10. Plain rice. It probably makes more sense to eat in, with friends or a date and try different stuff, but then you have to consider that it's on the corner of Larkin and Geary. 

So, that being said, there are lots and lots of festivities going on which make this an interesting dining experience. You'll see drug dealers, drug addicts, hookers, transsexual hookers, tweakers, drunks, even a midget hooker all walking by. You'll have to dodge them on your way in too, that corner being particularly gnarly, probably the gnarliest on Geary st. 

Mind, its far from being dangerous,  it's in fact, very sad. 

Homeless people urinating and defecating in front of me while I eat aren't really my thing, i kinda feel sorry for them and i lose my appetite.
IMHO the TL should be more about "it's cheaper to eat out than make it myself" restaurants, because no one want's to step into human excrement on their way to a fancy dinner, and have people take a dump on the sidewalk inches away from their plates right? Wrong, this is San Francisco. 

My idea of a restaurant in an area such as this is Tu Lan. 


*Update

Compared to other Thai restaurants, this one is actually really good. I'm taking off one star for some of the dishes which can be a total miss (pork something and duck something, comes with a few slices of meat, and a LOT of rice.
author: Dusan B.

description:
They have a close gap for midday. I believe opened for lunch and closed for re-open at 4pm.

In the TL district/neighborhood in SF. The surroundings remind me of the rugged areas in downtown LA. 

Anyway, decent size venue. Have half booth seats and regular seating (chairs and tables). We were seated instantly, luckily made it time when it was re-opening for their day. After seated dived into ordering.

Portion is a good size; I guess you can say average size, but definitely more than than your healthy serving size, haha! I ordered the pad see ew (go-to Thai noodle dish all the time, boring I know). 

Ordered my dish with tofu, added chili paste and I was good. Unfortunately there wasn't enough greens for me - I was kind of sad. Not sure if their tradition is more carbs than greens but yeah... Not enough.

The quality of the dish is great! Our dishes came out one-by-one within a 15 minute time frame, which was awesome! Instant, quality taste and price wasn't too shabby! 

It's more expensive than most Thai places I been to, especially in SoCal but I know the living conditions are pricier here than LA. So maybe that was the case. I know for $9 noodle plate, my plate would be super filled and I'd have some leftovers to pack to-go.

Oh, he gave us no straws. Odd.

But that's why 3 stars: price for serving size didn't cut it for me. But other than that, it was chill. It was okay. 

Love ya, SF!
author: Chary S.

description: No star for me for this place, we order the noodle soup & other dishes, after we eat half way, we found the long hair in the noodle soup. We have to stop eating. This is very disgusting. I asked for the manager or owner, they only give me no charge for that dishes. I am not happy about it. I would not recommend this place to anyone. Find some other thai restaurant. They have a lot in this area.
author: Becky B.

description:
i got sick. end of story.
the shrimp was probably bad in the pad thai.
BEWARE
author: Erika S.

description: Ordered delivery. Arrived hot and ahead of schedule. Packaged perfectly. All fresh, clean and delicious. More than satisfied.
author: Geoffrey B.

description:
They are not kidding about the "express" portion. 

The decor here is fairly nice; a step up from Zen Yai. It's a big place too. I ordered the bamboo salad, a fried rice noodle dish, and their specialty pork leg. The waiter asked, "Have you ever had the bamboo salad?" Probably because it's unusual or people sometimes don't like it, I'm guessing. So even though I've never had it, I reassured the waiter that I had it. The bamboo salad was great; the noodles were pretty standard, but the stewed pork leg was somewhat of a disappointment. I've had better stewed pork legs at a few places, and since it's their specialty I was expecting better.

As I said in the beginning, it is truly express. You can order, go wash your hands, and all your food will be there by the time you come back. It's great if you're in a hurry or are hungry.
author: Ryan C.

description:
I got delivery for me and my sons because we were hungry and tired from exploring San Francisco. The food wasn't truly awful but it was far from good. The pad thai was tasteless. The gang jerd soup was lack luster. The sweet sticky rice with custard was kind of yucky - the rice and coconut cream were okay but the custard was kind of grey and didn't taste good. 

My kids ate the food so I gave it a star.  Another star for delivery under the estimated time and the food being hot.
author: Pritam K.

description: At work we ask House of Thai to cater a lunch for 80 people.   Not only was the food amazing, but the service was excellent too.   They were on time, helped us setup, and brought extra supplies to ensure everyone had enough.   We order a wide verity of items.  The green curry won everyone over.  They have a very yummy mango and sticky rice that was individually served.  I would highly recommend them for catering or for just a night out.
author: Mark B.

description:
Lunch. Party of Three. We sat ourselves. We ordered two appetizers. This bbq beef with green sauce. The beef was really tasty. 
Raw marinated shrimp with mild sauce. It was really interesting. My first time eating raw shrimp. It was tasty but too spicy for me still.

I order sukiyaki, stir fry. The waiter gave me the soup. -_- He returned it and gave me my stir fry. They give a lot of stuff in it but not a lot of noodles. It was extremely flavorful but I think they put a lot of msg. I was super thirsty the rest of the day. I also don't remember them refilling our waters. 

The food came out pretty fast and it gets pretty busy during lunch. Only one booth free while we were there.
author: Sarah C.

description:
Delivery guy couldn't find my apartment to begin with.
Ordered the pork belly and it was disgusting and way over cooked.
The wings appetizer was horrible. Mostly wing tips with no meat at all.
My girlfriend ordered the chicken curry. The flavor was decent but the chicken wasn't cleaned at all. So she threw it away along with all the food.
author: Matt R.

description: Although it is in Tenderloin, it has great food. I got the Pad Ke Mau and it was delicious. Make sure you don't get it extra spicy because you can barely eat it. Overall, fabulous place and yummy noodles. Would def recommend
author: Tulsi M.

description:
Beef ball soup was delicious, but I think my husband was suspicious of the beef balls... Loved the Pad See-Ew and the beef and chinese broccoli with rice noodles. 

Delivery said it would be 75-90 minutes, and when I checked 24 minutes later, the app had increased the wait to 90 minutes... but in the end, everything was delivered within 45 minutes total. 

Definitely would recommend, good solid delivery!
author: E. S.

description: Been going for a while and tried a good portion of the menu. Everything is delicious and flavorful. Definitely recommend Pork Stew.(With noodle, rice or by itself. All good!) The service have always been nice every time I visited. Definitely recommend to try out!
author: J Y.

description:
By far the BEST Thai food in the city!! I am not disappointed every time I go! The service is always super fast too. I love this place because it's nice enough to go out on a date but also casual enough that I could go eat by myself too!
The only problem is I never know what to order because I have a few favorites that I get all the time and I always want to order the same thing!
Try Po Tak Soup, Tom Kha soup, Larb, AND... Peanut Tofu!!!
author: Sarah Z.

description:
One of my favorite Thai restaurants in SF. The Thai Beef Jerky is awesome... literally mouth watering just thinking about it.

The prices are reasonable too, just wish it was a bit closer!
author: Lee R.

description:
I'd love to tell you how great House of Thai is. I'm sure the Pad See Ew I ordered might be delicious. The Lamb Stew that everyone raves about is probably delicious as well. 

The thing is, I have no idea because it's been an hour and forty minutes and my food is still MIA. I've called a few times and have been told that "the driver is on his way" but I'm still waiting. When you add in the bitchy customer service I received that replied "what do you expect me to do?" this place is a definite NO GO next time we want Thai.
author: Bill P.

description: I was in the city for a comedy show with my brothers and we were walking around looking for somewhere to eat and stumbled upon House of Thai. We were pleasantly surprised! We ordered the pumpkin curry, pad thai noodles with chicken, brown rice, and one of their soups. We shared everything and we all thought the pumpkin curry was maybe the best curry we've ever had. We've been back two times since and it's been just as good each time.
author: Sean W.

description: One star for the delivery service ONLY!!! It's ridiculous to wait 2 hrs for their food in a weekday night. This is not the first time that I wait so long from this place. I love their food A LOT, but the delivery service really pissed me off. Why do you make me starve!!!! Hire a couple of more delivery guys so people don't have to wait so long in busy hours!!!!! VERY ANGRY at making me starving so much : (
author: Jade J.

description:
Favorite Thai restaurant in the city. I eat here at least once a week. I'm not Thai, but I eat a lot and it definitely seems pretty authentic to me. Food is spicy and full of flavor. It's not one of those hip, trendy fusion-y places with dulled down taste, but it can be made mild.

They make one of the best Panang curries I've ever had. Spicy, creamy, rich, and definitely oily. I love it. And their basil beef/chicken is also one of the best I've had. You can get it also order it sliced (not w/ cheaper ground meat) which is a big plus.
author: Alpo H.

description: Do not get takeout.  It took nearly 2 hours to get our food, and we don't live on the other side of the city.  Food was just okay.  Everything was cold.
author: Dagmar H.

description:
This place is by far my most favorite Thai restaurant in the Bay area, HANDS DOWN. ---THAT, my friends,is a HUGE statement for me because I really am not a huge fan of many Thai restaurants in the Bay. 

Everything on the menu is made just like its suppose to taste from home :) Need I say more? TEN STARS IF I COULD!
author: Sai K.

description: Not great but not bad, struggled to give it 2 stars but did because Its seems like they've changed owners or cooks? House of Thai just seems really different from years prior...
author: Josie C.

description:
I rate & compare Thai restaurants based on three dishes: Pad Thai, Pad Ma Keur (with pork), and Green Curry (chicken).

No place I have yet found holds a candle to Thai House Express on these three standards.  I keep looking, but I just can't find any place better....

For the life of me, I just don't understand the appeal of Osha, when this place is only two blocks down the street!!
author: Droo G.

description: Never order takeout from this restaurant. An hour after taking our order on Seamless/ GrubHub, the waitress called to say it would be an hour or so more. No apologies, no refund. Fuck you House of Thai, get a order management system you assholes!
author: Vinnie M.

description: Good simple Thai food but very flavorful. It is kind of in a sketchy part of SF but just walk on the street like you own it. :D
author: Liz S.

description:
I walked by this place for months before noticing the sign.(i'm a bit blind at times)  
Walking into the House of Thai, I felt transformed. Nice vaulted ceilings with tasteful décor. I must have came during the slow time, had the restaurant to myself (not for long). The waiter was attentive and answered every question with a smile.  
If you lenjoy Thai food, you will enjoy this place.
 The duck larb was outstanding paired with a Thai iced coffee to help with the heat. Also, you can't get enough of the sticky rice. Grab an extra side of sticky rice, make dessert with it by adding cut up mangos and sweet condensed milk!!!
author: Quinn S.

description:
This was a rather eventful lunch for Jenna F. and me. As you'll see in a second, we won't ever forget it O_o. Talk about awkward. 

We decided on Thai. Not awkward. So we went here. Again, not awkward. 

The food was good! I look forward to going back multiple times and ordering my super not awkward and yummy tofu/veg/brown rice combo for 6 bucks (Srsly!) 

Our lunch was going well. Totally not awkward...

UNTIL SOME DUDE RAN INSIDE AND STARTED BEATING UP SOME OTHER DUDE. Totally random. Totally battery.

... O_o Talk about totally awkward.
author: Emily D.

description: Came here tonite, order the pad Thai, it was perfect, no complaint, service were good too!!!
author: Eddy T.

description:
Came across Thai House when I had been turned away from various restaurants that were already closing  up shop. By the time I arrived I was famished in desperate need of food due to the run around, and my stubborn self. Went with the fried tofu. It was fried nicely but overly oily. The peanut sauce on the side was also too sweet as were the beverages. My Thai ice tea was so sweet I literally took one sip and left it on the table. It was like licking a sugar cube! The other drink I tried was a lemonade Thai ice tea that was again TOO SWEET! They also offered dirty water glasses which made the whole experience unappealing. I asked for a new glass and that too was smudged with grime..

I paid shortly after and headed back to my car. The meal did not satiate my needs nor leave me with a pleasant disposition on the establishment. It just killed time and taste buds. One good thing was the quantity for the price. The fried tofu was cut in bountiful hefty chunks which was nice, as I was sharing. The price was also under eleven bucks I believe (minus tip). All in all the experience was below average. 

D- at best, looks like this is a no go for me folks..
author: Honey B.

description: Impossibly mismanaged expectations on delivery time. Quoted 45-60 minutes. More than two hours later. Still nothing. Don't bother.
author: Brandon K.

description:
Hands down, best Thai food in SF. Great service, slightly snide but their food carries it. 

The crab fried rice is my favorite. Used to be a bit more crab in it but times are tough dontcha know?

I trek here from across the city on a regular basis from the Inner Sunset, it's that good.
author: Katie D.

description:
On a whim, my bf and I went here for lunch on a balmy San Francisco afternoon, and we both ordered the pad see ew (our standard first order when trying a new Thai restaurant).  We both thought it was oh so tasty, but then we came back to read a Yelp review that they saw cockroaches there before....ew....that review was written awhile ago, but I sure hope Thai House Express remedied that problem.  How will I know?  Hmm...anyway, I would've given this place 4 stars, but I will give it 3 for now.

I loved the Thai iced coffee though, and the service was ehh...we sat down and didn't get menus for a very long time.  I had to walk over and get them myself!  That's forgivable though, I'm over it, but do get rid of those bugs if they are still there please.

2 pad see ew entrees+2 Thai iced coffees+tax+tip = $20
author: Maile N.

description: I came here recently for lunch on a weekend, and was really underwhelmed. I remember coming here many years ago for dinner and being impressed, but sadly the food has gone downhill. We ordered the pad kee mao, chicken satay, and green papaya salad and it was all just kind of ok. The seasonings were off and the flavors were just very boring. The ingredients also didn't seem super fresh. This is not what it used to be.
author: Jessie L.

description: We ordered 3 different foods. The Pad Kee Mao was so great but the other 2 (basil Thai chicken and yellow curry) were ok. Overall 3
author: Sara K.

description:
Food: 
1) Pad See Mao: This was another version of Pad See Eew but I think is just another version of Pad Thai except Pad See Mao uses the big flat rice noodles. This dish was soo yummy and flavorful! I really liked the level of spicy-ness and how all the veggies blended together into a big dish of YUMMY-NESS! Can't get enough of this!
2) Papaya salad: Doesn't look like too much but this salad really packed a spicy punch. I really liked it though. It used a lot of extra special ingredients. I think this is one of the best tasting papaya salads I've ever had!

Service: mediocre. nothing special. 

Ambiance: Not really decorated. Just looked like a run down thai fast food joint on the corner of a ghetto block. 

Price: super reasonable considering how good it was!
author: Amiee H.

description:
i don't write reviews too often, but when a place is this bad, i felt compelled to. this is the worst thai restaurant. called for delivery and was told an hour wait. fine. an hour passes and called again to see where the food is. the lady picked up and said it'll be coming in 20minutes and then hangs up. wait for 30minutes and still no food. it's been over an hour and half and the restaurant is only a few blocks away. guy on the phone said that i should have just came there to eat. hello? if you offer delivery, then provide delivery. 

service here is horrible. people there are horrible. will never eat there again and don't recommend it to anyone else.
author: Julie C.

description:
My fiance and I live in Oakland, but we love Thai food and decided to cross the Bay to give Thai House Express a try based on it's stellar reviews- and it is now one of our favorites! Even thinking about it while I write this review makes me want to jump on the Bart to go get some Thai food...

The area isn't that great, but the restaurant is clean and has a nice feel to it. 
There always seems to be way more staff there than is necessary, usually standing around chatting by the food pick up zone- but they are fairly friendly, and the service is really fast! I mean you sit down, order and your food is there, like delicious Thai magic. 

The Pad Kee Moa is excellent- really great flavors, and good spice- which is another great thing about Thai House Express, they will actually make your food spicy! (Thai spicy!)

I also love the Pad Ma-Keur, if you like eggplant definitely give it a try.

My fiance always orders the Chan Pad Poo - which is essentially Pad Thai but with dungeness crab. Pretty delicious. 

You really can't go wrong with anything on the menu, the curries are really good as well. If you live in the Bay Area and like Thai food go try Thai House Express!
author: Allie H.

description: Pretty sure the wait staff are ninjas cause you can never find one. The food is always delicious. I don't know about most people but i like more than one glass of water with my meal . Also my order came out before another table's. They were giving me they eye the whole time. Sorry :( stilla dank Thai spot in the tL
author: Matt H.

description:
Kao Ka Moo - Slow cooked stewed pork leg with sour pickled veggies and fresh chili garlic sauce.  Get this with a side of rice and you have the absolute perfect comfort food.

Other dishes here are good too, but lately I've been favoring Lers Ros over THE for authentic just-like-in-Thailand Thai.
author: Joanne G.

description:
House of Thai
I had one of my first dates with my boyfriend here. I have frequently gotten delivery as well as eaten at the restaurant. I always like what i order but tonight is the last night.

Tonight I placed an order over Eat 24 at about 7:35
at 7:40 I called House of thai to switch a dish of equal value. The girl I spoke to over the phone did not seem to hear me. I repeated it several times. She said she understood. Yay! I also asked her to add a side of lime. she tells me limes don't come with it. I ask her to add it for me like adding hot sauce. just one wedge, hoping it wouldn't be a big deal, if not then forget it. She agrees. Im happy, I'm hungry.

9:15 comes around and I call the restaurant again asking if they knew the status of my food. A nice girl tells me it should be right over.
Right on time after I hang up I get a call from the delivery man. 

I come to the kitchen open up my food only to see that they never switched my dish out! I call House of Thai and I am to blame apparently because the girl i spoke with has forgotten i said that. They keep calling me. I have been called back FOUR times now by House of Thai. Told the same thing over and over again. i just wanted a refund please on the pad thai i was not supposed to receive. its only 9 dollars or so but its the principle and the blaming they're doing thats bothering me. 

I am frustrated over something that could have been solved in 3 minutes and will never return again to one of my favorite thai places in the city.
author: Megan M.

description:
Posted this also under the House of Thai...
Did you know they have weekend breakfast?! (Fused)
Got up and out early on a Sat for the Fusion Breakfast
(and I mean Breakfast 7-10:30 Sat and Sun)
Hard to choose but went with the Chicken and Waffles with the cheesy polenta. Delicious!
BF got the pulled pork on the homemade chive biscuit with chipotle hollandaise. I questioned this choice but it came out and was Beautiful and super flavorful.
The cheesy polenta was creamy and everything I hoped for.
Only drawback-the walk home up the hill.
check out the menu 
http://www.flickr.com/photos/garysoup/8761049459/sizes/h/
author: Susan M.

description: Dirty, bad service, worst Thai food I've had in the city. Just gross.
author: Dexter H.

description:
I'll be honest. I laugh at those who say this corner of the TL is scary. A block or two (or more) down, I can understand. The corner of Geary and Larkin is quite busy and vibrant. If you're at any of the colorful bars in a 1 block radius, Thai House Express is one of the go to places to grab a bite in between drinks or even order delivery to the bar. Yes, it's also on the regular delivery rotation for bartenders in the area who are hungry while tapping the kegs or pouring stiff vodka tonics (and trying to get you to buy them a shot). 

Most of the food I've tried there is among the best Thai food I've had. I'll put it this way - I never even liked Thai food that much when living in New Jersey or New York City. Thai House Express and the other Thai places in the area have changed all that.  I tend not to venture too far from the same few dishes so I'll give the rundown of what I've had:

Pad Gra-Praw (w/ chicken) - One of my favorites. It's better with chicken than with beef as its more tender. I get the mild, which the average person would still consider spicy. I'd ask for extra mild but I'm Korean and it's already a blow to the ego to ask for mild. 

Pad See Ew - Another favorite. I can't say it stands out head and shoulders beyond any other Pad See Ew I've had but it's definitely good.  I've always thought of Pad Thai and Pad See Ew as introductory dishes for those just getting to know Thai food. 

I've tried several of the curries and they've all been delicious.

Pineapple fried rice- another good choice. Not the best but worth ordering.

Tom Yum Soup - Probably one of the best places I've had Tom Yum Soup at.
author: Bern H.

description:
I had a good experience at the Castro location so wanted to try the one in my hood. Yelpers seem to like them better than the one in Castro.

First off, the servers looked really tired and unhappy. I don't think I saw any one of them smile. Maybe they had just gone through lunch rush (this was about 2pm) but yeah I felt all sad. Our server brought us water.. and mine just happens to have a piece of long hair in it. Already it's a great start. 

No matter. It's just hair.. it's organic! We order the calamari for appetizer. It tasted fishy and was too chewy. One of the worst I've ever had. For main dish, my partner had the Pad Thai. It was one of the better Pad Thai's I've tasted, so yay for that. I had the Kao Pad Nam, fried rice with cured pork sausage and chinese broccoli. The sausage was .. different. Not my favorite dish. It was too spicy for a medium spice so all I could taste was hot not other flavors (except for the distinctive sausage). 

There are just too many other Thai places in this area of town and in SF generally. I could do without this one.
author: Vol T.

description:
My friend and I settled for this Thai restaurant because we couldn't find Siam Thai Restaurant, which is supposed to be a few blocks away from this restaurant. However, since I yelp a lot on my free time, I heard plenty of good things about Thai House Express so we were more than happy to dine here for dinner. Coming to this area (Tenderloin) is already a dangerous adventure itself - so we were hoping our taste buds would be on a better on.

My friend ordered #41 ($7.95): rice noodles topped with fish and shrimp balls, tofu, squid, and shrimp on a bed of spinach. Overall, this dish was just ok. The sauce was a thick, light pink sauce that had a hint of tomato; it was too sweet and slightly salty for my taste. And if I remember correctly, there was only one shrimp in the dish. -_-

I ordered #68 ($7.25): pan-fried noodles with chicken, egg, squid, and peanuts. I wanted to try something new, but it resembled very similarly to pad see ew. I was not too excited about this dish, because there was barely any squid or chopped peanuts. It tasted just like pad see ew, without the broccoli. I would have been better off ordering a noodle soup dish or pad thai.

The food wasn't bad - we both just kind of wish we ordered different dishes. The service isn't the best either, but they did refill our cups of water every twenty minutes or so. Last but not least, this place can get a bit loud. Is it just me or was my voice echoing off the walls of the restaurant? I found myself talking above "in-doors voice level".

Brownie points for being authentic. They write in Thai! (the bill is the proof) But eh, don't think I'll be back anytime soon.
author: Annie S.

description:
I eat here all the time. When I was in Hawaii for 3 months, the one thing I craved the most was their Pork Leg Noodle Soup. It is so yummy. Tender Pork that's falling apart, pickled vegetable for a little sourness, and a delicious rich broth.  I never get tired of eating it.  Other highlights are the pork leg stew over rice, the cured pork sausage fried rice, and their papaya salad. 

I heard they got purchased by someone who isn't Thai, which annoyed me at first. But nothing has really changed so I'm OK with it.....HAHA The service is also incredible which you can always expect from a Thai restaurant.
author: Michael C.

description:
Ordered take out from this place on a night with overtime at work.  My workers and I were browsing through yelp for some good noodle place that does take out and Thai seemed like the right choice.

We ordered the pad see we, pad kee mao, and the beef middle soup.  They have this online site for ordering take out, which made it so much more convenient for our preferences instead of a phone call.  We also found a coupon for the site, so we had an extra 10% off our order. 

They said they were going to take about an hour, but our food arrived at our building in just half an hour!  Food was still hot and it was very satisfying.  Tasted better than I expected.  

Even though the three of us were sharing our dishes, we still had a lot of leftovers and it fed us through next day's lunch.  I'm determined to come visit this place next time, or even order takeout online again for a lazy night at home.  

Oh, by the way, take out is only available from 5PM to 7PM, with a $15 minimum.
author: Nancy S.

description: YUM!  I ordered (I think? looking back on the menu...) Pad Himmaparn with fried tofu and it was super good.  This doesn't happen all the time in regards to vegetarian dishes, but the vegetables were all cooked perfectly- none overdone, none underdone.   I asked for it spicy and it was spiced perfectly.   The service is great too.  I tend to drink a LOT of water with meals so I'm constantly looking around for the wait staff to pour me more but my water glass never reached the half full (or empty) because the staff was always there to top it off! :)
author: Daisy A.

description:
Just wrote a review on a terrible Thai place so I thought it obligatory to write a review for my favorite. 

Formally known as Thai house express.

I found the place a number of years ago on the recommendation of my hair stylist, who happens to be Thai.

It is in a sketchy area, just a block above the heart of the crappiest part of the tenderloin, many will not want to go there at night. Myself on the other hand that is usually when I go. The area is really not that bad, just unsightly. I think it adds to the flavor. This place rocks...great food at really great prices. Service has always been friendly and quick. My favorite dish is "Gangre guy" I probably spelled it incorrectly, "Chicken with yellow curry and potato. Seriously, I have never had a bad dish, the chicken is moist and tender, the curry just the right flavor and not overpowering, Jasmine rice is perfect. Often I will also order the "Sticky" rice and dip it in peanut sauce. You can't go wrong here, hands down one of my favorite joints in the city. Simple...really good food at really good prices. Sounds like I own the place. :) wish I did.
author: david b.

description: We love this place!  Best Thai food we've found and we come here every time we are in SF!  We love the pork leg stew (you can also get the noodle dish with that and it's AWESOME!) and the spicy garlic sauce that comes with the stew!  We haven't had anything we don't love.
author: Dl J.

description: Holy crap, try the Tom Yum Noodle soup. The five star is for the tom yum noodle soup. I came in here thinking this was going to be a mediocre Thai restaurant, but one sip of the Tom Yum noodle soup and I knew this place was awesome. Everything else I ordered was ok, but the Tom Yum noodle soup was amazing. You won't regret it or call me up and i'll eat the rest for you.
author: Wil M.

description:
This place is in the tenderloin which isn't the best part of town but it's very clean inside and the food is really good. We ordered chicken pad thai and a few other dishes. I can't remember the names of all of them but there wasn't a dish I didn't like.

The services wasn't really friendly but they were quick and the food was good. I didn't see any street parking but like most san fran people you walk everywhere.
author: Kelly Y.

description:
FOOD:
pad kee mao = twas good but not as good as this one other restaurant 


SERVICE
Good

ATMOSPHERE:
random asian casual atmosphere w big screen tv playing some cheap show to pique our guilty pleasure. Right into the border of Tenderloin, def see some strange peeps

6.18
author: Angela L.

description: Mushy vegetables. Shrimp in the chicken pad Thai. Arrived cold. Mushy rice. 90 min wait. I'll pass.
author: Tony Z.

description:
My original rating was 1 star (due to bad service and a wrong order)

4 years later:

Moving from 1 star to 4 stars.

Ordered a few times after my first disappointments. Have been quite happy with the restaurant.
(And am glad to see it maintains a high cleanliness rating of 90... commendable given its neighborhood)
author: T S.

description: DO NOT ORDERE FOR DELIVERY. They told me they would deliver within 90 minutes. After an hour and 40 min I called and they said its 10min away. (I live no more than 5min away) Once I waited additional 30 minutes and called again they said they forgot about my order. The people working there are rude and speak broken english. Don't waste your time there are plenty other great Thai restaurants in the area.
author: M I.

description:
This place has been on our rotation for several years now. The food is reasonably cheap, good, open late, and there's always people in there. The staff are nice, though up until a  year or so ago, there was really bitter waitress there. But she's gone now, so all's good.

Regular items I order are Gai Gra Praw (basil chicken), Pad Se-ew (stir fried riboon noodles), Five Spices Duck Noodle Soup, Gang Dang (red curry), and a host of other items, including one I'm not particularly proud of: Pad Thai. No, I'm not white, but the Pad Thai is actually quite good here. I only discovered this because I came here with a friend who happened to order it.

Every now and then, a flock of lady boys will come in, which is always interesting.
author: J K.

description:
Solid but the last time we went, it wasn't as good as we remembered.

We love the spicy crab pad thai (Chan Pad Poo and the stewed pork  (Kao Ka Moo) there. 

Wish this place was located somewhere less ghetto... maybe they should open one in the south bay.  =)
author: Miss Bonnie B.
