description: Great service - clean and very well kept interior. And the food - great! I am a fan of Pad-See Ew and House of Thai never fails to meet high standards. Large portions, and the crab fried rice is a must! If you are near the Van Ness & Polk corridor, stop by!
author: Alexias L.

description:
I sat in our hotel room reading the reviews on Yelp before heading out.  It was a few blocks from our hotel so we decided to walk there.  As the other reviews have stated...yes it's in a sketchy neighborhood but that is where you will find good authentic Thai food.  The place is so cute.  Modern decor, open, and spacious.  I would say it's a very hip Thai restaurant :)

We walked in and was greeted and seated right away.  Awesome!  I'm Lao so I'm pretty damn picky about Thai/Lao food...  THis place blew me away.  Our server was quick and attentive.  She took our order and disappeared for about 10 mins.  Came back with our first dish.  Super quick!  

We ordered:

Pad Kee Mao - pretty good
Som Tum - yummy and spicy
Chicken Pumkin Curry - Amazing...I wanna to lick the plate lol
Fried Banana & Vanilla Ice Cream - Finger licking good

Food was so so yummy and of course, service was great!  Best service I have ever gotten from an Asian restaurant considering it's in the hood.
author: Pon K.

description: Dined here with my family. As soon as we walked in i felt like we were being judged off our looks or being darker asians? Not sure but we got a table for 6 pretty quick. We ordered duck larb, pad ke mao (chicken), mild papaya salad, chicken wings, pineapple fried rice and chicken pad thai. Wow the food was delicious! My favorite is the pad ke mao and duck larb, it was my first time trying it and man was it good and flavorful! I also got the dishes mild spice and could taste the kick! The servers seemed like they didnt care much for our table, barely refilled water & didnt say thank you after we did. Seems kinda rude, because we were really nice. Thats why i took two stars off. If we recieved better service they would have really been the perfect thai place to go to! =(
author: Brenda Y.

description:
My wife and I found this place completely by accident.  In the mood for Thai and it was down the street from a Hookah bar we were looking for.  

When our food came we were surprised by how good it was considering this was a random stop.   I said to my wife " I bet herein San Francisco this is just decent for them"  Maybe our palates just didn't know.  SO when we looked it up it turned out it was one of the highest rated restaurants in the city.  It is well deserved.  Great Thaoi food at reasonable prices, especially for San Francisco.
author: B W.

description:
3-1/2 stars.  I pass by this place a million times while driving through Geary.  Finally decided to pay this place a visit.  We got there early, around 6pm - place was empty, but we didn't mind.  

Again, we ordered Yelp recommended dishes:

(1)  Pork leg stew/soup with noodles - it comes with pickled vegetables, bean sprouts.  Taste-wise it was kinda unique, just because it's a bit sour, but salty at the same time without either being too overpowering.  I was disappointed though the soup was warm, and not hot.  IMO, the soup should always be hot especially when served with noodles.  You can have a choice of noodles, and we chose the flat rice noodles... I must say that the noodles came out broken (not good).  The pork leg was tender and fell off the bones, but beware, it's very fatty.

(2) Pad Thai - they claim on the menu that they have the best Pad Thai, voted by the Bay Guardian, so I had to give it a try.  I must say that their Pad Thai is one of the best I've tasted.  The taste was just perfect - best yet, was that the noodles were moist, not dry and full of flavor.  It was not oily, not too sour - perfectly done!  I really loved their Pad Thai.  

Their portions were not that big so believe it or not, we were still hungry after eating the 2 dishes, so my hubby ordered a Pad See Ewe to go, just in case we get hungry later on.  Their Pad See Ewe was not as great as the Pad Thai. First of all, it was very burnt, and very, I mean VERY oily.   I've had better Pad See Ewe in King of Thai than this place... 

Overall, if you go there, just ordered the Pad Thai.  That will be all you would want to order from here.

===========

Review #132
author: Jannie Q.

description:
Hi, my name is Justin, and I'm a Thai food addict. For me to not finish my Thai food it must have been pretty bad, or in this case pretty boring. Me throwing out Thai food is like crack head tossing out some rock. 

On top of that, I was really really hungry. It didn't have to be amazing for me to dig it, but it was just.. really lacking I guess. 

I wanted to like this place, I really did. It's generally pretty busy which is a good sign, plus it's only about 4 blocks from my place. And it was awesome when I opened the bathroom door to be greeted by loud thumpin' house music complete with good bass. It was like a nightclub in that bathroom, I felt like I should grab a drink and find a spot to dance.

As fun as that all is, I still was there for food, and the food was not good. Wouldn't say bad, it was just bland. It served it's purpose but I'll likely go back to passing this place by. Unless of course I want to dance in their bathroom.
author: Justin N.

description: Do what it is supposed to do -- good, cheap food, and satisfying.
author: L S.

description:
Although I had to walk to the loin to get to this place, I think it's probably some of the best thai I've ever had. I ordered the pork leg stew, which is more like a thai version of pulled pork (there are no bones), some noodle salad with shrimp, and the fish of the day.  Everything was delicious and felt very home cooked.  I got the noodle salad mild from the servers recommendation, and boy am I glad I did.  Their spiciness scale is way skewed. I'm probably just going to stick with mild going forward.

My friend and I sat there for over 2 hours, attempted to eat everything and even tried to share a dessert of sticky rice. 

I can't wait to return and try some of the other items on the menu. This might just be my new favorite thai restaurant.

and oh yeah. it was extremely well priced and the service was great.
author: Skye W.

description:
Heard new owners took over this spot. That would explain the drop in food quality and change in recipes. 

Not the same anymore, how sad.

Lers Ros is now the only spot I go for Thai.
author: Derrick V.

description: Salmon Curry is the besssst. My favorite Thai dish in the city.
author: Colleen B.

description: The food is not that great. The ingredients are not well blend and tasted pretty plain.
author: Jen N.

description: Found a gem in our neighborhood. I love Thai food and we've tried a couple restaurants in the neighborhood but I think this is my favorite. The food was flavorful and there was a decent amount of protein in each dish. I recommend the eggplant and basil dish with chicken, and also the beef and Chinese broccoli.
author: Anisha A.

description:
The name of this restaurant suits itself in that since it kind of borders a little more of the seedy areas of the TL it will cause some folks, who don't feel as comfortable being in the area, to want to eat their food quickly and go or just get the food to-go.  Whatever you decide to do, eat in or take out, they are pretty quick about getting your food to you.

If ever I have a hungering for some tasty crab fried rice, this is my go-to Thai restaurant as, in my opinion, they make it best.  The pad see ew and dessert roti are quite good as well.  Beware with the curries though as every time I've ordered them from here they have been really spicy.
author: Erich D.

description:
I've had great Thai food on both coasts and believe me, it doesn't get any better than this. San Francisco has amazing Thai restaurants, but I have to tell you, after discovering  Thai House Express, I don't need to try any other places.
And affordable! Last trip there, out party of four had the papaya salad, chicken pad thai, tofu in red curry sauce, chicken with green curry, and one round of alcoholic drinks (two beers, two mixed) all for under $65 before tip! How can you beat that?
Every dish was amazing and all four of us raved about it while we were eating. Almost couldn't talk about anything else.
author: Arin E.

description:
I did a bad thing: 

I ordered online & then forgot to bring my phone (both my door buzzer & my phone in one nifty device) nearby....BUT! I was quoted 45-60 minute delivery window & my food showed up in 10.

Literally 10 minutes.

How awesome is that?

HOT-steaming HOT food. I ordered 2 noodle dishes: Pad Thai & Pad Kee Mao. The Pad Thai was ok --pretty cool that the noodles & the bean sprouts came in separate compartments. But, quite honestly, I want the bean sprouts to be steaming/cooking/heating in the hot Pad Thai. So, that's what I did when I got them: mixed them together.
For my taste, not enough tamarind sauce, hardly any peanuts, no limes. That's what makes the dish for me...so when all these things were lacking, I felt sad.

The Pad Kee Mao was better -- more vegetables, as it requires, good flavor...a little zing! YUM

Just to get a couple of things straight: I live near the TL, so no, I'm not scared of the scary neighborhood. Be smart, be straight, be open to adventure. 

Thai House Express has pretty decent food. What's interesting is that it seems a lot of Thai people love this place. Isn't it worth giving it a try?
author: Yasi S.

description:
You have great food, but I live exactly 2.4 mi away from you. 

I know because I mapped it on google while starving for your Gai Yang chicken. 

Your delivery radius is 1.9 mi. Seriously??? Please extend it by half a mile! 

I can't help but feel so vindictively hungry that I removed a star from this review.

Who seriously wants to pick up food at night in the middle of the Tenderloin? 

Sincerely, 

Starving in Mission Bay. 

(but seriously, love your food)
author: Andrea L.

description: Authentic Thai food with a friendly staff.  Food was served quickly with fresh ingredients.  Reminds me of food from when I lived in Thailand. I definitely recommend this for visitors in the area.
author: Bryan G.

description:
I came here for a quick bite and to dreadfully taste the larb they had. I don't get why it is so hard for me to find more than two places that actually make it the way I like. The larb here wasn't excellent, but it also wasn't bad either. It was aiite. 

I really need to start ordering other things other than larb at Thai places. I tend to give low ratings to those Thai restaurants that do not make it the way I like. I'm hard to please at times.

The customer service was good, the ambiance was okay with their windows overlooking the busy city streets and us watching to make sure no one came to tow our car away. I might be back, I don't live in the area anyways.
author: Kim T.

description:
Surprised by how authentic the food was, they had Kao Pad Gang Khew (fried rice with green curry paste) which I've only ever seen in Bangkok.  Came here for a midnight snack after rock climbing with coworkers, and would definitely come back!

Update 9/2016:  Cross-posting dish reviews from my "House of Thai 2" review:

---- DRY NOODLES ----

Pad See Ew:  5 stars
Yummy, they have the sweet sticky soy sauce down! Reminiscent of the best fried carrot cake dishes in Singapore.

Pad Thai:  4.5 stars

Kao Soy:  2.5 stars
I just really didn't like the texture of these steamed egg noodles, perhaps it's just personal preference.  The curry sauce was okay but chicken strips were dry.  The best part of this was the crispy noodle bits they served on the side.

Rad-Na:  3 stars
Wide flat rice noodles in lots of gravy, but the gravy is so salty!  I would've loved to drink all the sauce otherwise.  And the chicken (cut in thin strips) was pretty dry.

---- NOODLE SOUPS ----

Beef Noodle Soup:  3.5 stars
Delicious beef balls, lots of other fatty beef and organs.  Good for when I'm ill and need a hearty soup.  Asked for reduced salt.

Duck Noodle Soup:  4 stars
I asked for reduced salt / MSG and it still turned out super flavourful.  Duck meat was delicious and juicy, we couldn't stop though we were stuffed.  They give so much duck meat, this lasts me two meals when I order it delivery.

Pork Leg Stew Noodle Soup:  4 stars
Delicious soup and fatty pork leg!  Again, reduce the salt.

Chicken Noodle Soup:  5 stars
Okay, HOLD UP.  How have I been ordering food from here for over 2 years and this is my first time getting this?  If you have eaten in the hawker centres / food courts of Singapore growing up, you will recognise this familiar, pure chicken broth taste it is amazing and reminds me of home.  Many Thai / Vietnamese / Americanised Chinese soups I've tried skew too sweet or too salty, but this has the perfect balance and the chicken flavour shines through.  The chicken is just boiled chicken but still better than the chicken that comes with rice and noodle dishes.  Gosh I would eat this every week--when I'm craving a legitimate Asian flavour, when I want something light, when I'm feeling under the weather.  It's more "bland" than the other noodle soups so if you want something really salty, get the Duck Noodle soup and if you want a punch of flavour get the Tom Yum soup.  But if you know what's up -- get this chicken noodle soup.

---- OTHER SAVOURY DISHES ----

Chicken Satay:  3.5 stars
Surprisingly good and tender, but not as flavourful or chewy as Singaporean marinated satay of course.

Ped Yang: 3.5 stars
Their duck is fantastic, but why get this when you can get the duck noodle soup?

Kao Pad Gang Khew: 4 stars
Green curry paste fried rice. Yummy and flavourful rice, but the chicken strips were a bit dry.  Their pork in general is better than their chicken.

Yellow Curry Chicken:  3.5 stars
Standard.  Satisfying.

Pineapple Fried Rice:  4 stars
Pineapple chunks, cashews, egg, onions, even raisins and carrots up in your rice.  Sometimes you're just craving it.  And House of Thai has your back.

---- DESSERT ----

Roti:  4 stars
How can something so simple taste so good?  Crispy dessert roti oozing with sweet condensed milk.  Goes great with yellow curry.
author: Letitia L.

description: I love this place! I have tried many thai places in the city and I keep coming back here. I usually get the pumpkin curry with chicken but have had several noodle dishes as well, all very good. The actual sit down restaurant is a little lacking but not to the extent of avoiding it.
author: C K.

description:
Thai House Express is one of my favorite places for a quick and causal lunch in the city. Parking is easy with plenty of meters around ($2/hour at the time of this review).  

Here's what we get when we go -

* Duck Larb - Tasty mixture of duck, onion, cilantro, green onion, rice powder and lemon dressing served over raw cabbage. It is duck so there are certainly fatty pieces, not for those on a strict diet!

* Kao Soy - One of my favorite dishes. Simple yellow chicken curry over egg noodles and mustard greens, topped with crunchy noodle strands. They don't skimp on the curry here and there's plenty for extra egg noodles that can be added to the order.

* Beef Noodle - The nice and strong flavored broth made this a delicious comfort food. We always get this with thin noodles.  

Tasty food for a reasonable price.  My kind of a restaurant!
author: Christine C.

description:
Moo Tod! Pineapple Fried Rice! Thai Iced Tea! Ohhh!
Try the duck with the spicy soy sauce. It will kick you in the mouth if you can't handle spicy food, but it's a nice dish to have with the Thai iced tea. I have ordered various items on the menu and I have never been disappointed. One of the 4 best Thai places in the city where you can always get a fast table with quality service. Also you can make new friends! This place has the perfect atmosphere and it's a great place to go Friday nights before a movie.
The desserts can be really sweet, but if you have just finished a spicy meal, the sweetness is perfect.
4.5 stars all around
author: Antoinette C.

description: Everything here is delicious. super fast and cheap. Also very good for Take out! All the noodle soups are so sooo good. and the pork dish with string beans is the bombbbb...their soups are good too they give you lots of seafood! Cant wait to go bakc and try their diff dishes
author: Cindy L.

description:
I ordered delivery from here last night and it was awesome. It took 45 min from when I placed my order to when I received the food, (they stated 45min - 1 hr so I knew what to expect) and it was delivered hot and fresh. 

The food was delicious and the items that were supposed to be spicy were actually spicy! Portions were large -- I ordered 2 curries, one noodle dish, and a salad which came out to $35 or so, and this fed 3 people for dinner with a ton of leftovers. The 'Yum' salad with tofu actually does not have much lettuce/greens in it, but the crispy tofu and all the seasoning/spices in it are SO good. Highly recommend.
author: Richa A.

description:
I order delivery quite often and I have been trolling through Thai places that deliver late-after 9- and found this place. The woman who took my order was clear and concise and very polite!  She sais 30-40 min and the food arrived just under 30 min.  

The crab noodles were amazing!  Hot, sweet, fresh and yummy.  The green papaya salad was one of the best I've had. The reviews didn't lie and I am happy to say that this place is my new go-to for Delivery!
author: emily b.

description:
My boyfriend and I ordered online for this restaurant. Took well over two hours to be delivered. If you want good Thai food, go elsewhere. It was a very very long wait, and it certainly wasn't worth it.

When the food finally arrived, it was cold. Not impressed. Again, go elsewhere.
author: Charlotte S.

description:
The neighborhood is not that bad -- even though the location here says TL -- it is still a busy street corner and not far from a couple of bars.  Definitely not the worst part of the city.

I'm a creature of habit and tend to always order pad thai.  It is just good comfort food.  The pad thai here was very good.  Ordered with shrimp and tofu - full of flavor!

The service was nice - very friendly staff.  Clean dining room that was packed at 9:30 pm on a Tuesday...that says something.
author: Wendy P.

description:
My wife took me to my first Thai Restaurant.
The prices were cheap and the food was great. The FBI is always the finisher. For you fellas, it is the Fried Banana and Ice cream. Sure to win the hearts of the ladies. I spent most of my time there watching the TV and watching people walk by on the streets.
author: Teason M.

description:
This review does not reflect food quality, but rather delivery service.

We order often from House Of Thai. Some of their delivery staff are fine. Some have a habit of making you come downstairs to the front door of the apartment building to get your food. One of the better delivery servers told us that the reason they do this is out of laziness; plus, the more places they can deliver to, the more money they make.

Finally, we started to leave special instructions with the restaurant for the delivery people to call us from the keypad downstairs and we would buzz them in.

Tonight, in spite of our instructions, the delivery person called from a cellphone. We told him to hang up and call from the keypad downstairs. He ignored us and called on the keypad again. We decided not to leave a tip, whereas we ordinarily leave 15%, which I understand is the standard for delivery.

I went downstairs and looked around and there was no one around. I went back upstairs. The delivery person called again using his cell phone. I went back downstairs and got the food, not leaving a tip.

Shortly after, the delivery person called us again, asking if we had made a mistake not tipping him. I explained to him why we had not tipped him. He told me he had had to move his car because the police were about to ticket him, that he needed the money because he had a new baby, etc, and that he wouldn't be delivering to us anymore.

Now, the average customer would no doubt consider it the height of gall to threaten lack of future service for not tipping, but I don't necessarily. I was in the restaurant business for 20 years, as a busser, as a waiter, and even as a delivery person. If our delivery person had followed instructions and called from the keypad and delivered the food to our door, and I had not tipped, my opinion is that he would have been justified in complaining. That's how the guy makes his money and he deserves to be paid...IF he does his job. My problem with this guy is that he doesn't want to do his job and he still wants to get paid.

We called the restaurant to complain but there was no manager to speak to.

I am writing this review in the hope that the restaurant owners will properly train their delivery people in the future to avoid losing business.
author: Michael K.

description:
The pad see ew is AWESOME. The portions are humongous but I actually finished my whole plate. And usually, I don't finish huge plates in one sitting. But this stuff was so good I couldn't stop eating it!! And if I did stop eating it, one of my friends probably would have finished it for me. And this dish was so good that I wanted it all to myself. Talk about fatass status.

1 star off for slow service. The place was practically empty but it took a while for our the server to come take our order, and for the food to come out. Also the food didn't come out at the same time, so by the time the last dish came out, I was already halfway done with mine.
author: Crystal C.

description: My favorite Thai place in the city! Fast and friendly service! Food is consistent and extremely flavorful! Always bring my out of town friends here for a delicious hot meal! Love the red curry, beef pad se-ew, and fried pork belly
author: Chris Y.

description: When last in the city, hubby and I wanted to try Lers Ros, but the wait was out the door. Just a few blocks away, House of Thai was a satisfactory alternative with no wait. I had Pad Kee Mao with beef and hubby had fried rice. He really enjoyed his fried rice but I found the Pad Kee Mao to be a bit somehow bland, but spicy. (I guess the only flavor was spice?) Also had a tasty mango margarita and found the place to be loud (or maybe that was the loud group next to us.) I'd search for better options if I had the time, although wait staff here is very friendly.
author: Rachel B.

description: We ordered Pad Thai with shrimp, Pork leg stew and Pla Muk Gra-Tiem. 4 star for the first 2, 3 star for the last one. The price is very reasonable. Food service was really fast!
author: Mia S.

description:
Came here around 10 pm on weeknight. Being that I live a few blocks away, by some not so great thai places, I was concerned this place wouldn't be that great either, but I was pleasantly surprised. The thai tea came in a relatively large portion compared to how stingy some places are with it ($4 for a 6 oz glass filledd with ice!?), and the food was fantastic. I'm not usually a salad person but the crispy catfish salad was soo good. I've never had fried catfish like that before, the texture was really airy and light. I ordered it medium spicy, which was good but almost overpowered the delicate flavors.
This place can get very busy, so don't come here if you want to be holding quiet, intimate conversations. Love the location too, it's right by AMC and stays open late enough you can grab a bite after your movie.
author: Montana O.

description:
We ordered 7 dishes last night and liked them all.

- Fish Cake - very good
- Papaya Salad - the best
- Thai Style Beef Jerky - very salty
- Thai Style Bamboo Salad - too salty
- Kau Gai Noodles - always delicious
- Lad Nah noodles - very good
- Kao Ka Moo, rice top with pork leg - very good

The price is reasonable.
All the waitresses were very nice and attentive.
This is the place we always go to when we are in the city.
author: Cholada C.

description:
I came here on Memorial Day for dinner after finding out that the Thai restaurant in Japantown was closed, and also after giving change to a homeless guy with a brown substance on the back of his pants, but enough of that...

At first thought, this place looked really Americanized but once inside and saw the workers, I was a bit relieved. I ordered Pad Thai and Thai Iced Tea. My friends ordered Duck Noodle Soup and a rice plate with chicken I think, as well as a Mint Lemonade.

Thai Tea was very sweet, but not as sweet as most Thai places I've been to. The lemonade was extremely sour and according to my friend, too sweet, but the sweetness seemed okay to me. It was just very sour, which could be good or bad depending on what you like.

I thought the Pad Thai was pretty good at first, but then I tasted a weird aftertaste. I realized after a few bites that it was a really fishy aftertaste. I've NEVER tasted fishyness in any Pad Thai dishes from Thai restaurants I've ordered from, and this first time was not pleasant!! It was gross!!
 
Portion-wise, I think it's decent for the price you pay. Not the best, but not bad either. I was filled up when I was done with my Pad Thai, but I can get full easily and I ate a snack not so long before I ate dinner.

Service was great. The waitress who attended my table was attentive and answered our questions. Water was refilled often enough. The only thing I would have liked to see are smiles!

I say, stay away from the Pad Thai unless you aren't bothered by a fishy flavor in that dish.
author: Monica T.

description: I remember when the food here used to blow my mind. That was about five years ago. This time, the food was below average. The Por-Pia Sod (fresh spring roll) was very obviously microwaved and wasn't very good. The Kao Kah Moo (pork leg stew) was very dry. Should've been braised longer. Service was okay. Nice enough and I didn't have to ask them to refill my water.
author: Tan P.

description: This place used to be very good. Good price and decent food. Now they changed name and owner, the good quality is not even close to a regular Thai place. Also they raise the price. I will not come back and if you are craving for Thai, go somewhere else !
author: Ja X.

description:
I'm giving these guys one out of five stars for misleading communication.  In short, it took an hour and half to get my food delivered.

I ordered the food through grub hub originally. 25 minutes after the estimated delivery time, I called the restaurant directly asking whether my food was on its way and was told it would be at my apt in 5 minutes. 

After another 25 more minutes, I called grub hub and they gave me a refund (due to the delivery being late). Grub hub was told by the restaurant that the food was on its way. After some more time passed, I called the restaurant again, and was told that the delivery person was in the area and would be at my apt in 5 minutes. 

After about another 20 minutes, I called the restaurant again. They gave me a spiel about some sort of furnace breaking down and that they couldn't get ahold of the driver. I told them that they should just be upfront with me, I wouldn't have cared that much if the food wasn't on its way but if I had been told earlier, I would have ordered somewhere else. 

After about 1.5 hours of waiting for my food, it came. When asking the driver what happened, he said he had had another deliver before mine. 

The food tastes pretty good and hopefully grub hub actually refunds my money. It's the process that is deserving of "eek! me thinks not".
author: Vitaliy D.

description: The food smelt really funny, like an old rug. Ended up throwing it away without eating any of it. Not sure why it has 4 stars. Maybe the cook had a bad day or I just got a bad batch.
author: V E.

description:
Everything I've ever ordered here is consistently more than average to excellent (other Thai places vary widely from so-so to excellent dishes depending on what you order or even which day). They have the best Pad See Ew I've had in the City, heck, anywhere not call Thailand (an fyi, the VNese spelling is "Thai Lan", so pull out that knowledge at your next function). The soft-shelled crab papaya salad is good - sour, sweet, salty, cooling - though it might be on the spicy side if you're not into hot peppers. The sauteed shrimp and squid eggplant over rice is also a sure thing.

ITTET* one still has to go out and eat - and eat well - right? It's even better if a meal's cost is reasonable so there are funds left for desserts and booze. This place never fails to deliver on both counts. If it wasn't for the difficulty in finding parking spaces, and being located in a pepper-spray-required part of the City, I'd go here lots more often, even ITTET.

*In These Tough Economic Times
author: Peter L.

description:
Okay!

If i'm writing a review for a place I ORDERED food from, they're doing something right.
I eat out 5 days a week, and was in the mood to try something new.

Though I'm no stranger to Thai food, The Thai House express menu caught my eye.
Maybe it was the authenticity, maybe I was hungry.. anyway.. I was INTRIGUED..

I started out with the Thai House combo.
Its a Combination of 2 egg rolls, 2 fish cakes, 2 golden bags, fried tofu.. 
The egg rolls and fried tofu were nothing to write home about, but the Fish cakes and the golden bags made me weep for more. The sweet and sour dip served with the appetizers is a delight.

Next on my menu was the Moo Tod.. a delightful dish of  Crispy garlic-cilantro marinated pork, served with house-sweet and sour sauce, and jasmine rice. It was flavorful, aromatic and in general a very pleasing experience.

Finally, feeling a bit full (the portion sizes are quite large) i moved on to demolish the Shrimp-paste fried rice. Needless to say, lip smacker..

The delivery was quick and efficient, the food was wonderful..
I'm sure to dial again.

Want to try the Soups and Desserts next..
author: Akshay V.

description:
DO NOT SUPPORT THIS ESTABLISHMENT!

I liked this place at first. They serve some Lao dishes, such as papaya salad and laab. However, one day I saw a sign at the door, written in Thai, that says "Red shirt supporters not welcomed." I was horrified that this restaurant would say such a thing. 

If you are not familiar with the red shirts and yellow shirts situation, allow me to summarize it here. The red shirts make up mostly of the rural Thais who are the majority in Thailand. They elected a very popular Prime Minister (Taksin) . However, the yellow shirts (the color of the King), who make up of mostly Bangkok elites; benefit from the system and are tied to the royal court, did not like that the rural people actually have a say. The yellow shirts believe that the red shirts are "poor" and "uneducated" country bumpkins not worthy of making the right decisions, thus the red shirts should not allowed to vote. 

The yellow shirts blocked Bangkok airport for a week, ousted Primister Taksin with the support of the army and replaced him with Mr. Abisit. The red shirts were not happy with the military-supported new Prime Minister, so they staged a peaceful protest in the middle of Bangkok. The Military arrested their leaders, openly shot at the unarmed villagers. It was a massacre that many western countries, including the US, turned a blind eye. 

The media has been censored. All media outlets: radio and tv stations, newspaper and websites of the red shirts have been shut down, while the yellow shirts' media outlet could run freely.  Not sure what will happen next, election? Unlikely because the red shirt will vote someone into power again. 

DO NOT SUPPORT THIS ESTABLISHMENT for wanting to take democracy away from rural Thai people. How would you react if you see a sign at any restaurant in the city that says "Democrats are not welcomed" or "Gays are not welcomed."
author: Vince S.

description:
Came here because of friend's recommendation for authentic Thai food. The food tasted great, and they delivered the real Thai spicy flavor. The price is pretty reasonable. 
Why stars off? The restaurant ambient is not my favorite. It has this gloomy ambient and I felt pretty depressed sitting there--sorry to say so.  While we were sitting there, we heard something like the gun shot in the area in proximity. I didn't end up enjoying my meal because I was scared and nervous. May be going back to order take home if I ever go again.
author: Elle W.

description: The location is really nice and also the service. It takes only a few minutes from the time when you order your meal and you get it that is really good. They have about 100 different meals thats crazy.
author: Simon W.

description:
I ordered delivery from here after seeing all the great reviews, but the food was just OK  Food came in about 40 mins. 

I ordered the Som Tom salad with crab.  I was expecting crab meat not crab shells which I had to pick out.  Might also be a good idea for them to slice up the giant pieces of lettuce.  

The Pad Prik King was tasty but the green beans were a little on the soggy side, along with the steamed veggies.  

I did enjoy their Pumpkin curry with chicken.
author: Michelle H.

description:
I would like to consider myself a Thai food connoisseur and Thai House Express is where it's at! 

They definitely know what "extra spicy" means here! If you are a noodle and seafood lover i'd highly recommend the Chan Pad Poo and for a rice dish you have to try the Pad Gra-Praw with chicken!

You are in the heart of the TL and you might get offered some delicious crack from the lovely crackheads BUT the food is definitely worth the trip. You won't be disappointed :)
author: Jennifer D.

description:
SO AMAZING! I have been looking for a good Thai Place(that also delivers) and this place hits the spot

I ordered from Thai House Express on New Years Day and even though the wait for our delivery was over an hour, it was well worth the wait

We ordered the Chan Pad Poo(Crab pad thai), the Tom Yum with tofu and vegetables and the vegetarian spring rolls( filled with mushrooms, clear noodles, carrots, celery)

Chan Pad Poo: I was a little nervous ordering this because i didn't want it to have an fishy flavor or smell to it and was happily surprised when we received it. They use real crab which is an absolute plus! This had such great flavor. I love that you have the option to change the spicy level(mild, medium and hot). We both love spicy food but ordered the medium and that was PLENTY spicy for both of us. We almost alwasy have leftovers but we cleaned our plates with this one

Tom Yum: This is your classic Tom Yum soup. Again, you get to choose the level of spice and we ordered this medium. Perfect amount of heat and had great vareity of vegetables and soft tofu. It was so yummy and was perfect for a foggy, cold night

Vegetarian Spring Rolls: I have to say that I am not the biggest egg roll fan but these were SO good. The order comes wih 4 large spring rolls and a spicy sweet and sour sauce. These were great and even though i was full, I ended up eating 2!

For the three items and tip it came out to $30. 

This place really hit the spot after our night out. We will defintley be ordering from this place again to try the yellow curry!
author: Whitney S.

description:
I love coming to Thai House Express. It's one of my favorite Thai places to dine at in the city. Yes, it's located in a sketchy area... just walk in well lit places and carry some pepper spray! haha. Anyway, the food here comes out fast... hence why it's called EXPRESS! The price is very reasonable and not overly priced... and... its like a party in your mouth. All their curries are really good, all flavorful and rich. Meat pieces aren't dry either. The green curry is my favorite... it's just really spicy. Sometimes I settle for the yellow curry because I don't feel like sweating bullets. The papaya salad here is good too, they also ask you how spicy you want it. I usually get mild... but it still has a nice kick. Pad ke mao and Pad se ew... yummm. A little bit greasy, but still very tasty. The pad thai here is really good too, has a nice balance to it and isn't too sweat like other pad thai's I've had. The pad ke moo or the braised pork dish.. is my favorite. It comes with chinese broccoli on the bottom, but the pork is like OMG good. Tasty and juicy. The sauce that comes with it has a nice spicy kick to it.

Overall, the food here is great. I've been eating here for years and they've stayed consistent with everything. They stay open till pretty late. Food is always done fast. Service is great. I would recommend this place for some good Thai food!
author: Johnson S.

description: The restaurant is clean. The food is prepared quickly and is delicious. However, the service is just okay.  As in, you will have to request a refill on your drink and although you are drinking regular coke they will bring you diet coke, "okay."  Would I be back, sure! For takeout, or delivery. The waitstaff is not engaging enough for me to try them out again.
author: Jillian M.

description: A friend of a friend recommended this place.  Very good indeed. The pork belly with green beans is awesome! Also had the green curry with chicken. I asked for spicy and the waiter asked me if I wanted it "Thai hot". I said yes please :). Oh yeah I was not disappointed!
author: Garrick G.

description: OMG expensive for the smallest portions ever. It's close to my house so I always go here but I shouldn't! Just okay.
author: Laura P.

description:
The menu is very large, which is common for ethnic food, but typically menus of this size suggest that the kitchen is to spread out to make really great food.  I found the food to be reasonably good despite having such a bloated menu.  On the plus side, people can expect to find all the fish, curries, noodles, salads, and rice dishes that they have grown to love and expect on a standard thai menu. 

I (or others in my group) have ordered traditional dishes like pad kee mao, papaya salad, and pad thai and they are all solid.  The food came out hot. The ingredients were pretty good, especially the basil.    The spicing (heat level) of the food was just right (not Thailand level spicy but not suburbia spicy either).  

In addition to these i ordered rice and 5 spice duck, which was very good. 
I also ordered a pork belly chef special with green beans, basil and peppers.  This dish was really awesome.  The pork belly had a nice crispy fried texture on one side, and a nice soft, fatty, braised texture on the other.  The huge helping of green beans helped add balance to the otherwise heavy dish.  

I appreciate the authentic, yet less common items offered on the menu.  It reminds me of some of the authentic thai restaurants in LA's East Hollywood neighborhood. 

I would definitely come back here again.

I am looking forward to trying les ros to see how they compare.
author: Jeremy R.

description:
This Thai place was just okay for me. Nothing to fancy, nothing really to gloat about. I ordered *thinks for a few minutes* I don't remember but it wasn't what I thought it would be. It didn't really have any taste too. It tasted like Top Ramen with hot water and chicken broth. 

My friend ordered the Pad Seew and yes, I admit, I'm biased when it comes to this dish. Not only is it my all-time favorite Thai dishes but I also know how to make it at home *thanks Thai mom*. I'm not saying I'm the best cook BUT no restaurant can beat my Pad Seew. I learned from the best. Yes, my Thai mom had her very own restaurant for 13 years (I think it's actually longer than that). 

Even the Pad Seew dish was blah. 

This place is just that, blah....
author: Jay C.

description:
my flavorite pra ram. 
delivery is super fast, and the dining in service is excellent. 
even if i didnt live in the neighborhood id come here on the regs.
author: coffeecake j.

description: Nice looking restaurant.  Great tasting food.  Fast & friendly service.  Affordable prices.  One of my favorite Thai places in the City.
author: Rose A.

description:
I'll start off by saying that I would give this 4 and a half stars if I could. 

A friend and I visited this place because a friend of hers said it was awesome and because she read the Yelp reviews and sent the link to me. Based off of the reviews we were sold. 

We went on a Wednesday night at about 7 and there was a decent amount of people but I wouldn't call it crowded. I got there first and despite not having my friend there they still sat me. I ordered a glass of their house Cab and found it tasty. 

Once Amber got there we agreed on sharing the Por-Pier Sod for an appetizer and the Pad Thai and the Chicken Pra-Ram as entrees. 

The Por-Pier are rice paper rolls stuffed with Chinese Sausage and other yummy stuff. We had never had it and thought it sounded good. Was it good? **** yes it was! I can't wait to order it again. It was very different from anything I have ever tasted. I really enjoyed it.

Pad Thai is a pretty typical dish to order at a Thai place but we decided to try it here because of the "Best of the Bay, voted Best Pad Thai by the Bay Guardian" claim it had on the menu. It was indeed quite tasty. They weren't skimpy with the shrimp which is often the case at other places.

The Chicken Pra-Ram was (please excuse my east bay slang) off the hook. It was my first time trying this dish and Thai House has made it a favorite of mine. If you like peanut sauce, I say shove this in you gaping mouth immediately. Pretend you can't finish it all (you don't want to seem like a hungry pig even though you actually are) and take the rest home in a box. Get in your apartment door and finish the rest post haste. 

So far, Thai House Express has won me over as my favorite Thai place in SF. Plus, this location is in the TL so if you get a seat by the window you will get a free show as well. I think the show is called "This is why you should avoid drugs in rock form or in needles." Yeah, long show name but you get my point.
author: Liz M.

description:
My favorite Thai restaurant on creation! Every time  I get a chance to go to San Fran, I try to eat here at least twice each trip. Their food is consistent. It tastes the same every time I eat it. It's so tasty and spicy. The service is great and the food comes out quick. It's now open later too. It's clean and decor simple but modern.

What I order if it's a group or just me and a friend (I gotta get it all in!) :  thai ice tea, Tom yum soup, pad Thai, green salmon curry, papaya salad, sometimes larb, beef penang, pineapple fried rice, fried pork, and for dessert, roti with coconut ice cream and fried bananas with vanilla ice cream. To die for!

Beware now, this place is in the tenderloin which means you have to be cautious. At night all the prostitutes and drug dealers come out. Frankly, it's scary! The last time My husband and I went around lunch, after we left the restaurant , there was a robbery with cops all over the streets. It was broad day light lol
author: Loan N.

description:
Great spicy Thai that avoids the cliches of bad Thai food.  Here was my order for two:

Larb with catfish -- aromatic with lots crunch
Chan Pad Poo  -- basically crab pad thai with wonderful mild flavors
Pad Gra-Praw  -- ask for it spicy!
author: Zuttoman Z.

description: I got Pad Thai and vegitable rolls. Rolls were great. Pad Thai was good too. The quantity was more for one person i think. Food wasnt too expensive.
author: Sandeep M.

description:
Truly authentic thai food.  My thai coworker who frequents Thailand recommended this place and it didn't disappoint.  

Definitely try the braised pork leg and the crispy pork skin salad.
author: B K.

description: Although the atmosphere is lacking, the food is fantastic. The Tom yum noodle Soup is off the charts if you like spicy. And the Kai Kai moo is special. We'll definitely be back.
author: Peter U.

description:
Being Thai, lots of people ask me for Thai food recommendations.  In San Francisco, I always recommend Thai House Express.  The food is fast, authentic, delicious, and as spicy as I want it to be.  

I went there last week with my wife, brother, and parents, and Thai House Express delivered again.  We ordered a variety of Thai dishes and the food was out within 5 minutes, even though the restaurant was pretty full.  The Larb Duck salad was the perfect combination of sour, spicy, and salty, and the duck was not too fatty, like at some places.  I didn't have the raw-ish shrimp salad, but my family members enjoyed it.  

We also shared the Yen Ta Fo (Thai red soup) and Duck Noodle soup, which were both delicious.  The red soup is not something you can get at most Thai restaurants, but it's a family favorite.  We also had the basil chicken (my wife's favorite), the basil crispy pork (my favorite) and the Gai Kua noodles (my dad's favorite).  The first two dishes were nice and spicy, just like we asked for it, and exactly what we were looking for.  My dad has never found a better version of those noodles at any other Thai restaurant in the Bay Area. 

The service was great, the food was amazing, and we left with leftovers.  I will not hesitate in continuing to recommend Thai House Express in the future.
author: Pilan C.

description: Tried to order through Eat24.  Estimate was 45-60 minutes.   Finally they showed up after 2 hours and 15 minutes, just as I cancelled the order.  We didn't accept the delivery.   Twice we got updates that it would be there soon or was "on its way" and arrive at a specific time or in a "few minutes" .  I don't mind an occasional late delivery, but clearly we were being deliberately mislead by either the restaurant or Eat24.
author: Plookie P.

description: Very nice Thai food. It had been a while since I tried Thai. Be careful when asking for spicy - they can make it really hot. Good place for families with small kids as well. Staff was friendly.
author: Anwar H.

description: We ordered delivery. We were quoted an hour to hour and ten and it took closer to 2. She did call and tell us she was running late, which was nice of her, but the serving size was disappointing. The to-go container was about 1/4 full. The Pad kee mao was delicious, but the pad see ew was pretty bland. Won't be ordering from here again - seems like it's pretty hit or miss.
author: Michaela S.

description:
Food = 5 stars
Service = 3 stars

I think they need to hire a few more people there...my boyfriend and I went in to pick up our food (we called in our order) and had to wait about 10 minutes just to pay.  Just don't be in a rush if you are going here (we went around 7:30pm on a Saturday night).  

I had the Pad Se-Ew.  AMAZING.  I had it with Chicken and Shrimp.  If I could do it again, I would get just shrimp.

Boyfriend had Pad-Kee-Moa.  He loves spicy food, and he got mild.  And he STILL was sweating and his nose was running from the spiciness.  It was good - want to make sure people know that - but if you don't like spicy food, do not get this dish.

The Thai Iced Tea was pretty darn good too.  Something unique, and my boyfriend and I split it.  Delicious.
author: Emily G.

description: I've been eating thai food for a long time and this place is by far the best in variety, quality and taste! Quick tip...try the spicy crab noodles.
author: Michelle A.

description: Good food! It was actually my first Thai meal. It's kind of sit down, kind of take out.  Not a lot of service, but we got food!
author: Michelle S.

description:
Som tam thai- really was true "Thai" with dried shrimp, not the best grade shrimp, whole tomato rather than cherry, fresh not dried chile. Flavor well balanced, slightly more savory. Impressed the papaya was sliced traditional style (or so it seemed) giving sizes of various girth and texture. 
Thai tea- heavy on the half and half but good for cooling tastebuds
Larb duck (per yelp suggestions) surprisingly lean duck like dark meat chicken without the oiliness. The fresh ingredients were obvious, perfect balance, taste just like in Thailand. If you're not a big duck conniseur, then I'd pass and do your favorite meat instead 
Sticky rice- not as good as ler ros
Roti- crispy sweet greasy goodness 

Atmosphere-trendy
Svc- trendy looking young waitress. Nothing special. Seemed harried. The other waitress seemed sweeter.
author: Sujan P.

description: This place deserves 4.5 stars. Quick & easy. Free delivery with a minimum $20. Tom yum soup with chicken was the best I've had, alittle on the spicy side but 5 stars for that. Pad see ew noodles with chicken was flavorful, alittle on the oily side because it was in a to-go container, but I'm sure if I dined in-house I would have avoided it, 5 stars. The papaya salad was just ok. The price was average.
author: Katie L.

description:
the food here is excellent! I was the first customer in the door at 12:01 :) 

I ordered the PRA RAM rice plate with chicken , mixed vegetables and topped with peanut sauce

service was very quick and the waitress was nice, Im glad I found this  restaurant! I'll definitely be back to try more. Nice little restaurant also very clean.
author: Mr Bolo B.

description: Very good food pleasantly surprised how good everything was! Delivery Fast! The food-Ordered Pumpkin Chicken Curry with Brown Rice I didn't specify what degree of spicy I wanted so it wasn't very spicy and Chicken Pad Thai also very good! Very fresh sprouts accompanied the meal.
author: Andrrs B.

description:
When the Yelp helium tank needs to be refilled, I no longer mind being the one to cart it down to SFParty - since I've discovered Thai House Express, right around the corner.

Thai House Express is quality eats. The atmosphere is low-key, the  service quick, and the food never disappoints.

I highly recommend their pad-thai: delicious, seasoned and sweetened just right. Their pad see yu is true greasy bliss.  And if you still have room at the end of your meal, their mango and sticky rice, of course,  (should mango and sticky rice ever be doubted?) - is on point.

If you have time, check out Thai House Express' menu and scroll through it slowly. You'll have trouble controlling the rumblings of a hungry stomach, but the images in your head of  hot high caliber thai food - will be worth it. 

Tring a book, some friends, and grab a booth near their big windows
author: Jessica T.

description:
Meh.  I don't really see what all the fuss is all about.  Just stopped by tonight based on all the yelp reviews, and have to say that while it was good  for the price, I've had better thai food and was a little disappointed.  

The Highs:
-The service was great!  Server was friendly, my water glass was never empty and they were very quick with the check.  Just about all you could ask for
-Pad See Ew was pretty dern good

The Lows:
-The pad thai was disappointing although I do give them props for having REAL shrimp in their shrimp pad thai as opposed to most restaurants which give you little wimpy shrimps.
-The Thai House Combo appetizer was very overcooked and not tasty at all

Overall:  You could definitely do worse, but this restaurant was about as unimpressionable as they get.  If I lived in the area for a long time I'd probably come back every once in a while but for someone who's trying to explore the city as best I can in three months, I don't really see myself coming back at all.
author: Neil A.

description:
Sketchish neighborhood but quality and value on par.

Pleasant service.
author: Inigo M.

description:
Every 10 days or so, I crave Thai food so badly that I can't function like a normal person until I get some. 

My friend and I came to Thai House Express specifically for the Pad Thai, which was voted the best in town by the Bay Guardian. Although it wasn't the best I've ever had, it was the best I've ever had in San Francisco. I liked that the noodles were drenched in saucy goodness and were nicely separated from the bean sprouts. The bits of egg were oh-so-crisp and mmm-mmm-good. It definitely hit my doughy spot, and I can finally carry on with my life--at least until 10 days from now.

We also had the Pumpkin Curry with rice, which was almost as delectable as the Pad Thai. It had a mild red curry base and sweet chunks of fresh pumpkin. I can't believe I'm going to say this, but I'm really looking forward to eating leftovers tomorrow.

Dinner was only $20--what a steal! I can't wait to try the rest of the menu.
author: Liz T.

description:
WOW WOW WOW

My friend and I ordered the Pad Thai and the Param Pak.  Both were cooked PERFECTLY, and had tons of flavor.  

Sorry Marnee Thai, Thai House has officially taken the top spot for best pad thai in my book!  :X  I am such a cheater...  Worth it though!!  :)

Plus they were spot on with service and refilling water glasses!

I will DEFINITELY be back!!!
author: Jammir G.

description: I love this place so much that I had my birthday dinner here this year. The food is AMAZING! I didn't know what good thai food taste like till I had food from this place. I recommend their Beef noodle soup, pad kee mao, pad prik pao, thai tea ice cream. I am sure everything on their menu is delish! Be careful to order your food in MILD because they can get very spicy. And if you're the type of person that has eaten hot stuff all your life then maybe you can handle their extra spicy, but if you are a beginner just ask them to make the food not spicy.
author: Eva L.

description:
Solid. 

THIS restaurant is a perfect reason to love Yelp.  Arriving late from the east coast, I just wanted a quick bite. When I arrived at 7:30, no one else was in the restaurant.  Typically I would just turn around and leave...but, I trusted my fellow Yelpers.  

House salad was a "kitchen sink" salad (i.e., they throw everything in), topped off with a very tasty dressing.  It was big enough to share as a first course.  (I was a little annoyed that it came at the same time as my entry...but, they both came so quickly it wasn't a big deal).  Pumpkin red curry was delicious.  (A little annoyed they charge extra for rice).  Paired with a glass of red zen = spicy perfection.  

Would definitely go back if I lived in the area.
author: Yolanda S.

description:
I really liked this place! The staff was friendly, the portions were really big too. We had great service so I don't know what other people were talking about... Maybe it was  a good day. 

Anyways we got the spring rolls, pra ram, eggplant beef, and pad thai and everything was really good (I got to try enough of every dish because we were sharing everything). 

I would say this is one of the better thai places I have eaten at in the city so far!
author: Brandon R.

description:
One of my favorite Thai restaurants. Try their green vegetarian curry and their pad see yoo. Both soooo good. The pad see yoo is full of fresh veggies and isn't oily. The green curry is packed full of veggies. Remember to ask for it mild-hot. Because it comes automatically hot. 

Reasonable prices, great food, take out is easy.
author: Katie Anne N.

description:
3.5

After seeing some guy blatantly smoking crack in broad daylight, we knew we were in the Tenderloin. Yay!

Decided to stop here and skipped Osha (we had that last time).

Ordered a la carte duck salad, pumpkin curry with shrimp, tom kha soup with shrimp, and deep fried catfish in plum sauce - - all medium spicy.

Service was friendly, efficient, and fast. Our water was filled within minutes and everyone smiled.

Tom kha soup was delicious. Good balance of coconut and lemon grass. The shrimps were nice and plump. We liked that. Downed that.

Then the pumpkin curry. Pumpkin could have used a few more minutes. It was a tad too tough. I like vegetables soft. The flavor was good with the basil and shrimp. Nice and simple.

The duck salad was my least favorite dish. It tasted too "vinegary" for me, but Ryan seemed to like it. He had seconds.

The deep fried catfish was actually good . . however, the plum sauce was not necessary since it was too strong and sweet. 

We did not order drinks or desserts so the bill was under $40 for 4 dishes. Damn reasonable.

Overall, it was a good Thai experience and we will return if we are in the neighborhood.
author: Betty N.

description:
Best Thai resturant in SF.
I am from Thailand and this is the only place in SF that reserve the authentic Thai taste. wide variety of authentic dishes.

If you wanna try real Thai food, this is the place.
author: Scott B.

description:
First off, Thai House is arguably the best Thai in the city. (FYI, I'll be giving Americanized examples because whether you want to admit it, you love the Pa Ra Kai.) 

-Yellow curry is unparalleled; sauce is more complex then your average spot, and they actually give you a ton of thigh and leg meat as apposed to thinly sliced, tasteless breast meat.
-Chad Pad Poo, or crab Pad Thai, is the best Pad Thai I have ever had.
-Toong Gern, Tom Kha Gai, Pad Kee Mow, Minced chicken and basil, all incredible.
-I could go on but if you aren't convinced by know, move on.

Conci tip: 
Everything can be made spicy as in most places, but if you want the "real deal spicy," you can specify to the person taking the order that you mean business and that's exactly what you'll get.

Side note:
One of the best things that has happened to this place within the last year, is that this location delivers. That and the staff is incredible
author: SF C.

description:
Went here last night after Whiskey Thieves instilled an insatiable appetite for something spicy. 

had the pad-kee-sew, larb, pork leg stew, and something else. Everything was great - but if you don't like cilantro - don't get the larb. 
Another note - if you get 'thai spicy', make sure you have at least 1 thai-iced tea to ease the burn. Unless, of course, you are insane, :).
author: David N.

description:
I use to go to T.H.E a lot but now it is not quite as good as it use to be. I went about 2 or 3 months or so ago with my family and the Pork Leg Stew was very good but the sauce was not even close to the quality it use to be. I am not sure we will be going back since we live so far away. 

They also stopped serving the palm juice I love so much. 
My guess is new owners. New faces.

Still worth a try if you live in SF City area.
author: Tony T.

description:
The food are very tasty but very heavy on MSG.
I was very thirsty all night after dinner. Drank 3 glasses of water and can not sleep well getting headache the next day. MGS in food is not good for me.
If you are not sensitive of MSG that will be ok.
author: Garbo C.

description:
This ain't your Americanized Thai restaurant!!!  This is authentic as it gets in the states.  I am soooooooooo glad I decided to come here last minute for take-out because I will definitely be coming back.

I asked the waitress which non-beef appetizer she recommended and she suggested the Por-Pier Sod (fresh rice paper rolls stuffed with Chinese sausage, egg, tofu, cucumber; topped with crab meat and sweet and sour tamarind sauce).  This was EXCELLENT.  The rice paper had the perfect texture...not too flimsy or too hard from being undercooked.  I was initially hesitant on the tamarind sauce but it was light and sweet--usually it's too sour.  I definitely recommend that you get this.

Beef Noodle Soup (noodle soup with sliced beef, beef balls, beef strew & tripe) - This was ok.  I probably wouldn't order it again.  The bf thinks there might be some MSG in it.  With noodle soups, you can get them with flat rice noodles, rice stick noodles, vermicelli or egg noodles.  I got flat rice noodles for both this and the dish below and they were great.

Tom Yum Noodle Soup (hot spicy noodle soup with ground pork, slice pork, pork balls and peanuts) - If you are pretty good with spiciness, GET THIS IN MEDIUM.  This was my favorite dish out of all the ones we ordered.  It has such a deep and rich flavor.  And the peanuts and cilantro make the noodles smell so fragrant.  I'm normally not a fan of anything tom yum but this has changed me forever.

Kao Ka Moo (special pork leg stew over rice) - Very similar to my dad's Chinese style pork feet dish!!  The only difference is that incredibly spicy chili sauce that comes on the side.  Use the sauce but do NOT eat the chilis--my mouth was burning for 5 minutes straight and I almost cried when I realized I had no milk in my fridge.  This is a huge portion--lots of pork and lots of rice--so be hungry.  It comes with a side of pickled veggies.

Thai House Beef (marinated beef broiled to order; served with chef's secret sauce) - The "secret sauce" is actually cilantro based and almost belongs in a Mexican restaurant.  It does go well with it.  The beef was tender and I'm thinking it would've tasted better in the restaurant; our 30 minute drive home probably dried it out a little.

Ordering and getting take-out only took about 15 minutes total!  That's what I call quick service.  The total for 5 dishes was about $40.  I'm so glad there's a Thai restaurant with more than your typical Pad Thai and Thai Basil dishes.  Everything comes in really cute lunch type, plastic take-out boxes.  I think that's what this is meant to be... fast Thai food.  If I worked in the area, I would eat here all the time!
author: Shannon L.

description: Really awesome food! It was amazing! Tasty and fresh :) price are very good. Around 12$ for main course. Service was also good. One thing that could be better are interiors. Still you feel like in a fast food bar to much.
author: Bartosz R.

description:
One of the BEST Thai Restaurants in SF. Must try at least once. 

I've never been displeased with their food. They give decent service but they are always busy too.
author: Kissy F.

description: I don't know why it's so impossible to get good Thai food in San Francisco. House of Thai had halfway decent pad thai, but the other rice/chicken dish we got was bland. The portions were too small for the price. Most of the pad thai was bean sprouts rather than noodles.
author: Jen R.

description:
They have a pretty large selection of menu items here. Everything taste authentic and full of flavor. The food served here is on par with the meals I've had at restaurants in Thai Town (Hollywood), the North Hollywood Buddhist Temple and from my Thai roommates cooking.

Wish they stayed open later on the weekends for after hours when the clubs close. Only thing available is street parking, so street sweeping has a lot to do with no late after hours. Finding parking during regular hours is also a challenge.
author: Vince V.

description:
I'm surprised I have't written a review for this place yet! Thai House has the BEST thai food I've tasted in the city. They are open till midnight so it's a great place to hit up for those late night cravings! 

I found out about this place from a former coworker when we came here for late dinner after a meeting, and man where have this place been all my life?! All those money wasted eating at King of Thai for generic, bland, bad service restaurant. Thai House offers authentic Thai spice. This place is a bit more expensive compared to other Thai restaurants, but you will soon find it's well worth the extra penny because it will show in the quality of food that you're being served.  

Every time I come here I am never disappointed by their food! Their Pad-Kee-Moa is SOOO delicious! You can choose from beef,pork, or chicken; and the spiciness from mild-spicy! I always order medium spicy and is the right amount of spiciness for me, my boyfriend said he can move onto the next level to spicy next time. HAHA no thanks for me, i'll be chucking ice water like a fish after 1 bite!! I'll stick with good ol' medium spiciness. I always get their curry because i've never had good tasting curry anywhere else! 

I highly recommended giving this place a try if you haven't already!!! bewared of the weekends though, it gets busy during dinner time and they are a bit short staff! aside from slower services you will not get rip off of the quality of food because of its busyness like other places do.
author: Jenny G.

description:
a. So good.  

b. Spicy means spicy ya'll.  

c. Delivery is raging fast.  And I mean that literally - the delivery guy damn near ding dong ditches as he drops off your food and proceeds to run away from your door.  Portions to-go may seem smaller, but I don't know if that's been scientifically proven yet.

I always order something and perpetually forget what it's called - or, since we're talking Xpress here, numbered - so I've come to the point where I just ask for/exclaim "those noodles with squid.  And spicy too, please!"  Everything is good.  The pad thai, beers, and sakai are standard.  A soup which I only had once was deceptive - it was much spicer than I realized.  What a little bitch.  And just one more time for good measure: the word spicy.

Also, the bathroom is upstairs and accessible with a big ass key (er, the accessory is big assed.  The size of the key is the uge), which I think is kind of rad.  If I had a restaurant I would consider making patrons haul a hunkin' awkward thing attached to the key to use the restroom.  Like in Secretary when she walked around chained to that pole. Except not really.
author: Keeks K.

description:
One of my favorite Thai restaurants in the city.

Everyone should give this place a shot, pretty authentic place.

They Deliver, and they are fast, yummy chicken in the curry, Great pad thai, and good rice portions!!
author: ThuZ W.

description:
That's what I'm talking about!
Straight to the food, and because I don't understand any Thai, I will have to just tell you the white cracker interpretation of it all!

Papaya Salad- Very nice flavor, and just the perfect amount of spiciness. Highly recommended.

Squid Salad- My GF really liked this one a lot. This one is not very spicy, but is pretty enjoyable if you are a squid fan.

Beef with Tofu and Noodles- VERY tasty! This is the type of dish you can find in a lot of Asian restaurants, but these guys really do this one well. Excellent flavor and texture.

Green Curry- This is what it's all about, baby! I'm a huge curry fan, and they know what they're doing in this department! Will the flavor be something you've never tasted before? Probably not, but it's freakin good and surprisingly filling!

Also the drinks here are pretty good! I will say that their Mojitos don't actually taste like Mojitos, but who cares?! They are really good, and ultimately that's what you're really after.

We had a Thai lad as our server, who was extremely nice and gave us great service. Really, no complaints in the service department- only good things to say.

My biggest criticism about this place is that it is in a really sketchy part of the Tender Loin. I hang out in the Loin all the time, but you should park as close to the place as you can, as some of the surrounding streets (like Ellis) have you really watching your back, and wishing you brought a fake wallet. 

Anyway, this review is about food, which they do very well. Enjoy!
author: Mike M.

description:
If you want aurhentic, i mean real bangkok food shop no further! I have also searched everywhere up and down so cal and no cal for po pia sod (fresh spring roll with good wrapper and chinese sausage with real thai sauce) now im in heaven. Also must try noodles kwaew tiew koo gai, pad see ew, all their noodle are sooooo soooo good i dream of my next grubhub order on thursday nights - no cooking thurs and sunday nights! For those of you frim thailand this place is as good as anna cafe, central chidlom and emporium food courts! Too bad the price isnt cheap like in bkk.

Only thing missinf from this place is kwaew tiew buh mee with ped ( dry yellow noodles with duck) like on the streets of bkk
author: Diana S.

description:
My visit to San Fran always includes a trip to this place!
Love the panang curry.  Tried their several noodle dishes and they were all excellent!
Thai Fried rice is excellent as well.  
Can't wait til my next visit!
author: Dana L.

description: The food at this resturant was fantastic.  The Tom kha soup was excellent and my main dish chicken Pad Prik King was great.  The atmosphere in resturant is nice a little generic but, never less food is great.  Service was good.
author: Dean M.

description: Favorite Thai in the city. They are friendly, the veggies always taste fresh, and I've never had a bad meal. My favorites are the pumpkin curry and the pineapple fried rice :)
author: Lark M.

description:
I wish Yelp had an option to review the food and service separately for restaurants because Thai House is honestly some of the best thai food I get in the city, but the service suuuucks!
I work literally two doors down from them and my boss and the rest of my coworkers go in there at least 4 times a week (literally, my boss goes in everyday). They continually never remember us... well, I'm sure they remember us but never acknowledge us. It's strange, but I suppose the food is good enough for us to keep going back.
author: Tova L.

description:
Thai House Express is one of my favorite Thai restaruants in SF city.
l came here again after a while the prices are good the service is fast 
and the food was really good!
author: Mary P.

description:
We tried the fried chive cake. It was a bit doughy.  The secret sauce tasted like soy sauce with Worcestershire sauce with a tad of sugar.

Tom Yum Soup with vermicelli noodles was good. $8.00/ #66 on the menu. 

Service was minimal but attentive and pleasant. 

Prices were reasonable. Open Kitchen. Will be back if I am ever in the area. The menu is a little overwhelming but come here in a big group so you can try everything.
author: Jboogie L.

description: Price is reasonable, I ordered green curry here, curry is fairly ok but the rice is too soft
author: Xing L.

description: really really tasty. spicy in the right places. good ambience for kids. good mango sticky rice
author: Jon M.

description: Got a recommendation from a Thai friend to try this place and it was excellent.  I've always done take out but the ambiance is nice, clean and welcoming.  The papaya salad is a good starter, can't go wrong with their curries and their noodle dishes are cooked to perfection.  They have a big space too so it would be a good spot for big parties.  Enjoy!
author: Bobbi R.

description:
Excellent Thai, authentic flavors, some of the best I've had. Definitely can't get this in my neck of the woods. Mouth numbing spicy. Made me sweat despite the air conditioned room. Deafening noise level. Modern decor. Had to shout to make myself understood. Fair service, had to be reminded on forgotten items. Needed to be hailed to get service.

Better to eat here on off times or for take out given the harried service and stadium like noise level.
author: G N.

description: Was looking for a quick bite in a neighborhood I don't frequent and was pleasantly surprised. Pad Thai (I swapped shrimp for chicken) was sweet and flavorful. Service was quick but not curt. Recommended!
author: Rich B.

description:
I'm surprised this place was so good!!!

seriously! it looked like any other random thai restaurant that are so darn abundant in this part of town. figured i'd give it a shot, and SURPRISE! it was delicious! nice! 

well, at least the green curry and duck salad were good. actually, GREAT. they were flavorful with the right amount of lime, spice. really... really DUCK SALAD.

i haven't tried the tomkha yet though. that's kind of my make-it or break-it with thai restaurants. if they can make a good tomkha, you're pretty solid. 

plus, i heard lots of fob thai talkers in there. place has to be right for all those ppl to eat there. cuz for sure they're not going to pay money to eat at a crappy place serving their own country's foods.
author: Yui K.

description:
I have wanted to jump into this spot down the block from my house for a few months now and today I got a chance to try them for lunch.  

They certainly have the "express" part down because they had us in our seats with fresh waters and drinks in under 30 seconds. 

I live and die by Pumpkin curry so of course I was gonna have it my first time out. It was on par with some of the best i have had and the chicken to gourd ratio was in good balance.   The wonton appetizer was perfect and I loved the sweet chili sauce they throw it down with.  The waitress kept on top of my glass and kept it to the rim with the awesome ice tea they serve.  

My date had a bowl of something scary that included squid balls(didn't know they had them), fish balls (ditto) and a flower looking flesh pile that was apparently tripe.  I will not include how scary that dish looked in my rating as I am sure that someone, somewhere would be happy with it. 

The food's  presentation was attractive enough to garner the interest of a homeless man that pressed his runny nose against the glass staring until I engaged him with my death look.  

You know the look, the one that screams " touch my pumpkins and you are gonna draw back a stump."
author: Dru P.

description: Don't hesitate... it's surprising you are even looking at reviews.  Unbelievable prices, unbelievably delicious food.  Great service.  Enjoy it.  Remember my rec that told you to STOP READING AND JUST GO NOW.. =)
author: Uncle Fishbits Aeneas X.

description:
This place gets four stars only because of it's location. Everything else about it is 5-star for sure.

I have be scouring the reviews to find a great Thai place in SF. I've been to Basil Thai and Lers ros and they were certainly mediocre and over-priced. The reviews everywhere have been pretty mediocre, so my husband and I have been on the hunt for the best thai in town.

We chose to order take-out (or try) from House of Thai last friday and their take-out wait was an hour and a half! I'm not complaining, this only solidified that this was the thai gem we were looking for. So we went on Saturday night, and were seated right away. This restaurant is much larger than I would have expected. The staff was attentive and everything came out quickly. I ordered pad thai spicy and my husband ordered pad se ew. The spice was excellent on both. Their thai iced tea was perfect. I LOVE this place! Will definitely go back.

Transit tip: you can take the 19 bus and it drops you right in front so you don't have to walk too much in the Tender...unless you want to of course, it's always interesting.
author: Jessica R.

description:
So, seeing that I've been adopted in a Lao family (via the bf) who have grown up around legit Thai restaurants, I too have become picky when it comes to Thai food. 

And although I have yet to dine inside this restaurant, I have eaten their food via delivery which is WAYYY more awesome than so many other places I've eaten at inside! How can this be? Delivery that is actually good? You must know this is a rareity. 

Not only was it flavorful and delicious, but the portions were HUGE! The Pad Thai and Marinated Beef dishes the bf and I ordered were so big that we had much leftovers for the next day. The Thai Iced Tea was also a perfect blend of syrup and half&half - not too much cream like so many other joints do it.

So I say, not only eat inside but try their delivery if you can.
author: Tay R.

description: Not going there ever again and strongly recommend you to choose somewhere else for thai food. TERRIBLE food and customer service. One time the lady on a phone hanged up in a middle of our conversation by saying SHUT UP. I understand that most of them barely speak english, but dont give such an attitude to customers. The other time we went there for dinner, a waitress yelled at me for a order that I made, even though she was the one who took a wrong order. Food used to be good but it gets smaller and smaller portion, a la carte dish we ordered was half open in the container for full price. their food is no loner worth of your money. Food is burned badly, no sauce, always way to spicy.  Overall this place is not worth of anyone's money and time. If you would like to have delicious thai food with appropriate, mannered serving, go somewhere else.
author: Guo L.

description: I'm not the biggest thai food fan, but this place has some delicious thai. Is it hot as hell in the restaurant? Yes. Is it dirty? Maybe a little, but you're in the tenderloin, so what really isn't? The prices were a little steep, but the food was good. The service was meh, it seems like they forget about you after you get some food. Overall, a decent experience at a convenient location.
author: Clinton J.

description:
We had 3 items for lunch and all came out pretty damn good (imho). It's the next best thing to being in LA thai town and Thailand.

Rad-na : 4 stars, aaahh..yes..I just luv the burned noodle flavour and well blanched kai-lan with generous gravy.

Tom-Yum noodle (spicy) : 4 stars, sweet, hot, sour, spicy, fragrant, all in one tasting.

Kao-soy :perfectly spiced in yellow curry with nice and rich aroma. (I had this in northern thailand and it's like the real deal)

All the flavours are simply good and unusually authentic. Hope they continue this way. Forget the neighborhood atmosphere/locale, if you are a real foodie and simply want good thai eats, this place is it.
author: Borneo M.

description:
It's has become my staple go-to for late-night eat-in or delivery. I must say, we've primarily ordered the same 2 to 3 dishes all the time and it is fail safe, so I am sure that the rest of the menu is pretty fair and tasty.

Chan Pad Poo (Rice stick noodles with generous Dungeness crab meat, egg, green onion and fresh chili) and Moo Tod a la carte (yummy crispy garlic-cilantro marinated pork, served with house-sweet & sour sauce) are my faves and most dishes are $10 or less. Hits the spot every time.
author: Basil B.

description: I really like it! I ate the pineapple fried rice with shrimp :D but it is more like chinese than thai food
author: Jessica B.

description: This is the reason why I got addicted to Thai cuisine.  It was in 2010 when I found this restaurant.  Unfortunately, they no longer have the Mixed Seafood Special on their  menu.  Btw, my fiancee loves this place, too.   It's one of the places that we frequently visit during lunch hour.  The servers are attentive and friendly. Well, I think they already knew us.  ;-)
author: Kit P.

description: I mistakenly ordered delivery here thinking it was the same place I ordered from before...  Portions of the Pad Thai and Fresh spring rolls were like lunch portions, but we ordered last night while watching the Warriors beat the Spurs... The fresh spring rolls were pretty tasteless and Pad Thai was just ok.  But I do have to say the delivery time was surprisingly fast.
author: Myra M.

description: I used to love this place. The food is amazingly good and reasonably priced, plus it's super close to my house. Unfortunately, after the second time that I found a large roach in my food (the fact that I went back after the first time says something about how good the food is) I had to swear off.
author: Lynn B.

description:
The food was good - fresh, tasty, not greasy.  I enjoyed it.  But the service was the worst I've ever experienced.  I was left waiting at the hostess counter while the staff giggled and chatted.  When I asked to see the specials menu I was told "we don't serve specials for carry out.  Go sit down."  When I asked what was in the fish cakes, I was told "fish."   And on and on. 
I have never stiffed a server, until today.
